text:
Bottle. Really great porter. About like Rasputin Russian imperial. Nice light chocolate taste. Very smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Revisiting this beautiful classic, I think it gets better with the years! 
Pours dark brown going-to-black, medium beige head, not much lacing. Aroma is strong caramel and roasted malts, with notes of yeast sweetness. Taste of medium sweet dark roasted malts and chocolate, with low bitter hops to balance. Medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, lingering after taste. Awesome!

F: thin, tanned, quick gone to thin film.
C: dark brown with ruby hue against the light, clear.
A: malty, a lot of cocoa, coffee, chocolate, molasses, dark caramel.
T: malty, coffee, cocoa, chocolate, mineral, tobacco, brown sugar, dark fruits, dry on the palate, archetype for the style, enjoyed, 0,5l bottle from Sainsburys supermarket, Camden, London.

lekker potje,halve liter fles,bier naar een dag hard werken; geurend naar koffie en choco en net zo kleur, proef de volle en romige smaak van koffie en choco mouten en aarde tinten van de hop allen er verkoelend

Deep brown colour with a frothy/creamy head. Rich flavours of chocolate and malt, and a pleasant sweetness on the finish. A delicious beer all around!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(500 ml bottle) Pours a deep ruby beer, practically black, with fine carbonation, and a creamy off-white head. The aroma is laden with coffee, chocolate, and tanned leather - an immediate archetype of the London porter style. This is followed by hints of raisin, toffee, tobacco smoke and mineral water; then pine, oak, vanilla and earth towards the finish. The mouthfeel is medium-light, smooth and silky on the palate, and slightly effervescent.

This is a smooth, well-blended porter - just what youd expect from a classic Fullers brew.

Pours very dark brown with a decent beer tan head. Aroma is malty and coffee. Taste is slightly sweet with notes of coffee, dark chocolate, strawberries, and a hint of burnt toast. Its full bodied with low-medium carbonation and a velvety mouthfeel. I cant believe Ive never had this before!!! Delicious!
Deep, roasted smell. Good amount of lovely off-white head. Complex, heavy taste.

Barwa ciemnobrązowa, prawie nieprzenikniona, pod światło rubinowe przebłyski.

Piana obfita, wysoka na dwa palce, drobnopęcherzykowa z nielicznymi średnimi pęcherzami, koloru écru. Po paru minutach redukuje się do cienkiego kożucha, po następnych paru minutach znika całkowicie. Lacing niski.

Aromat gorzkiej czekolady, kawowy, w tle nuty palone.

Smak lekko kwaskowy, czekoladowy, kakaowy, kawowy, palony. Na finiszu kawowa goryczka.
Tak jak zauważyli przedmówcy to piwo to bardziej Stout, a nie Porter.
Warka 01.10.2016

Botella de 99Cervezas.

De color castaño-rojizo oscuro y brillante, con formación de espuma media y baja persistencia.

De intensidad media-alta en nariz, da notas ahumadas, de chocolate negro y de café. También notas cítricas, con algo de cáscara de naranja y un punto herbal ligero. Transmite una sensación ligeramente alcohólica, como de licor de café suave.

Entre los gustos básicos destaca el amargo, muy marcado y algo astringente, acompañados de un fondo ligero dulce y unas notas suaves de salado y acidez.

De cuerpo medio y textura chispeante y sedosa. Buena persistencia en boca, donde se realza el amargor con notas intensas de café negro.

Achetée au Hyper U de Sierentz. Bière très sombre avec une mousse beige. Nez de chocolat et café. Bouche douce, on retrouve le chocolat. Pas trop damertume mais il lui manque un peu de rondeur peut être dû au taux dalcool peu élevé de 5.4%. Très bonne bière dans lensemble.

Aroma - pleasant, intense and very suit to its style: coffee and black chocolate, roasted malt and burnt black bread crust. Taste is very pleasant, starts with intense notes of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate, then continues with a pleasant and slightly burnt bitterness, and finishes with black and sweet fruits with some alcohol and pleasant and intense burnt, which diminishes in the aftertaste. Very good and tasteful! Porters standard.

Appearance: black, clear, tan foam, rocky head, disappears fast. Aroma: bread, malt, roasty, caramel, cereal. Taste: light sweetness, medium sourness, medium bitterness. Palate: light body, thin feel, thin feel, oily feel, soft carbonation, light bitter aftertaste.

Bottle @Queens Head, Brook Green, London.
Small off-white head, dark brown colour, clear.
Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, really nice. Lightly bitter taste, medium body, long finish, soft carbonation. Wow, pretty good!

Piwo lekko metne w ciemno brazowym kolorze nalewa sie z dosc obfita sredniopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie niezbyt intensywnie, troche czekolady i kawy. W smaku wiecej karmelu i palonosci. Malo intensywny i niezbyt bogate. Lekko palona gpryczka i wysycenie n srednim poziomie. Dobrze ukryty alkohol ale poza tym to troche za przecietnie jak dla mnie.

Une bière plutôt brunâtre tirant sur le noir, avec une fine ligne de carbonatation. Au nez, cest plutôt torréfié, avec une touche de chocolat noir et, jhallucine peut-être, mais des notes plutôt fumées également. En bouche, je ne rêve définitivement pas. Les notes fumées, on les remarquent dès le départ, avec un peu de torréfaction qui fait son uvre également. Le chocolat noir est également plutôt présent, procurant une réelle profondeur à ce Porter. Le côté sefface avec les gorgées, pour faire plus de place au chocolat. Cest bien agréable.
Black porter with tan head. Chocolate, coffee and malt aromas. Light acidity.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Intense dark brown color with yellowish head, a bit short. Roasty aromas, mainly coffee and caramel. Also some yeasty notes. Fine bitterness and medium body. In my opinion too light mouthfeel for a Porter. Not bad but very soft Porter
A well balance but interesting porter. Lots of coffee and chocolate notes.

Rubīna melnums krāsā, dzidrs, ar nelielām putām. Smarā jūtams dūmains grauzdējums, auksta kafija, kaut kas no tumās okolādes. Tas pats sajūtams arī garā, bet grauzdējumam pievienojas arī kaut kas no riekstiem, plus vēl tumās okolādes gara un aukstas kafijas atblāzma. Ķermenis diezgan viegls, ļoti dzerams alus.
Smells and tastes of roasted coffee beans rich texture but little complexity. Slight moderate bitterness in the finish.
Bottle - Pours black, creamy tan head. Dark roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, nuts, hops, dry. Creamy mouth-feel. Cest bon.
Moje první zkuenost s anglickým porterem, který byl doopravdy výborný :) Dal bych si ho zase.

Ive been searching for this beer for years, from back when porter was my favorite style and Id just found ratebeer. London Pride was easy to find, but bottles of this were never around anywhere in Seattle. It went on draft one time at Bottleworks, but keg blew before I got there. I saw it on draft once in 2014 on a trip to Iowa, but I ended up drinking Toppling Goliath and a Wine Barrel Noir instead, foolishly figuring itd be easy to find in the midwest when visiting family.
 Never saw it on draft again. Or in bottles. So imagine my surprise and delight when I stumbled across this 4-pack at the Party Source. Your days of eluding me have come to an end, Mr. London Porter. 
Dark brown pour with khaki head of moderate duration that dissipates to a ring. For lack of a better description, this is sort of what I imagine from an Old World porter -- less aggressive on the roast bitterness side than my American favorites, but with a richer malt profile. Caramel, toffee, bread, creamy milk chocolate, hints of dark fruit. These flavors come in waves, finishing with a light roast bitterness of short duration, followed by lasting chocolate. Medium- body; slick texture, average carbonation. Overall: this is bottle 3 out of 4. The first bottle I opened warm as soon as I walked through the door and was a bit disappointed. But the last two bottles have impressed me more and more. Well-deserved reputation. Hope it doesnt take me another 5 years to come across this one again.

Bottled. Pours deep brown colur with quickly disappearing beige head. Coffee, cocoa and roasted notes in aroma. Basically it has the same notes in aroma, combined with slight smoky/woody notes. It finishes with moderate bitterness and with warming some very slight alcoholic notes also appear. Softly carbonated and medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel. Nice one.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 bottle. looks cool, but foam goes quickly. taste is dark chocolate, roasted malts and slightly nutty. medium bodied. easy to drink for a porter.
Very very nice but not as stellar as others suggest. Strong yeasty smell, loads of chocolatey malts in the taste. Would prefer a bit more depth or unique notes but still very good.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Lovely chocolate and coffee malt aroma. Medium sweet sweetness. Lovely creamy mouthfeel. Nice bitter finish. A truly delicious beverage. Great value for money too.

The beer pours ruby-black with a nice, beige head. The aroma is not very intense, there are typical porter flavours - chocolate and roasted malts. The taste is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and medium bitterness which is quite hoppy, herbal. The beer does not have much body, but it is smooth on the palate. There is no expectation of an avalanche of sensory sensations here; it is simply a very well-done, classic English porter.

Pours a deep brown with a medium, foamy, beige head. The aroma is on the subtle side, but its pleasing. Coffee and roasted malts on top, with lesser amounts of chocolate and bread. The taste has some bitterness to it, with just a hint of sweetness. Its very similar to the nose both in the impressions and their strengths. That being said, everything is mild yet pleasing. I find more chocolate and roasted malt, and coffee, bread, and nuts being complimentary. Long, light chocolate aftertaste. Light in body, thin in texture, and soft carbonation. It is very easy to drink. Id have no problem buying this one again.
Smooth in the mouth. Low carbonation. Nice lacing. cheeries plums, roast and Coffee in the taste. Classic porter.

Donkerbruin, iets lichtdoorlatend, crèmekleurige schuimkraag, niet veel koolzuur te zien, vrij helder.
Aroma: Zacht geroosterd, koffie, Chocolade, broodachtig en geroostetde mouten.
Smaak: Geroosterde mouten, mokka, melkchocolade, koffie met een lekkere lange nasmaak. Vol moutig en lekker gehopt.... spicy Fuggles bittere Engelse hop. Deze porter heeft ook echt een klassieke smaak. Mooi in balans, lekker robuust maar ook weer zacht met een lange roasty smaak.
Medium body, zacht en rustig mondgevoel, afdronk is roasty, bitter en iets droog.
Topper!

Bottle, 0.5 l. Pours dark brown, with a nice beige head. Aroma is smooth, not so in-your-face. Roasted coffee beans, roasted malts, a bit of dark chocolate. Some ash also. Enjoyable stuff. Medium oily mouthfeel. Flavor follows the nose. But more complex stuff emerges: Caramel, vanilla, dark bread. Dry and bitter finish. Great classic!

0,5l bottle. Thick very dark colour with creamy and stiff medium lasting tan head. Aroma: Caramel, milk chocolate, roasted bread with vanilla and cheese notes. Taste: Huge malty start but suddenly an overwhelming bitter taste comes and gets stronger (but stays pleasent) by time in the mouthfeel. Has a light spicey (black pepper, nutmeg) tone too with a creamy texture. The alcohol % is low but this beer has a medium/full body with a gentle and soft carbonation. Long bitter/dry finish in the end. A robust and quite bitter porter. Great one.
Väldigt god porter. Visserligen är det nyligen jag "lärde" mig njuta av porter. :-) Satt fint som avrundning efter att tidigare på kvällen ätit räkor med gumman.

Aroma: burnt malt, chocolate, coffee.
Appearance: black with small brown head.
Tate: burnt malt with chocolate.
Palate: light body, medium carbonation.
Deep Dark - Looks really good in glass. Inexpressive taste - I expect something more.
It is highly drinkable, light medium sweetness, semi-creamy coffee chocolate. Very smooth and balanced.

Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma is of dark chocolate and coffee. Taste follows the nose. As I let it sit it lost the coffee smell and taste. This caused the beer to be better if think. Overall a really good porter.
Tap @ Savory Grain. Dark with minimal head. Smells like dark bread and some roastiness. Flavor is dark coffee with a hint of sweetness. Fuller bodied than I expected.

500 ml can. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of coffee and plum with faint notes of chocolate, dried fruit and caramel. Taste is pretty sweet, very low bitterness; with flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel.

0.33l bottle. Malty aroma, caramel, rosted malts, coffee, dark chocolate. Dark, almost black color, beige head. Malty taste, same as aroma, light sweet, medium bitter. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation and dry malty bitter-sweet finish. Excelent.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours a very dark brown to pitch black with a tiny tan head and an aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, black coffee and wet earth. Very nice!
Szép fekete szín. Krémes hab. Étcsokoládés, pörkölt malátás, kávés illat. Mindez az ízében is visszaköszön. Parádés egy ital.
0,5l bottle. Dark amber color with small beige head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts and light liquorice, Very drinkable.

500 ml bottle. Deep dark almost black brew. 2 finger thick creamy tan head. Flat carbonation. Aroma is bitter chocolate, roasted malts, instant coffee, nuts. Flavour is bitter chocolate, walnut, roasted malts. Dry bitter roasty finish. Overrated.
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer
Rich dark roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, light sweet but dry finish, mild alcohol. Great porter.
Draft at Blatt. Pours black, tan head. Aroma was roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Taste was coffee, roasted malt, cocoa. Creamy mouthfeel. Not as rich as I was expecting.

"Best before: 15 Oct 16" on the back of the 11.2floz bottle. So yeah, this beer is a bit past its prime. Purchased a few of these as singles for a discount price in the St. Louis, MO area. Ive had this beer numerous times before and consider it a classic (bottle and draft). Consumed 01.17.2017. For a $1 a bottle, its totally worth it despite being old. Lets start with the appearance in an imperial nonic glass; its a dark-brown with chestnut hues when held to the light and has a light amount of head. Smells like a quality porter, on point to the style -- bready, sweet, moderately roasty. Goes down smoothly, lighlty bitter, decent carbonation, and has clean finish with a hint of sweetness. Pumpernickel bread best sums the flavor. When fresher, my score would likely be a 4.5 or so.

Nästan svart med ljusbrunt skum. I doften finns mörk choklad och aningen kaffe. Smaken har mer av kaffet och dessutom finns det lite lakrits i eftersmaken. En lätt porter som dessutom är lättdrucken, en riktigt klassiker.

From 330ml bottle (is this the smaller version for export?). Pours dark brown, almost black with a nice tan head which fades to lacing. The aroma is chocolate and this carries through to the taste. Sweet rather than bitter. Bit of vanilla in there? Smooth and easy to drink. a winner from Fullers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

W zapachu pierwsze skojarzenie, piernik, Marcepan. Ciepło. Później jednak zwycięża kawa i karmel  palony. Piana. Czy ktoś na nią zwraca uwagę w tym stylu? Nieregularna, krótkotrwała. Do końca jednak pozostał krąg na obwodzie szkła.
W smaku jest ok. Pewnie to sugestia ale jawi mi się jako wzorzec. Taki prostolinijny. Ani go zganić, ani pochwalić. Dobrze nasycony i zrównoważony. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, Ale 5,4%, co tu jest do ukrycia? Skojarzyło mi się z ciastem do pizzy. W tym sensie, że ciasto to podstawa, ale jak je udekorujemy to już inna kwestia.
Butelka 0,5l. W aromacie palone słody i czekolada.W smaku suszone ciemne owoce ,czekolada w tle trochę kawy.Finisz gorzki ,palony ale nie zalegający. Dobry przedstawiciel stylu.

Bottle. Black with a hint of brown. Nice creamy head. Aroma and taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee and roasted malts. Long lasting aftertaste full of chocolate and just the right amount of slightly fruity hops. Creamy and smooth mouthfeel. Minimal carbonation. Very balanced and well made. Delicious. This was the first Porter I ever had and to me its still the benchmark of the style. One of my alltime favourites.

Bottle 11.2 fl.oz. Noire à quelques reflets. Nez intense de café, chocolat, caramel, noisettes. Bouche un peu surette où dominent le café, le chocolat, lamertume, le rôti/torréfié. Jaime mais pas autant que lensemble des "rater" !

Bottle from sister. Brought from London. Pours a dark ruby brown. Nose of caramel and coffee. Dark roast coffee taste with high cocoa chocolate following and a toasted malt. It has a soft body with gentle carbonation. This is a rich, smoothly bitter porter with plenty roast flavours adding warmth and depth.

0.5 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with lovely Anja. Clear dark brown to black with red tint, creamy small to medium off-white to beige head. Roasty and coffee aromas, malts, light fruity, light metallic. Very nice and round, medium body, roasty and dry. Carbonation a bit high. Finish is strong and lasting, roasty turning to dark chocolate. Quite good for a right price!

0,5 l bottle. Pours dark red brown with a finger of tan quickly dissipating head. Aroma is big cocoa, malt and a bit of fuggle hops woodiness, slight roasted malt aroma. Flavor is similar, cocoa with roasty notes, some berries, coffee. Taste is light sweet with mild bitterness that lingers on the back of tongue. Body is light with thin texture and average carbonation. Very pleasant, quite complex and well rounded beer.

Colore marrone scuro, quasi nero con riflessi mogano. La schiuma è beige a trama fine cremosa ed abbastanza persostente. Al naso è essenziale, pulita ed elegante con le sue note di caffè cioccolato amaro e tostature. In bocca offre le stesse sensazioni con un finale amaro ed un retrogusto di caffè, cioccolato amaro e cenere.
Birra semplice, elegante e buonissima.
Gout prononcé qui laisse transpirer les arömes sans laisser de gout dalcool en bouche. Jaime bien

Light roasted. Good light body no presence of the alcohol.
Very drinkable. :)
Bottle into a shaker. Aroma of chocolate malts. Tastes nicely balanced between sweet and bitter.

500 ml bottle
dark brown to black, tan foam, 
slight citrus aroma, followed by roasty, cereal and a little coffee aromatics
light body, soft carbonation, short lightly metallic finish

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark red-brown to black with a light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt with coffee, lightly smoky and some sweet aromas. Medium watery body with a low to average carbonation. The taste is again malty with coffee along with some faint fresh fruity notes (apples and pears).
Black with light brown head - Raosted malt aroma - Roasted malt body with some bitterness from the roasted malt - The roasted malt with bitterness goes into the finish - This was nice

Zapach średnio intensywny, czekolada, karmel, suszone owoce. Kolor ciemnobrunatny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, czekolada, suszone owoce, karmel, lekka paloność, kawa. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.
Cool, cheap, interesting porter. Like it. Its not anything amazing but something to go back to....

bottle from beer rep....poured dark brown near black...big creamy head....nose is chocolatey malt...mouth is creamy chocolate with a little coffee maybe some anise and a splash of berries....light bitterness on the finish...one of the best porters i have tried...really nice....wish i had another!

Porter de 5,4 % abv et 33 ebu, en format 50 cl.
Décrit par son brasseur comme "rich, dark and complex", on ne demande quà le croire  et à vérifier !!
Mon exemplaire avait fait un peu de stage en cave, pendant 15 mois en plus que sa date.
Couleur noir marron intense, à lopacité forte.
Mousse brun moyen, à fins flocons, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de chocolat, café, châtaignes, noisettes, pointe de ganache fine.
1ère bouche souple, soyeuse, à la très belle entame malt torréfié/café/chocolat noir.
Arrière-bouche longue, pleine, complexe, avec un feu de camp au loin.
2ème à la belle texture, une grande élégance et un bel équilibre.
Arrière-bouche dense en saveurs, avec le petit feu de brindilles très doux.
3ème avec un peu de bois de fût, du tabac brun.
Arrière-bouche avec quelques amandes grillées.
Longueur qui travaille le côté chocolaté avec un grand bonheur.
Jambes huileuses, longues.
Levure typiquement anglaise.
Alcool volontaire, malgré son niveau modeste, il travaille au bénéfice de lensemble.
Finale douce, élégante.
CONCLUSION : effectivement un grand porter, Sir brasseur, dont lAngleterre et Londres peuvent
porter (du verbe porter) lemblème jusques et au continent .. dont il raffole, le porter. Mais trêve dhumour anglais, je ne suis quand même que le 27ème rater (du verbe rate) à lui accorder un 5 
preuve quil a séduit plus dun people  et partout dans le monde.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with small beige head. Aroma of plums and dark chocolate, fainter notes of coffee and roasted malts also appear. Taste is medium sweet: plums, chocolate, some caramel, and light roasty, coffee bitter - very nice. Medium body, soft carbonation. Slick, but also feels a little thin. Good, easy to drink.
From Alcampo. In Ikeas pint glass. After dinner. Deliciously chocolatey, smooth and with a well adjusted bitterness, all packed in a relatively low abv for such a great taste and feel

Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of coffee and plum with faint notes of chocolate, dried fruit and caramel. Taste is pretty sweet, very low bitterness; with flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel. Well-balanced and highly drinkable. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Aroma is dominated by malt coffee with notes of plum, roasted malts and gently touch of caramel. Jet black in the glass with with ruby reflections. Minimal mocca tan head. No more lacing. Taste is especially coffee, roasted malts with dusty roast. Also notes of milk chocolate. Walnut touch in the background. Woody finish. Highly drinkable. Very slick and rich. Nice brew.
Bottle at home. Pours black colour with a tan head. Roasted malt aroma. Malty, smooth porter with lots of coffee and a hint of chocolate. Very well balanced. Lovely.
Very dark brown, not Black, medium head. Roasted malt, chocolate aroma. Taste roasted, coffee, chocolate.

- schwarze Farbe mit einem leichten Rotstich
- leichte, feinporige, schnell zerfallende Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Röstmalz, Bitterschokolade, dunkle Beeren, Rosinen, etwas Zimt
 und viel Karamell
- passende Carbonisierung
- die dunkle Schokolade und das Röstmalz prägen den Antrunk sofort in ange-
 nehmer Art und Weise
- ein passender, leicht süßlicher Karamellunterbau trägt das Ganze im Mittelteil
- im Abgang gewinnt dann eine angenehme Bitterkeit die Oberhand
Fazit: Wunderbar trinkbares Porter

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma amarronada de un dedo de grosor (cremosa, no demasiada retención). Carbonatación imperceptible (nada presente en boca). Aroma a café y algo de chocolate. Sabor tremendo a café con un deje de amargor final. Quizá me gustaría un poquito más si fuera algo más espesa en boca. De todas formas, gran Porter, cosa innegable.

Jet black, tan head. Aroma roasted malt, freshly ground coffee beans, Dark grain, bitter chocolate, milk chocolate and some hops. Tastes absolutely wonderful. Chocolate, coffee and a nice bitter hop finish. Perfectly balanced. Medium mouth feel and silky smooth, goes down easy !

Pours dark with small tan head. Earthy mild aroma. Rich but smooth taste like a cross between brown ale and a good chocolate porter. A nice balance for when a typical porter would be too rich but better than any brown ale in my books.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0,33ltr: Dark brown colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of chocolate and roasted malts. Long time not drink this one, pre-Ratebeer times.
Old review written before making ratebeer account. Elegant, full-bodied, tasty porter.

Aroma - pleasant chocolate malt, warm toast, maple, and mild roast.
Appearance - the body is a very dark cola brown. The head is about 1 1/2" beige, and settles at a slower rate.
Taste - is malty, with a combination of light roast, chocolate, barley, and slight syrup. There is also a nice brown warm toast.
Palate - medium body, velvety texture, the carbonation is average, the finish is malty, but not overly sweet.
Pours dark brown/black with medium beige head. Aroma is coffee, resin, roast, chocolate, nuts, some caramel. Taste is caramel, cream, fruits, coffee, smooth roast, almond. Nice porter!

Can. Pours dark brown color with medium-big light brown head which leaves lot of lacing on glass. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, light orange and tobacco. In flavor there are mostly caramel and chocolate with really light peppery and grassy notes with some roast in finish. Medium-full body. On sweet side. Overall: really nice brew. When I think about classic porter as a style I could imagine this beer as real representative example.

Bottle. In appearance very dark brown but not black. There was no head retention at all, but maybe due to pouring technique. In aroma very pleasant milk chocolate and little hints of coffee. In taste was medium bitter again with chocolate and coffee but also very little, but nice fruitinesss. The roastiness is very subtle or there is none of it. Beer is rather thin and medium to high carbonated. All in all decent but not supereb.

Can
Brown off white head, hazy.
Aroma of syrup, malt, butter
Grain, bitter caramel.

Bottle into stout glass. Dark but not opaque w a decent head that doesn't hang around. Bold chocolate malt aroma. Similar taste. Mild hints of coffee. Not too thick or heavy. Somewhat creamy but Some mild bitterness on the finish. Solid porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Voi hyvä luoja miten maukas portteri! Kaakaota, kahvia, paahtunut ja silti terävä.

Pours coffee-brown, not quite black. Slight head dissipates into a light coffee-creamer layer. Aroma is full, roasty, sweet - chocolate and coffee, cherry, floral note. Taste is smooth and desserty - lightly sweetened dark coffee, cocoa, dairy, light almond, chocolate covered cherry. Palate is thick and creamy. Very high quality.
Pours in black colour with medium light brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, prunes. Medium bitter, ligthly sweet. Full body, oily feel, strong plumish bitter finish

Flasche 0,5l: Kastanienbraun, dunkles Mahagoni, klar, deutlicher grobporiger beiger Schaum; sehr würzige Nase, kräftige Röstaromen, Röstmalz, eher trocken, Kaffee, etwas Malzzucker, dunkle Süße, trockene Bitterkeit, getrocknete dunkle Früchte; im Körper trockene Würze, kräftige Röstaromen, Röstmalz, trockene Malzigkeit, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, leichte Säure, dezente Bitterkeit, Kaffee, etwas dunkle Fruchtigkeit; angenehmer würzig-trockener Nachgang mit kräftigen Röstaromen
Sample, dark brown beer, small head. Aroma is roasted coffee, chocolate, Taste is the same, bit watery

4-pack. Very creamy porter, chocolatey notes on the body. Fairly light compared to many American porters. No hop taste, but the IBUs are enough to keep it from being too sweet. Super lacing in the glass.
Coffe, chocolate, practically black with a good and persistant brown head, medium body, law/medium carbonation, cocoa and roasted malts...an exceptional classic porter.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Stale coffee, smoky nutty sweet aroma. Same for taste with floral notes from the hops. Not bad, glad I tried it. Its a wonder why Guinness is everywhere when even this is much, much better
Can bought at an LCBO in Kitchener Canada. Black ruby color. Thick creamy head. Aroma like a Guiness. Taste like a Guinness plus more body and I like Guiness. Period. Good beer.

Pours very dark brown with a big-ish beige head and little lacing. Lovely rich aroma of chocolate, smoke, caramel/toffee, diacetyl, dark bread crust, prunes. Sweetish taste upfront, light roasty sourness/ bitterness backing it up. Full body, medium carbonation, somewhat sticky. Rich and complex, perhaps a tad too buttery.
Dark colour with a huge chocolate smell. Strong and complex flavours with good strength and excellent, lasting finish. Good flavours.
Ez lenne hát a porterek (hordárok) portere (portersöre)? Kicsit tejszínes, mint a reggeli kávé, de hát abba raktam is...
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with almost no head. Aroma has licorice, herbs, malts and cocoa. Flavor is malty with some cocoa. Quite easy drinking. Nice.

Finally found this one, and i wish i found it sooner. This is one of the best porters i have run across. Flavors of coffee and chocolate blended together magnificently, and the mouthfeel is smooth and creamy without being heavy. Overall it is a very good beer that is certianly worth your time. Originally rated on 10/6/2008.

Una Porter de color caramelo oscuro y baja carbonatacion. Su aroma es a Café con leche, un toque de caramelo y frutos secos. Su sabor tiene notas de café y vainilla con un amargor inicial que desaparece rápidamente dejando un agradable dulzor final.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black liquid with brown edges, tan foam. Chocolate caramel and coffee aroma, bitter chocolate taste. Medium body with soft carbonation

Bottle. Black with minimal head. Roasty, light bittersweet chocolate, rice crispy bar, soy sauce and light earthy aromas. Light chocolate sweetness with a medium earthy taste. Medium body with a soft bubbly feel.

Bottle from Shell: Smell was off with a smell of dead yeast and old stale malting. Appearance is dark brown with thin layer of head. The flavor is somewhat strong with a bitter dark chocolate taste and a background of roasted coffee bean. The beer expired over 7 months ago but still delivered nicely on the warm alcohol and smooth texture.
Вкусный портер, мягкий, сильный приятны& аромат, мощный вкус, много жженки во вкусе, легкая горчинк& приятно& послевк& (срок годност& бутылки до 11.01.2017г)

Bottled - Dark brown colour, medium creamy tan head, good durablity. Roasted malt aromas with chocolate, cocoa and some caramel. Taste is sweet with chocolate, mildly roasted coffee, breadcrust and some smoke. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture, dry and decent roasted finish. Great, well rounded classic porter.

Can 500ml. Deep black with a cream-white (or somewhat darker) dense head. Aroma of coffee and sweet orange. Smooth palate with a creamy mouthfeel. Taste is sweet roasted malts with bready notes. Finish is surprisingly bitter.

0.5l can from coop in basel. pours a clear very dark chestnut with a beige head. intense aroma of chocolate, coffee, raisins, dark fruit. flavour of milk chocolate, coffee, cola, marmite, berries. roasty bittersweet finish. nice.

Burk från SB. Svart färg med tjock, brun, gräddig skumkrona. Doft av pumpernickel, knäck, kaffe och rökta charkuterier. Mediumfyllig kropp, halvtorr kropp. Smak av kaffe, honung, pumpernickel och mörk knäck. Påminner om en lite mustigare Guinness.

Brunatne piwo o średniej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w formie pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat słodki, kawowy, czekoladowy. W smaku palone, kawowe, czekoladowe, lekko ziołowe. Goryczka średnia, wyraźnie zaznaczona. Ogólnie fajne piwo z wyraźnym smakiem i aromatem, bardzo dobrze ułożone.

Average beige head with medium retention.
Clear dark brown colour (coffee).
Aroma is roasted, black coffee, dark cocoa and dark dried fruits (prune).
Taste is medium bitterness, burnt sugar and roasted malt. Black coffee finish.
Medium body, slight diacetyl.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 500ml bottle. Dark, almost black pour, with a little frothy head. Lots of sweet coffee for the nose and the flavour is lots of creamy coffee too. A little charcoal on the way out finishes it off beautifully. A little thin textured but otherwise near perfect.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Tumman punertavanruskea olut noin sentin paksuisella beigellä kermaisella vaahtokerroksella, joka säilyy hamaan tappiin asti. Todella herkullisessa tuoksussa paahteisuutta, suklaata ja maitokahvia. Maku tumman paahteisen maltainen, suklainen ja kahvinen. Kaikkea sopivassa suhteessa. Pitkä kermaisen pehmeä paahteinen ja tumman kahvinen jälkimaku on todella nautittava. Öljyisen täyteläinen ote. Oikein laadukas portteri!
Brown, small to medium head. Bread skin, bottom cake, chocolate, ash, vanilla, dairy or ice-cream. Quite sweet, medium long finish, mostly black chocolate bitterness. Good

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Large bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a black chocolate colour with a thin, brown head which dissipates quickly. Strong aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste of chocolate malt, coffee, dark fruits with caramel. Rich and strong. Medium carbonation. A good porter.

Bottle at De Pass. Pitch black with a thin espresso head. Notes of chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, molasses, toffee. Medium to full bodied, smooth texture, low carbonation and a chocolate roasty aftertaste.

the aroma is caramel and chocolate with shades of vanilla, dark fruits, toffee and nuts... the taste of roasted and caramel malt, brown chocolate, toffee, vanilla, nuts and some spices... the aftertaste is sweet, bitter and dry...
On tap at Union Jack. Pours pitch black. Smokey and choloately. Very thin taste. Not bad and drinkable n

An absolutely fantastic beer, my first Porter and a wonderful introduction into the world of darker beers! Many reviewers on here noted chocolate and coffee in the smell, but the main smells I got were that of dried fruits such as figs and raisins, coupled with roasted coffee and the slightest hint of chocolate. When poured it looked pitch black at first but upon closer inspection was a very dark ruby red with a minimal tan head. The taste is complex and strong, filled with the same fig and raisin tastes as that of the smell, there was a definite wine quality to the drink and it was very creamy in the mouth. The beer was not too carbonated which would have detracted from the taste. Should go well with a lovely steak. Overall, a wonderful beer.
Malt rôti, légère acidité des grains, (trop) effervescente, corps léger, rien qui ne mimpressionne.

500ml bottle. Clear very dark brown colour with a two-three finger tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and slight chocolate. Taste of roasted malts, some chocolate, dried/dark fruit, coffee. Bitter roasty finish.I suppose this is the archetypal porter, pretty much exactly as I expect a porter to be, almost perfect example of the style. Rich flavour, medium body, medium carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. At only £1.89 bottle you cant go wrong.
very nice; roasty beginning of the taste. light brown in color, thin in body.
Goeie lichte chocolade tonen... beetje donker fruit? Medium bodied olieachtig.. lekker
On tap. Pours ruby brown, medium head. Delicate aroma of roasted malt biscuits and dried fruits. Same in taste. Delicate roasty finish.

Data ważności:  11.01.2017 
 Chmiele:  Fuggles 
 Kolor:  Przypomina nieco coca-colę. Ciemnobrązowy i jest całkowicie przejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Wysokie wysycenie niszczy pianę.
Piana jest kremowa, drobnoziarnista. Szybciutko opada do niskiego krążka. 
Lacingu brak. 
 Zapach:  W aromacie wysoka czekoladowość.
Gorzka czekolada i odrobina słodkich pralin. W kolejnym niuchu lekka paloność i ciemne owoce.
Na deser buchnięcie kawy i sporo karmelu.
Spodziewałem się, że zapach może być płaski, tymczasem spotkało mnie miłe zaskoczenie.
Jest wyraźny i intensywny. 
 Smak:  Bogaty, kompleksowy - dokładnie tak jak na etykiecie.
Początek to mocna gorzka czekolada, odrobina słodów palonych i ciemne owoce. Śliweczka miesza się z ciemnym winogronem.
Jest też solidna karmelowa podbudowa, upiększona przez szczyptę toffi i orzechów włoskich.
Faktura średnia, półpełne ciało. Jedna jedyna rzecz, która tutaj nie pasuje to to zbyt wysokie wysycenie, które sprawia że piwo staje się chwilami zapychające. 
 Wysycenie:  Wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Piwo kupione w Budapeszcie w sieci sklepów Spar.
Powiem szczerze, że jak na piwo z sieciówki w cenie 500 HUF (500 węgiesrkich forintów = ok. 7zł.) to całkiem solidna pozycja.

Oczywiście nie wrzucił bym broń Boże tego piwa do pierwszej 5-ki najlepszych Porterów świata, aczkolwiek ten jest stricte angielski, tradycyjny.

Bogaty smak i aromat podparty o mocną czekoladę, ciemne owoce, toffi i karmel wspierane palonością i nutami orzechowymi.
Średnia pełnia i odpowiednia faktura.
Ogromny minus za wysokie wysycenie, poza tym git.

Butelka z datą: 02.12.2016
WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna z rubinowymi refleksami, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Ton nadają słody (charakter melanoidynowy). Czuć zboża, karmel, kawę, anyż, przypieczona skórka od chleba . 
SMAK: Półwytrawne. W smaku przypomina kawę zbożową z lekką karmelową nutą. Długi kawowy posmak.
OGÓLNIE: Dobre, lekkie i bogate w smaku. Z pewnością nie jest to czołówka stylu jak sugeruje Ratebeer czy sam producent, nie mniej zasługuje na szacunek.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Can in wine glass. Pours beautifully in a dark brownish red hue with a head that dances slowly as it grows. Aroma is milky chocolate and the taste is very balanced with chocolate and a fine tail of coffee. Blown away by the quality of such a commonly available beer. Excellent.

Svart och krämig. Rejäl fyllig och djup smak lätt men med mycket malt smak, rena smaker

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown liquid, small head. Aroma of malt. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet, peat.
Pours dark brown, tan head. This is one of the best porters Ive ever had. Great roasty chocolate aroma, sweet malty taste and chocolate finish. Well balanced and medium bodied. Just so good

500ml can BB 31/8/2016

Roasted malt aroma upfront.
Poured jet black with creamy head
Good bitterness with lovely roasted finish. 
Also a touch of vegemite/marmite with a residual metallic note at the back.
All in all a very nice porter.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Pours almost completely black with a beautiful layer of thick foam. Looks magnificent. Aroma is rather fine and delicate - very roasty and chocolatey. Maybe some coffee. Medium body. Flavour is archetypical for a porter and delicious. Loads of chocolate and a well rounded roast flavour. Dark malts come out nicely, beer is quite sweet. Very well balanced with a medium long chocolatey and quite bitter finish. Classic and very good.

Ill agree with the commercial desciptor - this is top shelf porter. Good weight and depth of flavour with plenty of chocolate and cola coming through. A clear pointer to the gains of pushing over 5% for porter. (Tesco 157 baht)

Aroma: roasted dark malts (even smoky), burnt malt, caramel, sweet.
Appearance: deep amber color and beige head.
Taste: low bitterness, burnt malt, roasted caramel, semi-sweet
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Thats ok, not outstanding beer.

My favourite Fullers beer but its a shame that it isnt bottle conditioned. A dark brown, ruby colour with a thin head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate with a rich body. A faint liquorish taste with berry fruityness.

Pours an almost pitch black beer with some translucency and leaves a smallish cream coloured head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is dominated by roasted malts. Coffee, some chocolate, hints of caramel. Tastewise the beer is pretty similar to the aroma. Medium bitterness with strong coffee notes. Leaves a lasting aftertaste of roasted malts. Body is slightly weak compared to the taste, the beer doesnt really have a remarkable mouthfeel in it. Overall a nice strong flavoured porter, probably one of my favourites. The price (4 / 500ml bottle) is bit steep though.

Bottle. Dark chestnut brown pour, essentially opaque with a medium beige head, decent retention. Nose is coffee, caramel, chocolatey, somewhat diacetyl butterscotch, but in an acceptable English way. Mouth is medium bodied, mild creaminess, light sweetness, coffee, candy, subtle bitterness. Very nice.
Finom gyümölcsös illat, pörkölt jegyekkel. Erős, pörkölt kávés íz, a háttérben egy kis gyümölcsösséggel, és némi komlós mellékízzel. Utóízében a kávés jegyek dominálnak. Közepesen testes.

Bottle 500ml. Aroma: Roasty and a little bit of soy sauce and chocolate. Brown almost Black with a midium, tan head. Tastes slightly bitter and sour with a light body and fizzy carbonation. Finish is long, mostly coffee like. Overall: Light beer, with strong influence of dark malts. Nice break between IPAs on hot days.
50cl can. Pours dark brown, almost black with weak tan head. Very strong flavour, a little bit too strong. Mostly coffee.

33cl bottle at De Vlaamsche Reus, at Wageningen in the Netherlands (26 V 2016). A 5.4 percentage ABV chocolate dark porter with mint notes. Very lovely porter styled, pitch black and white foamed brew with a rich body. Thick and sweet, bitter flavoured. Perfect porter archetype - great brew.
Zeer uitgesproken geur, wel geen lekkere geur. Heel donker met een Donner witte schuimkraag. De smaak valt wel beter mee dan de geur. Maar gaat toch bij 1 keer blijven
bottle @ supermarket. dark colour, heavy body, coffee and chocolate taste porter

APARIENCIA: de color marrón con destellos rojizos a contraliz; corona de espuma de poca retención, color marfil, burbuja compacta con algunas abiertas.

AROMA notas de café, chocolate, maltas tostadas es lo que predomina.

SABOR: notas de café, chocolate con buena permanencia en paladar, grano tostado es lo que predomina; el retrogusto queda un amargor bajo, seco, no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: Cuerpo ligero con sensación untuosa, baja carbonatación.

RESUMEN: Buena porter.
Tap. Black, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.
Esta cerveza es la puta polla. Fue probarla y quedar enamorado de ella. Muy muy buena.
couleur brun foncé; mousse beige; arômes et goût maltés, de café et de chocolat noir; bière légèrement douce avec finale un peu amère

Aroma of sugar and toasted nuts. Dark brown and smooth body, minimal head of any. Looks viscous. Medium roasty notes, very smooth with slight kick at the end of hops. Not overly thick/coating or cloyingly sweet. Well balanced. I enjoy this a lot. Very well put together beer.
Flaska Ölsellskap efter årsmötet. Ja jävlar med choklad. Annars nja den är väl flat

Pours a very nice rich dark brown, but still transparent ruby at the edges of the glass. Rich roasted malt, some coffee and toffee notes both in the nose and the mouth. Full mouthfeel. Very good beer.

Black pour with small, beige head. Lovely smell of roasted malts and coffee beans.

Medium to full body with subtle carbonation. This is incredibly tasty and rich. Aroma of roasted malts, coffe, dark fruit and berries. A bit bready with notes of caramel and chocolate in the background. Slightly smoked. Very, very smooth. Short and dry finish.

Overall, excellent porter. Pure class.

Pours black brown with a thin tan head. Smells of coffee, chocolate and chalk. Tastes of malt and light coffee notes. Sour finish that lingers. Round mouthfeel with oiliness and light carbonation. Simple but pleasing enough.

Dark brown color, almost black. Beige head with good retention. Aroma, coffee, toast, chocolate, liquor. Taste is very complex. Chocolate, toast, nuts, bread, a little liquorish alcohol after it gains some temperature. Creamy texture, caramel sweet with a light bitter end. Best before july 2014, opened march 2016... beautiful

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, mocha, some liquorice, espresso, burnt caramel. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a little roasty bitterness in the finish. Body is medium. Surprisingly strong flavoured at only 5.4%. Great Porter.
On tap at Fox and Goose. Pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Nicely balanced hops and malt. Medium sweet brown sugar flavor.

Bottle. Dark brown with almost no head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Taste of dark caramel, licorice and ripe berries. Smooth finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

aroma: smooth coffee, roasted malts, some caramel, very gentle toffee, some grassiness way in the back. 
appearance: almost black, some opaqueness, off white head, good retention.
lightly bitter, smooth coffee, chocolate, roast, caramel, some alcohol. 
light-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, slight astringent finish. 
overall nicely balanced and drinkable with no exceptional notes. could have a few!

Aroma roasted malt, nuts, light chocolate, bready. Appearance is dark brown, light tan head. Taste is roasted malt, subtle caramel, nuts, chocolate, everything is subdued but very nice. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, a beautiful nuttiness lingers. Overall, this is not over the top with flavor, but thats ok. It is a classic example of the style, and features everything youd want in a porter.

Deep dark, brown head. Lots of roated malts, coffee, chocolate.
convenient bitters and complexed enough for the low alcohol percentage.
En porter med meget lidt kulsyre og næsten intet skum. Har en rigtig god fyldig let brændt chokoladesmag. Eftersmagen bliver længe i munden. Sådan som en porter skal være.

Dark brown, almost black color with tiny almost non existant brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Low bitterness. Too waterish for my taste. Expected more from this beer based on ratings.
Just think of Christmas pudding in a bottle, this is it. One or two bottles will leave you satisfied. So much flavour needs to be carefully rationed.

Aroma of chocolate, roasty malt, coffee and liquirice. Notes of fruits/berries. Black liquid with a beautiful white foam. Medium-high sweetness followed by light-medium bitterness. Perfectly balanced with taste of chocolate and coffee most present. Average soft carbonation, full body, creamy texture. Great porter from Fullers!
Denne porter har et klart mørkt udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en sød lakrids aroma og smager deraf med noter af karamel og en bitter afrunding. Lav karbonering.
Black-brown color with foam layer. Coffee and some chocolate aromas. Mild coffee and calmly roasted chocolate with a smooth watery mouth feeling. Calm chocolate aftertaste. Insanely smooth beer.

poors black with lil lasting head, aroma floral and alcohol,
Taste light sweet with a short tasted light bitter after taste.
its fizzy with thin to oily body.
i would like to try this beer outside of america.

Pours near black wih a not so lasting head.
roasty, bread, caramel aroma with hints of chocolate.
light sweetness, medium bitterness, with strong but yet subtle roasty flavors.
medium body, creamy, sticky texture with a long roasty, bitter finish.
The drinkability is just astonishing, I could drink literally liters of this.

Definetely one of the best porters you can have, and specially for the price (less than 3 USD in Chile).

Bottle from the Malt Shoppe for my 100th porter as 2100th rating. Pale brown pour with a tan head leaving little lacing. Aroma has sweet malts, chocolate, and fruits. Taste is of sweet caramel, dark fruits, faint chocolate and some oatmeal. The blend is a touch off, although smooth, and the body is medium. Lowly carbonated with no alcohol presence. Finishes well blended between bitter and sweet. Shrug? Old style porter - there are much better takes on the style. Happy to get to 100 though! 14

Beautifully dark, almost black with ruby reflections, it really surprised me with a noticeable aroma and taste of licorice after the more obvious roast coffee and chocolate.

Carbonation is also a bit higher than expected, but its really nice to the tongue, like an invitation to the next sip and, boy, you bet I could drink liters of it, but the bottle holds only 500ml.

Piana opadajac ładnie znaczy szkło. W aromacie troche palonosci oraz slodowosc, o dziwo raczej w stylu jasnego piwa. Gdzieś w tle przewija się mleczna czekolada. W smaku więcej mlecznej czekolady. Smakuje troche jak niektóre polskie milk stout, dosc gładkie. Przyjemne.
Bottle to glass. Dark brown, reddish, small head. Aroma caramel, nuts. Taste medium sweetness, malty, coffee. medium body, average carbonation. Decent.

Draft at the Oregon Highland Stillhouse.

A: Pitch black with a thin off-white head.

N: Intense milk chocolate with a good amount of coffee, toast, vanilla, toffee, and lactose underneath.

T: Goodly sweet, lightly bitter.

M: Medium body, crisp carbonation, no alcohol.

O: This is really, almost surprisingly, delicious. Theres immense flavor here for such a light ABV.

Copenhagen 10/2 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. A little golden man carrying a stick/pole on the label. A porter I presume. Pours clear reddish dark brown with small off-white head. Disappears quickly leaving only patches of foam. Aroma is dark roasted malts and chocolate. Fairly sweet but not overwhelmingly so. Soft carbonation and slightly thick palate. Taste is pretty rich. A bit on the sweet side without being too much. Caramel, chocolate, a touch of licorice. Pretty mild compared to many porters usually heavy with alcohol. Light bitterness in aftertaste. A very fine shot at the porter style from Fuller.

Bottle into a pint glass. Pours black, with a moderate tan head that fades quickly. Nose is dark roast malt, and the taste follows, with hints of cocoa and coffee. Very well balanced and extremely drinkable. One of the worlds best porters.

nuts, resin, spruce, cheese, cooked vegetables, soy sauce, black, brown, red, hazy, white foam, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, umami, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Poured into an English pub glass at cellar temperature. Smells roasty and chocolatey, has a solid brown porter look to it. Sure enough you get a bit of coffee and chocolate in this rather thin but smooth porter. If I had to pick a brew that defined this style, Fullers would do nicely. Easy drinking and pleasing, quite well balanced, this ones a keeper.

Nez: Chocolat, fruits noirs
Bouche: Café, amertume chocolat noir, fruits noirs
Du déjà bu mais jadore cette bière.

Pours beautiful dark brown, black in the glass, with a nice airy head that disappears very quickly. Roasty aroma of coffee and chocolate, as advertised. Light bodied on the tongue. Not much happening but leave it resting in the mouth a couple of seconds and it gives a good, medium sweetness, with some hints of dark chocolate. Thin feel, average carbonation, abrupt finish. No aftertaste. Hyped up as "one of the best" but I beg to differ. Good value.
Dark ruby with moderate head. Aroma of coffee, dried plums and dark malts. Very smooth, dry, taste of roasted malts and coffee.

Marrone scurissimo, ai margini del nero, e schiuma beige chiaro a trama fine, cremosa e dalla buona persistenza. Al naso cè lessenziale, quanto basta, ovvero pulizia ed eleganza: caffè, cioccolato al latte e amaro, orzo tostato, cenere; a temperature ambiente emergono anche leggere suggestioni di caramello, vaniglia, cuoio. Ottimo larrivo al palato: poche bollicine, corpo tra il medio ed il leggero, perfettamente in equilibrio tra la volontà di essere scorrevole e quella di non risultare troppo acquosa, lasciando una sensazione morbida che avvolge il palato. Cè grande intensità, nonostante la modesta gradazione alcolica (5.4%), fatta di caffè, tostature eleganti, cioccolato amaro: lacidità del caffè è la sfumatura conclusiva che dà un po di riposo al palato, permettendogli poi di assaporare il retrogusto, ugualmente intenso, fatto di raffinate tostature, cenere e caffè.

500 ml bottle poured at home. Pours a dark brown with a beige head that dies out quickly. Smells like chocolate and malts (I think...stuffy nose). Taste is smooth with notes of dark fruit, chocolate and malt. Good beer.

Poured from 330ml bottle into pint glass.

Appearance: pours a 1" tan head that falls moderately with mild lacing. Nearly opaque reddish brown color.

Aroma: definite roasty malt is prominent just some mild hop notes. Overall the aroma is fairly mild.

Mouthfeel: medium bodied and frothy with a fairly dry finish.

Flavor: Chocolate and coffee notes, raisin, bread dough, with some lingering hop bitterness in the finish.

Overall: another excellent beer from Fullers. Definitely recommended.

500ml bottle @ Östra Station. Dark with a creamy tanned head, leaving only some lacing. Roasted chocolate nose, malts, dark sugar and dried fruit. Really smooth with cocoa and chocolate taste, nuts, caramel and fudge. Nice sweetness with a mild cocoa and grassy bitter finish.
Lekkere, vrij simpele en lichte stout/Porter. Niet helemaal zwart. Mout, koffie en chocola in geur en smaak.

500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with moderate head. Aromas of dark candi sugar, raisins, and dark malts. Flavors of dry roasted malts, weak coffee, nuts, and dark caramel with a little grass.Light but complex.
Smokey caramel aroma. Pours black with a nice brown foam. Lightly bitter, less full than I typically like my porters. But very drinkable, better than I expected.
Aromi di caffè, cacao amaro. Complessa ed equilibrata, ottimo finale secco.

Hints of chocolate and coffee. Crisp, fairly light. Definitely drinkable. This Porter is the classic and the standby.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 L: pours a very dark brown with cola highlights, I can see quite far in but not see-through, tiny dark beige bubble head that disappears quickly. 
S: great nose of slightly burnt dark malt, chocolate, caramel toffee. 
T: tastes superb, full-flavoured, rich chocolate with toffee, malt, hints of dark fruit. 
F: a medium body that carries the full-flavour wonderfully, gentle carbonation up front them a bitterness that washes the sweetness along the palate, but definitely not sweet, a great balance with the bitter notes and it lingers nicely. 
O: if these were a little easier to pick up in Osaka Id have it permanently rotating through my fridge. Excellent.

Really nice dark brown, almost black color, foam disappears too quickly. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and caramel. Taste is sweet bitter(bitter in a dark chocolate way). It has defined and well rounded aroma and taste. Body is medium with nice lasting chocolate aftertaste. One superb porter.

Bottle. Sweet, caramel aroma. Pours dark brown. Very pleasant chocolate, caramel and malt flavors. Tastes very rich but not overwhelmingly high ABV. Therefore very drinkable, thus bucking the current trend for recent porters and imperial ales, which are very dense and tasty, but also very boozy and can only be sipped.
Bottle. Clear dark brown color with low tan head. Aroma - Dark fruit, choc, coffee. Taste - Medium sweetness, dark choc, red berries, cream.

Bottiglia, 500 ml. La vera porter inglese! Scura con riflessi rubino, limpida, schiuma non troppo persistente. Al naso note tostate, caramello, un pò di cacao. Gusto equilibrato, caramello, caffè. Corpo leggero, carbonazione bassa. Ottima.
Fles, thuis, ABCbeers. Klassieke Engelse portersmaak. Zo goed als plat met een subtiel kietelend bruisje, droppig, slome bruine kroeg, zoet, schoenzolenmuf. Backlog from 2015/10/27.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin off white head. The aroma is rich red berry fruit, caramel malt, light chocolate. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich, fruity, liqourice malt palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Toffee primarily on the aroma, not particularly intense but pleasant. To a lesser extent, some caramel on the nose, and slight hints of Hersheys powder. Lots of mocha qualities in the aroma. Color appears to be a light brown with a tan head that has some staying power. Medium bodied with flawless carbonation. Rich enough, but not overbearing mouthfeel. Spectacular, satisfying finish that will have you reaching for your glass. Palate is more of the same, expanding the spectrum downward to toast and definitely not so much chocolate on the palate as on the aroma. A true delight to sip on in any circumstance.
Good beer quite fizzy for a porterand a medium / light body. Nice little torified taste with no noticable aftertaste.
Barwa brunatna, klarowne, niezła piana. Aromat palony, w tle śliwki. W smaku przeważają kwaskowe nuty od ciemnych słodów, przyjemny kawowo-palony posmak, goryczka niska. Przyjemne, ale bez szału.

Rossa molto scura con riflessi rubino e caramello, limpida, schiuma beige di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di liquirizia, prugna, caramello, leggero cacao e caffè tostato, note affumicate.
Al palato parte con liquirizia e prugna, successivamente viene fuori una bella coda di cacao amaro alla quale si unisce poco dopo caffè tostato e leggero cappuccino.
Corpo poco più che leggero, carbonazione medio-bassa, texture watery.

Robe noire avec de minces reflets noisettes. Aucun col de mousse, aucune dentelle. Apparence aqueuse. Arômes de mélasse, malt rôti, un peu de chocolat et noisettes, le tout sur un fond minéral. Nez plus ou moins intéressant et manque dintensité. En bouche, beaucoup de mélasse, noisettes, goût prononcé de malt rôti, pointes de chocolat. Finale très amère de café froid aux noisettes. Texture très légère et corps mince. Bière commerciale facile daccès qui manque déquilibre.
Could use a bit more alcohol, but other than that it is a perfectly done Porter.

Best beer ever
Beautiful colour, strong and smooth taste, good balance, beautiful after taste
Chocolate toffee charcoal simply the best porter

it pours black as death and with a slightly tanned head that disappears instantly.it smells malt,coffee,toast and maybe chocolate.the taste and the sensation is great.it tastes dark malt sweetness,a bit of chocolate and the body is a full one.the aftertaste is long and sweet with just a tone of biterness.Loved it.

Dark mahogany Porter. Complex aromas of roasted, coffee, dark chocolate. The taste is torrefied, mocha, ashes, cocoa powder, licorice. Creamy texture, woody, perfect balance between bitterness and sweetness. Soft and earthy hops.

Can from Systembolaget. Pours black with strong white head. Burnt malt with licorice, coffee and chocolate and nitrogen. Light to medium body, with a slick texture and appropriate carbonation. Long, porterish finish. Nice, but some metallic side tastes, probably from the can. Would like to try from a cask.

Bottle from Sainsburys, drunk at home. Dark brown and slightly translucent. Very little of the tan head but a decent (although not excessive) amount of visible carbonation. Strong good quality coffee, rich melted chocolate. Sweet, rich, malty taste, fading to a surprisingly effective mild hop bitterness for the finish. Chocolate, liquorice and spruce in the aftertaste. Full creamy body. Decadent.

Bottle. Opaque black a bit reddish color with tanned head. Aroma has roasted malt, ripe fruits, caramel. Taste is malty with long noble bitter aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, ripe fruits and cocoa.

Taste of toasty malt, almost smokey, dark chocolate.
Dark brown and mostly opaque. Deep roasted coffee bean and malt aroma.
Full body with Large dark tan head with good lace.
Bottle. Chocolate barley malt and roasty aroma. Dark brown with a large tan head. Roasty barley malt and chocolate flavor with a light herbal bitter finish. Medium body, average carbonation.

Porter grand public à cause des ses arômes de caramel de sucre prépondérants qui masquent tout et tapissent trop les papilles. Par contre, ce profil sucré apporte pas mal darrière goût mais avec des arômes de noisette, de pain grillé au caramel de sucre quasiment brûlé; ce qui la rend un peu écoeurante. Heureusement, cette petite aigreur bienvenue en finale qui la rend désaltérante. #306 [Free sample]

Root-beer brown-garnet with a cm of medium-fine tan head, moderate-slow-to-fade. Aroma is bread crust and coffee-cake dipped in coffee, some hazelnut and cocoa with a hint of bbq underneath, all blended seamlessly. Body is smooth, but with carbonation a bit fat and discrete to be silky. Flavor is a bit more cedar wood and less coffee cake and chocolate. Some dry chestnut, and a bit of burnt coffee.

Quasi nera con riflessi rossi, schiuma beige compatta di buona consistenza. Aroma buono di malto tostato, meglio al palato con ingresso con tostatura e dolcezza di bel livello, note di cacao, avvolgente. Bene la bassa carbonazione.

ロンドンポー  
しっかり焙煎&
Porter emblematica che più non si può, ma altrettanto poco interessante per il sottoscritto. Cacao, caffè, malto e struttura "liscia" come vuole lo stile.
Drank from a 11.2oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours a nice dark, deep black with nice head. Nice aromas of roastiness, slight chocolate notes. Has a nice light, but a bit too sweet of a taste.

0,5 l bottle. Aroma of sweet malt, chockolade, caramell and a hint of smoked. Taste of sweet malt, raisins, some cara and some smoked. The bitterness is perfect for this porter and overall a nice beer!
Bottle. Dark brown colour with tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel. Medium body with soft carbonation, a bit of sweetness with balanced mild bitter finish. Great beer.
Geschmack von Mokka und dunkler Schokolade, leichte Holznote, dabei cremig weich.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - black pour with tan head. Medium roasted and sweet malty aroma and taste, prominent milky chocolate, caramel, light vanilla nuances, not bad.

Cloudy dark brown color with a copper hue. Nice light brown head but weak retention.

Perfectly balanced aromas and flavors of toasty coffee and chocolate with a fruity sensation, like apples. A really fresh and tender taste with notes of toffee.

Rich and creamy, super smoky and almost chalky. Dense body with slight carbonation. The only drawback: the finish is too short...I want more!

Overall this is a wonderful beer, super flavorful with great balance in all aspects.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 13C). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 051 11:41 AROMA: toasty caramel notes with coffee and slight brad crust and dark chocolate notes with a sweet background. APPEARANCE: dark brown color with ruby body against light. clear. moderate-low light brown head with fair retention. TASTE: toasty caramel flavour with a slight coffee and dark chocolate presence and a slightly sweet backgbround. low bitterness with a semi-sweet finish. balanced towards the malt. PALATE: medium-light to light body. moderately-low carbonation. slight creamy texture. OVERALL: a good traditional english porter, balanced towards the malt.
Bottle. Deep brown with tanned head. Aroma is lots of dark chocolate, fudge, earthy notes and a bit of metallic scent. Taste is roasted and smoky malts, chocolate and a bit of coffee.
Brown color with beige head. Milk chocolate, slight coffee, a bit nutty. Nutty coffeeish flavour, more milk chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel. Pleasant aftertaste. A classic.
In der Nase leicht Kaffee, etwas schokoladig. Im Trunk cremig, leicht süß, dann plötzlich Kaffee. Toller, plötzlicher Abgang. Sehr rund, gute Drinkability.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 Deep brown with a shortlived fizzy tan head. Light, and easy drinking, yet roasty... flavours of coffee, milk chocolate, liquorice, dried fruit. Lovely and refreshing porter. Good stuff.

Deep brown color with some gorgeous ruby notes. Medium carbonation. Dark fruitiness, raisins, milk chocolate, and coffee aromas. Quite dry and bitter with a nice toasted malt flavor. Notes of milk chocolate on the tongue. Full of flavor, but not too heavy. When I think of porter, this beer is what comes to mind. Excellent.
Tasted in bottle. Clear, dark brown color, thin white head. Aroma: dark chocolate, not reach. Taste: light sweet, light bitter, medium body, a little watery. Quite long a nit bitter finish.

Very dark ruby color, crystal clear. Small tan head, quickly disappearing, leaving ring on glass. Aroma of coffee, roastiness, quite weak aroma. Palate more on thin side, carbonation medium. Taste sourish, non on malty side. Fruity start - black currant with red wine like barrell finish. Aftertaste roasty and rich but at the same time decent and not overpowering.
Good one, balanced and not too strong to scare broad audience.
A nice porter, though at my second try it seems somehow less interesting than at the first.

Ciemny w kolorze jak to porter z przyzwoita brazowa palona piana. Ciekawa nuta kawowa i slodkawy posmak czekolady.Dobry porter ale...jakby zbyt wodnisty. Ponoc to jeden z nalepszych na swiecie porterow - jesli tak, to ja tego nie czuje

33cc Bottle. Tasted on my 30th birthday :)
Pours with two fingers fast-fading head and blackish color. Mostly toffee, coffee and burnt malt aromas, maybe a bit almond and strawberry. Really well-balanced refreshing taste but quite short finish. It would be a great meal company

Bottle. Dark brown color with thin head. Aroma of dark chocolate, dry fruits. Taste is lightly sweet with light bitterness in the end. Medium-bodied, complex taste. Nice long finish. Very good porter.
12 oz bottle, best before Oct 26, 2015. Dark brown, thin tan head, minimal lacing.Aroma is dark toast, chocolate, toffee.Flavor is sweet, chocolate, dark toast, mild hops.
0.5 l bottle from Alko. Dark brown colour with tan head. First impression is dark chocolate. Later on it becomes coffee. Overall quite dry.
Appearance is small tan head with brown color. Aroma is sweet malts. Taste is nicely roasted, smokey malts with some chocolate. Overall enjoyable.
This May be well within the historical lines of the original porters, but for me its just too thin. Need more body, warmth and complexity...

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 pompa w jabeerwocky. Piwo dosc zaskakujace, bo z jednej strony bardzo jednowymiarowe i w pewnym sensie pustawe, a z drugiej fajne w tej swojej jednowymiarowosci. minowicie: bardzo kawowe, czekoladowe, zarowno w aromacie jak i w smaku... i wlasciwie nic poza owa kawowoscia w nim nie ma, dodatkowo - bardzo lekkie, wodniste wrecz - efekt tez o dziwo pozytywny - wypija sie je blyskawicznie. ;)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

dark red, almost black liquid with minimal head. Aroma of roasted malts. Taste: caramel, roasty, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: light body, creamy, average carbonation, long caramel finish,

Bottle bought at Malt Attack Brussels. It pours a rubyred hued very darkbrown almost black beer with a creamy tanned head.
Aroma is of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, bayleaf, liquorice with some nutty and fruity hints, some hops too...
Taste is a nice mingling of roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, coffee with hints of dark fruits and a slight bit of bready note with the hops in the lightbitter hoppyaftertaste, which is well balanced against the sweetness.
Its got a nice soft carbonation with a thin but still nice light oily mouthfeel.
A porter that has been around for awhile, and which I will keep on enjoying very much indeed!

The pasteurized, bottled version of this (litterally) London porter. Older bottle from Malt Attacks, shared by Craftmember. Pale yellowish beige, creamy, lacing head resting on top of a very dark burgundy coloured beer with ruby hue, almost blackish in appearance. Pleasant aroma of bitter chocolate, bayleaf, coffee liqueur, liquorice but not exaggeratedly so, black tea, dried plums, hazelnuts, vanilla. Soft sweet onset of raisins, dried prunes and candied dates, hint of banana, soft carbo, smooth, bit thin but oily mouthfeel resulting from a coating of very agreeably chocolatey and caramelly maltiness with a light coffeeish roasted bitter edge and a well-balanced leafy hop bitterishness in the end. Exemplary for the regular brown porter style in the modern sense of the word, nice addition to Fullers old school and thoroughly English range.

Pours dark reddish brown with beige head. Roasty aroma with coffee and chocolate. Very rich taste which has roasted malts, licorice, chocolate, coffee. Truly an amazing porter, very well balanced yet smooth to drink.
Chocolate malt caramel and bready aromas. Chocolate malt toast nut bread and balanced bitterness. Medium full body. Dry finish.

Una Porter compleja. El color se diferencia de otras porter por ser mas rojizo y negro pero totalmente cristalino. Sin turbidez. La espuma es beig y desaparece con rapidez. El aroma recuerda a cacao y esto se confirma en el paladar, resaltando primero las notas a café y saliendo posteriormente el cacao. Una de las mejores Porter, pero a mi gusto, no la mejor.

Very interesting and complex Porter. Ill have to sample it again, because it was bb August, but then again it did not give me the sense that it lacks freshness. Pours dark brow to black, with small diminishing creamy beige head. Malty with tastes and aromas of roasted barley, coffee beans, chocolate and molasses. Not as hoppy. Balanced between sweetness and bitterness, dry bitter finish, fair lacing, medium body, dry fruits and chocolate tastes. Great for its kind.
Klares dunkelbraun mit reichlich Schaum. Röstmalze, Kaffee, Bitterschokolade mit Waldbeeren, würzig, sehr lecker.

Bouteille de 500ml. Couleur brune opaque avec reflets rougeâtres et épaisse mousse beige qui disparaît vite. A: torréfaction, malt brûlé, caramel, réglisse. G: café, chocolat noir, un peu de noix fumés en fin de bouche. P: très liquoreux avec effervescence quasi nulle. Cest excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 Dark nutty brown appearance with almost no head. Tastes of roasted caramel, citrus, chocolate, some alcohol, apples and dark malt. Heavy body with with lots of carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of burnt sugar. One of the great porters

Dark color (almost black) and very nice head.
Aroma of roasted malt, aged wood and some wine note.
Taste is bitter and sour. Toast malt.
Palate with a strong body and long finish.
Great Porter!!
Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, licorice, roasted malt and caramel. Taste is mild sweet, mild bitter and long lasting.

Aroma of roasted coffee, dark fruits and burnt malt. Taste is coffee, sweeter dark chocolates, there is a hint of some kind of red berry underneath. Dry aftertaste and overall very well composed. One of the best regular porters out there.

Color negro, espuma muy fina que rápidamente desaparece. Aroma tostado, café y fruta madura. Buen paladar, con notas de café, chocolate y un toque dulce, muy equilibrada. Cuerpo medio, sin carbonatación y final con ligero amargor. Excelente.

Pours dark brown, with medium head, which diminishes quite quickly and leaves you a flat top. Strong smell of roasted aroma, some sweet notes - chocolate, can be sensed. Almost no carbonation, taste is very intense at the beggining, strong creamy-hops feel, with a very well changing body to a slightly dry aftertaste. An excellent beer specimen.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coffee, chocolate, 
Appearance-brown, hazy, beige foam
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle. Dark Amber colored, brown with a small rocky tan head. Strong roasted malt aroma in the nose with a rich note of coffee and dark fruits. Hints of dark chocolate. Dry bitter taste with a nice finish. Flavor is also strongly coffee and dark chocolate. Complex in its flavor profile and aroma. The coffee and chocolate notes get accompanied by a nice touch of dry sherry. The medium to full body lays a good foundation and transports the flavor very well. Good dry aftertaste with a light note of coffee. Great Porter.
Bottle in London. Dark brown body with no head. Nose of malts, chocolate, coffee, raisins. Taste is also quite malty, with plums, sugar, raisins. Moderate balance. Bitter in the finish.

Delicious black porter with reddish tinge. It has large renewable light brown foam and smells although hard roasted malt, licorice and caramel.
The taste is light touches of coffee, good mellow taste of English licorice and everything kept nice balance of sweetness coming from the hard roasted malt and caramel. An unbelievably rich and delicious porter. Personally I do not think that a porter / stout need to be a kind of imperial-barrel-aged-extreme to taste good. This one is simple, but incredibly tasty.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Keg at The Counting House, Bank. A deep brown colour with no head. Aroma of roasted malts, cola, chocolate, light coffee, some raisin and subtle gravy granules.Taste of roasted malts, raisin, some prune, slight brown sugar, liquorice, chocolate and light roasted coffee in the background. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A lingering, roasted bitterness in the finish. A well made porter with nice roasted bitterness and decent dark fruit flavours. Decent.

(330ml bottle, Beijing). Aroma: good nose of roastiness, coffee, toast, raisins, some herbalness. Appearance: dark, rich, tan head (but not much head, dissipates relatively quickly), slightly oily/clingy. Taste: Bold, rich, dry. malt, coffee, chocolate, roasted, touch medicinal/tannin. Palate: smooth and sparkly upfront, a bit creamy/oily in the middle, with a dry finish. Decent bitterness that hangs on the sides of the tongue. Overall: a rich, bold, chewy beer. Something to be savored and enjoyed. 

High points: Boldness and complexity without being over the top. multiple layers of flavor. 
Low points: Cant think of anything.
500ml bottle poured mahogany black with an aroma of coffee chocolate malt taste is similar roasty malt coffee mild chocolate sweet flavours even dry bitter finish

Bottle. Pours black with opaque shine and small cream head. Aroma is very nice and balanced with roasty malts, light liquorice, some raisins and bread crust. Taste is more fruity, roasty malts, bready, light one, yet really nice! Full body compared to abv and really smooth. Long roasty finish with some liquorice.
Cooked vegetables, cooked vegetables, basement aromas, raisin, cooked vegetables, herbs, cheese

Poured from a large bottle. Appearance is khaki head that retains a finger width, and is frothy, dark brown hues. Aroma is sweet and toasted malt. Taste is very dark roasted malt and milky. Palate is a watered-down milkshake. Overall, I wanted to like this more than i really did, especaily since its so highly rated and i usually love the style.

Arômes maltés, torréfiés, tourbés, légère amertume picante et poivrée.

En bouche : chocolat, raisins mûrs, cacao légèrement amer.

Pas mal du tout.
Vastly overrated in my opinion. I know people love it, but it just doesnt do it for me.

0,5 l can. Black reddish colour, not much foam. Aroma is good amounts of coffee, chocolate, malt. Taste starts off slightly waterish which might suggest the thin body. After a while, the coffee and chocolate kicks in which eventually leave a nice aftertaste. A good porter for the abv.
Black-reddish color, brown foam. Not long lasting head. Aromas of chocolate and roasted notes, some malt sweetness. Taste pretty similar, very smooth, balanced bitterness. Just love it
Bottle from SB. Very nice taste and aroma, like raisins and chocolate. Easy to drink, but not as powerful taste as imperial porters.

Bottle. Clear dark reddish brown colour with a small beige head. Rich aroma with notes of caramel, coffee and dark roasted malts. The taste is medium sweet with notes of roasted malts. It is good, but it does not fully deliver on what the aroma seems to promise. Light body, average carbonation, and a long and bitter finish. A good porter.

Bottle 0,5.
Dark brown. Medium body. Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt. Well balanced taste, medium bitterness, long finish. Good porter.

Bottle. Near black, small beige head. Complex aroma, roast coffee, roast malt, dark chocolate. Taste largely follows, espresso finish. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ein überragendes Porter.
Schokolade, Kaffee, dunkles Malz. Zudem eine sehr angenehme Süße.
Aber das allerbeste: Ich habe noch nie ein so sanftes Bier getrunken. Es schmiegt sich an alle Ecken und Enden im Mund und Rachen und bleibt so lange dort, dass man sich ruhig Zeit mit dem nächsten Schluck nehmen kann. 
Für das Gefühl im Mund gibt es eine 1+, sensationell. Zudem der tolle Geschmack, einfach ein rundes Bier.

Bottle from Waitrose. Pours almost black with a frothy beige head. Lovely roasty mocha aroma. The taste is rich and delicious. Starts with a little spice before coffee and lots of dark chocolate. Superb.
Bottle and tap. Dark brown with very good foam. Aroma: roasted, coffee, chocolate, brandy. Taste: velvet, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dry finish. Very good.
Drink it on tap at Bobby Dazzler Pub, Moscow. Perfect Porter, great taste of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, nuts. The Englishman next to us was his drinking.

Dark brown pour with medium sized persistant beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, faint nuts, and faint hops. Taste of big sweet chocolate, roasted malts, slightly nutty, faint burnt coffee and faint bitter hops. Medium bodied, perfect carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, smooth from the lips all the way down. Perfectly balanced, my new benchmark for porters!
Самый сбаланс& портер. Несмотр& на то, что имеются вариант& куда поразно& Фуллерс& держат марку и являютс& одними из лидеров.

Tras haber probado la bitter de la casa, la London Pride, me atreví a dar un paso más en el mundo cervecil británico, y tras esa dí el salto a una porter. He de decir que me quedo con la Pride. Vale que la Porter tiene una divertida mezcla entre Bockbier y sabor a anchoas. Este estilo me recuerda, quizás me equivoque, a la cecina con chapa, la Aecht Schlenkerla Urbock. Yo soy más de la versión Marzen, quizás porque una cerveza de 5º no le exijo demasiada dificultad en su degustación...le pido más diaridad, que sea mas bebible...y tanto la Urbock como la London Porter son mas complicadas de disfrutar, tanto en el dia a dia, como de beber mas del medio litro que esta botella contiene. Para mi una 5º tiene que ser adictiva, y para mi, la London Porter NO LO ES!
Esto ye pa mexar y nun echar gota.....vaya pepino...porter polos cuatro costaos........
Čapované v Local Pube. Tmavá farba, niia biela pena. Horkastá chuť, praená káva, iadny cukor, super! 4. pivo v poradí, mám doma fľau, podrobnejie hodnotenie, po jej vypití... :-D
Bottle. Pours black with a frothy tan head. Nose has chocolate, almonds, milk and some light roast. Taste is smooth, lots of chocolate, some milky notes, nuts and some light roast. Enjoyable.
Nice example of a porter. Dark brown pour chocolate, coffee, roast, dark fruits. Creamy and full body. very enjoyable
Sample på Annas ölprovning. Mycket god öl som kommer att införskaffas igen! Drick och bar glad.

Aroma: burned coffee, chocolate, some wine notes.
Taste: light sweeteness, medium to light bitterness.
