Flavour. burned coffee, chocolate, pumpernickel, ash, 
Light to moderate bitterness, and light sourness in the aftertaste.

Very complex and good for the 5.4% ABV

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2015 0.5l bottle from britishstore. Huge beige head, aroma is mild, chocolate, maybe a bit roasted. Foam is bittersweet, well, bitter. The beer is fluid chocolate. Mild carbonation, silky mouthfeel, maybe a bit watery. Bittersweet aftertaste, probably the best part of this beer. Altogether well balanced, moderate, harmonic, but I could not find the complexity for a higher score. Maybe it was too old (I opened the bottle two weeks after rhe Best Before date...).
(Retasted on 8 August 2015): Well, I was probably too critical, this is a very fine beer and also has some complexity,  after all...

Negra opaca, con 3-4 dedos de espuma ocre. Aroma marcado a chocolate. Cuerpo ligero-medio y baja de carbonatación, lo que la hace muy bebible. Ricas maltas le otorgan un sabor potente y rico. Dulce y cremosa en el primer contacto, para evolucionar a un amargor seco y largo de cacao y algo de café. Buen postgusto. Muy rica como norma de la casa. Otra buena Fuller. De las mejores porter.

500ml bottle shared with lots of people at Savori. Aroma: soya, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. App: clear dark brown, minimal beige head,little lacing. Taste and palate: some cacao and dark chocolate in mouth, medium creamy body, slightly sweet, light bitter and smokey finish. Overall: good but prefer my porter more smokey.

L:
-pours a very dark brown with ruby tinges and a small,frothy,khaki head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-Coffee,bready,mocha,chocolate
T:
- bready,huge coffee finish
F:
-low-medium carbonation,medium body
O:
An absolute classic,if youre looking to drink your first Porter,drink this and let this be the baseline all other Porters will be judged at.
From bottle. Doesnt fail expectations. As advertised, silky creamy. Great body. Possibly the best porter around.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 À mon avis surestimée.Une bonne porter, goût très chocolaté, peu amer. Un arrière bouche fumé. Et pas grand chose de plus. De fait, peu de longueur.
Plutôt agréable à boire, pas trop amère.
Can from Systembolaget. Creamy, beige head. Coffee colored body. Smells of dark bread, roasted coffee beans, nuts. Tastes of coffee,chocolate, vanilla, dark bread, grainy and hoppy. Sweet and bitter.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Dark brown color, with a small beige head. Smell is roasted malts, some coffee, earthy. Taste is first roasted malts, good ones, not at all too roasted but nicely balanced, coffee, some chocolate, even licorice and in the end it comes a nice bitterness from the hops. Good body, nice balance, very good dark ale.

Wygląd: Bezowa, drobno ziarnista, kremowa piana. Opada pozostawiająć na szkle koronkę. Utrzymuje się dość długo. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta.
Aromat: Na pierwszym planie kawa i lekkie kakao. Gdzieś w tle nuty wędzone (chociaż to raczej palone słody, tylko na początku mi się tak skojarzyło), i śliwkowe. Wyczuwalny również jest karmel.
Smak: Palone słody, kawa, gorzka czekolada, wanilia. Dość wytrawne i średnio wysycone.
How : bottle Appearance : almost black, small tanned head. Aroma chocolate, caramel, coffee, vanilla, black sugar, raisins and dark berries. Palate : medium body, soft carbonation.
Black, aroma of chocolate, some sourness and a bit of coffee, tan head, low/medium body.

Pours almost black, tan head.
Smells of liquorice, espresso, chocolate.
Good balance between sour and bitter. Thin body, early ending. Interesting metallic after-taste.

Nicely complex with smooth lightly sappy elements of coffee, roast and chocolate throughout. Development allows for all these tastes to come through individually over the time of the glass though at the same time the beer works as a well balanced whole. Still as good as always.

Pours deep ruby from 12 oz with thin off white head. Caramel, molasses, and chocolate aroma. Sweet cocoa flavor with dry lingering bitterness. Medium full body with low carbonation. Wonderful rich porter with signature cocoa flavor. Loved it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, bread
Taste: light bitter, light sweet, chocolate, grain, bread, coffee
ALmost perfect. Great real British porter - with great apperance, taste and aroma!

Bottle thanks to klim, Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of beige head. Aroma of dark malts, flavored chocolate, weak caramel and roasted malts. Taste is roasted and sweet. Notes of cocoa beans, weak coffee grains and roasted malts. Decent porter!
50cl @ bottle. Porter inglese veramente ottima. Facilmente bevibile e ottima anche come dessert.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black with a medium dark brown head. Aroma is pretty malty, chocolate, light roast, some caramel, light coffee. Taste is chocolate, bitter, sweet, malty, some hop bitternes, dry licorice finish.

50cl. transparent dark brown colour with ruby reflections. rich beige head. proper lacing adorns the glass decently. aroma of roasted malts, coffee and cocoa. taste is chocolate, roasted bread and coffee, distinct bitterness. medium to high carbonation. very good beer

Bottle from Waitrose.

Pours dark brown with ruby tinge. Half finger tan coloured head. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, coffee and some smoke. Initial smokey taste, then chocolate, coffee, molasses giving some sweetness, light orange too. Very nice.

Pours a deep red with a shallow, tan head. Minerally up front and some honey and light chocolate while cold. Add sugar cookies, caramel, and molasses as it warms. Flavour is of cocoa powder, cherries, cinnamon, and all spice. Off sweet finish and a medium bodied, slightly sticky mouthfeel.
Not a bad porter, but I find it a bit thin and dont like the palate. Worth a go, though. Pretty bland label, suits the beer.

Chocolate malt aroma. Fine foam head with some thick lacing qualities over black beer. Flavour is dark malt, cocoa, with some herbal hoppy bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with subtle carbonation, slightly oily and astringent. Finish is smooth as described and intensifies the flavours nicely. Overall it just gets better and better.
Butelka, sklep..Piana dobra utzrymuje się długo,piękny kolor, głęboki, lekka czekolada, orzeżwiające, goryczka dobra. Nie przepadam za angielskimi piwami aale to było dobre.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Pint Glass. Supplier: The Cambridge Arms (Bristol). Burnt woody notes.

Bottle. Has a clear, dark brown color with a light brown head. Aroma is filled with dark chocolate, liqourice and some dried fruit and toffee. Flavor of roasted bread, liqourice, coffee, dark chocolate and leather. Has a medium body, and a light bitterness. A well-balanced, roasted porter with sweet undertones. Fairly easy-drinking.
Old rating. Great porter. Dark brown pour. Bittersweet chocolate, coffee, roast, dark fruits. Creamy body. Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 Pours dark brown color, slightly haze, with stable off-white creamy head. Visually low carbonation. Aroma: intense malt aroma, which takes on coffee, bittersweet chocolate and dark fruits like prunes, plums. Both are supported with hop aroma, with notes of dark fruits and flovers.
Flavor: high malt flavors, which takes on coffee, coffee bean, bittersweet chocolate, supported with flavors of dark fruits and flavors of hops, which also takes on dark fruits.
Body is medium, texture is silky smooth, carbonation is soft. Very good porter, for sure one of the very best.
Bottle: 7-4-7-3-15=3.7, keg on inertal: 7-5-8-4-16=4.1

500 ml bottle. Today I read "84, charing cross road" so I was in the mood for a british beer, specially if its called "London Porter". Fantastic smell, chocolate, pepper, malt. Dark brown color with low cream colored head. Great taste has well, very balanced and moderated dark flavours. Fantastic! One of the best dark beers ive ever had. Run to try this one, sir.

Wow, indeed a contender for the title of "World's finest porter" although probably would not get my vote in the end. Anyway, pours an excellent mahogany accented dark brown, fluffy khaki head. Rich roasty and earthy hop aroma, very fresh and pleasant. The flavor is impeccably classic porter, coffee, chocolate malt, bitter fuggle hops, strong with a caramel creamer espresso finish. Biggest downside is the thin mouthfeel, did not achieve the creamy full-bodied texture as advertised and as I would have preferred. A great beer, just needed more body to match the full flavor; mouthfeel is the only aspect keeping this beer from greatness.

Dark brown color with brown head. Aroma is clear roasty malt with some sweetness in it. Taste is light bitter and a bit sweet, and it has a perfekt balance. Body is tiny bit too thin, and thats the only negative Think to say about this beer. Very enjoyable beer.

Pours dark brown with medium light brown head
Aromas of bitter chocolate, coffee, brown bread, ash, dark fruits
Taste nice well balanced with brown ssugar, chocolate, caramel, dark bread
Nice and dark, smooth initially with a bit of a caramel finish. No wonder it had such a reputation, it if well earned.
UPDATED: JUN 16, 2015 this beer has everything before you even taste it the aroma and color looks great. It is a perfect balance of bitter and sweet. Top beer for sure
11.12.2014. Dark brown. Mild malty aroma. Taste is slightly roasty, slightly malty and some bitterness in finish. A bit too thin.

0,5 bottle. Appearance: Dark brown, with a minimal off-white small head. Aroma: chocolate, prunes, caramel, roasted malts and light licorice tones.
Taste: Light sweet, gentle bitterness, Light licorice tones, with a decent roastyness, chocolate, licorice and quite some prunes, some coffee aftertaste. 
 Soft carbonation, medium body.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 Cela fait parti de mes bières favorites. Elle a un arôme complexe, elle sort de lordinaire. Bien entendu, le goût café-chocolat ressort et cela est fort agréable. Je pense quil ne faut pas la boire trop froide. Sa robe est typique, elle est noire et opaque. Bien entendu, cela reste un avis personnel, il est vrai que je préfère les porter séches et amer que sucrées. En la rebuvant, ce soir, on peut également noter une note finale de vanille et une faible note de whisky. Elle est équilibrée avec une dose de houblon et malt grillé. Ce neat que du bonheur.

Jest ok, ale bez większego szału. Aromat kawowy, słaby. Po przelaniu do butelki czuć metaliczny zapach. Wygląd średni - piana słaba, szybko znika. W smaku również szału nie ma - lekko wodniste, przyjemna goryczka. Jakoś nasze rodzime portery bardziej mi smakują.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours black, nose is chocolate milk, toffee, light coffee, taste is dry, toffee, caramel, chocolate, coffee.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Very good beer. Wonderful rich nose with bold chocolate. Dark brown/black pour with an airy thick head. Creamy smooth silky mouthfeel. Medium light body. Smooth rich balanced flavor. Sweet and roasty with a lovely dry ever so slightly bitter finish. Definitely a fan.

This was a little disappointong. We expected a little bit of porter and this was more dark lager

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Clear dense red brown. Medium head & great lace. Very lifter nose. Caramel, roasted malt, cocoa, slight smoke & clearly chocolate. Very clean. Dense but fresh. Dry, not sour and low bitterness. This beers got loads of great flavors. Creamy, silky, rich with cocoa, milk chocolate. Its balanced perfectly. 
Changed my view on Porter. Its a lot bigger & richer than the alcohol would indicate.

Nez sur des saveurs fumées, proche barbecue, un peu de chocolat, robe marron, peu de col.
Courte en bouche , finale sur le houblon.
500ml can from a supermarket in Shanghai. Pours dark brown black with a white head. Aroma of chocolate and dried fruit. Rich dry bitter cocoa finish.
Dark brown pour, thin tan head. Nose is chocolate malt. Bittersweet. Middle is dark roasted malt and mild charred wood. Finish is carbonated malt with a hop kiss.

Bottle @ Big Ben Pub, Tartu. Pours dark brown with tan head. Aroma of roasted caramel malts, some chocolate and cofee. Taste the same. Medium body, medium carbonation. Good beer if sit in pub and just wanna have some beers.Altough nothing special, just good beer.

Gust nu foarte puternic, nota finala de caramel, cereale coapte si cafea
Caramel, coffee, roasty

0,5 bottle. Pours very dark brown colour with minimal off-white mostly diminishing head. Aroma of chocolate, prunes, caramel, roast. Soft carbonation, medium body, drinkable. Flavour is smooth, light sweet, light bitter, with decent roastness, chocolate, coffee-like astringent aftertaste. Medium long finish. Fantastic porter, cant find proper words to fully describe it.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 tiefdunkelbraun, fast schwarz, im Licht leicht rötlich schimmernd. In der Nase wundervolle Röstaromen, Kaffee und dunkle Schokolade. Geschmacklich kommt die Schokoladennote sehr gut und stimmig zur Geltung ohne parfümiert zu wirken. Erinnert auch wegen der leichten Süße an schokolierte Mokkabohnen. Eine angenehme Bitternote untermalt diesen tollen Gechmack und leitet den lang anhaltenden Abgang an.
Toll!
Bardzo dobre. Doskonałe ciemne słody z czekoladą i kawą. Finisz z lekką goryczką.

Bottle from Kaufhof, Mannheim. Clear mahogany with persistant white head. Complex aroma - dried fruit, coffee, cocoa powder. Taste is the same, lots going on - starts with roasted malt bitterness, then fruity notes merge with coffee and tobacco or leather flavours. Right on the money.

Brune assez foncée, reflets rouges. Mousse beige foncée persistante. Gros lacings. Magnifique.
Puissant toastage chocolat. Un peu fumée. Fruits rouges. 
En bouche chololat noir-café. Un poil sucré caramel. Sécheresse. Peu damertume dûe au toastage, mais bien là pour la balance. 
Très bonne Porter.

Barwa głęboko rubinowa. Piana drobnopęcherzykowa, średnio trwała, koronkuje bardzo dobrze. W aromacie palony słód i czekolada. W smaku czuć mocno palony słód, czuć gorycz. Piwo jest gęste, treściwe, z gorzką czekoladą na końcu. Na języku szerokie, wysycenie niskie, goryczka zalegająca.

Butelka, barwa ciemna, wiśniowa, klarowna. Piana szybko znika. Aromat wiśni w czekoladzie, orzechy laskowe. W smaku wspomniana wiśnia w czekoladzie, kawa. Piwo jest niesamowicie aksamitne, głębokie w smaku, pełne pomimo niskiej zawartości alkoholu. Goryczka niska lecz bardzo dobrze komponuje się w całość. Świetne piwo!

Pours the color of dark chocolate with a sticky, buff-colored lingering head that leaves better than average panes of lace. The smell is the best part of this beer, and is deep and complex: dark fruits, melted chocolate, light roast coffee. The flavor is more straightforward than the nose: heavy dry roasted flavor, with hints of dark fruits. A small amount of bitterness, with a sweet and nutty finish. Medium/thin body, creamy mouthfeel. Please sir, I want some more!

Bottle. Pitch black colour with ruby reflexes, quickly diminishing head with poor lacing. Aroma is intensive dark chocolate, some herbal hops, slightly burnt, a touch of prune, liquorice and pralines. Light bitterness, no sweetness, after some time becomes slightly sour, which is not very pleasant. Soft carbonation, medium body, thick texture. Fantastic!
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of milk chocolate, a burnt note in there aswell, caramel. Flavour is malty, roasty with chocolate and some bitter hops. Nice lingering aftertaste.

This is a dark as porter should be with mahogany glints in the bottom of thr glass and a creamy covering of head. The aroma is pleasantly chocolatey with cocoa and oatmeal. Its hard to put together a string of words that adequately describe how delicious this smells. If it is the last thing my sense of smell picks up in my lifetime, Ill be satisfied if it stays there. The body is mild and brings forth plenty of salty licorice and molasses. It is warming and fulsome. Ideal autumnal beer. I can well imagine a case of this on a wintery night at the beach house listening to the waves lashing the rocks.

Bottle, pours black with an off white head. Loads of dark chocolate,espresso, toast, liquorice, nuts, caramel, touch of cream. Light sweet, medium bitter, creamy, almost silky soft. Lasting hoppy bitter finish. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 11.2 oz. bottle from BevMo. Pours opaque black with a small, caramel colored head. Nose of roasted malts with a hint of chocolate. Taste of roasted malt, caramel, black coffee and bittersweet chocolate. Light carbonation. A ton of flavor makes this more of a sipping beer. Wonderful balance. A classic porter.
Draught at "na 7. schode", Zilina. Clear, ruby/ brown colour with small brown head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate bit nuts. Taste is light bitter, with some acidic notes, turns into medium bitter.

Bottle. Pours in dark body with tan head. Aroma is light caramel, toffe, light fora even, toasty. Taste has high caramel toffee sweetness with medium earthy bitterness. Body is medium, medium to low carbonation. Not bad actually.

Hand pumped tap (apparently not cask though) - average size foamy head, very dark brown color, nice medium roasty malt aroma and flavor, fair earthy hop balance, almost creamy finish - very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0,50L. Have this one many times, but obviously forgot to rate it. Clear, dark amber - ruby brown colour with small, frothy, light brown head. Nice aroma of dark chocolate, strong coffee and roasted nuts. Taste is light bitter with some acidic notes at the start and turns to a medium bitter with a lot of chocolate and coffee. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Very good, rich and smooth. 
P.S.: Canned version is poor and watery, not even shadow of bottled version.
Blind sampel @ Systembolaget tasting. Brown with tan beige head. Sweet, roasted and chocolate aroma. Burnt bitter/roasted flavour with some coffee. Thin mouthfeel, lasting bitterness.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Wauv. En super dejlig porter.Jeg vil gerne cykle langt for denne øl. Dejlig mørk skum

probably my favorite brew in the world. almost fully black with a pinch of ruby hue, nice tan head. dark chocolate and coffee aroma. milk and dark chocolate taste going through macchiato to roasted coffee finish. a crescendo of roastiness! dryish coffee finish. full- body, quite creamy. God, I love it!

caramel, bread, chocolate, nuts, roasty, resin, herbs, dough, leather, earthy, licorice, raisin, woody, vanilla, red, brown, clear, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, an ashy flavor [good], medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Deep ruby color with thin off white head that disappears quickly spite medium carbonation. Aroma is complex with an even chocolate, coffee, roasty, and spice character. Flavor is rich with a mild bitterness that is quite buried under a thick layer of malty, chocolate, coffeeness. Flavor is lingering but smooth clinging to the malty, chocolate, coffeeness. Excellent beer and top example of a tradition English Porter.
Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours dark brown with beige head. Roasted malts and chocolate in aroma. Flavor is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Bitterish finish.

500 ml, from can. About 15 degrees C. Little to medium nitrogen foam. Deep, dark red colour. Medium carbonation. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate on the smell. Complex taste, a lot of chocolate, coffee and bread notes. Excelent beer!

DATE TASTED: January 17, 2015... GLASSWARE: Barley Creek pint ... OCCASION: Silver Linings Playbook watching requires a comparable libation.. APPEARANCE: ruby black body; brown, fizzing, simmering head; holds to a quarter-inch that sits throughout; attractive... AROMA: robust chocolate, coffee, and that peat scent that is undeniably porter; light and alluring... PALATE: milky, silky smooth; an unbelievably agreeable beer to sip--I found half the glass drained before I even began the palate/taste analysis...TASTE: as lactic and chocolaty as a porter could be; the hops balance this extraordinarily; sugary and sweet--a dessert in a bottle...OVERALL: God, what a joy it is to revisit the greats; a beer this fluid should not be this flavorful and enjoyable...
I like it bitter, fullers London porter gives me what I like, with the added bonus of honey after taste
Marrom, pouquíssima espuma. Aroma de café, caramelo, cacau, toffee. Amargor baixo, retrogosto doce. Nota baixo devido ao fato da cerveja estar oxidada.

Bottle at home from McHughs,Dublin clear dark ruby brown with dates and sultana on the nose. Milk chocolate and toast undertones. Full body, zippy carbonation, tannic, dry, fruity, creamy, coffee, a little bitter in finish. Decent but not on same tier as cask version.

Malty aroma, dried friuts a hint of liquorice
in the mouth malt, bitter cocoa, quite a sexy fine bitterness.
Thin burnt body. Almost watery but hops still there. Round. Balanced and drinkable but bit boring.

Een bijna zwart bier zonder echte schuimkraag. De neus is veelbelovend: ruikt naar basterdsuiker en koffie. In de mond is het aroma rokeriger: karamel en as. Smaak is behoorlijk bitter en licht zuur. Weinig koolzuur, textuur is wat slap en waterig. Medium body.
Dark crystal liquid. Caramel, dark molases. Average finish. Medium body, light carbonation. Good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Malt aromas with hints of chocolate and coffee. Flavor is similar.

Black brew with no head, just some lace that fades away. Smells of chocolate malts and a small hint at some grassy hops. Taste comes on strong with chocolate malts but then there is a roasted flavor following closely behind. Nicely balanced. Body is a touch thin for me. Pretty decent porter and I should expect the higher price being an import, but since I have had just as good if not better porters for less price this one is a one time deal.
UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Its an awesome english porter. Youll enjoy it if you like the smells of roasted coffee and this kind of beers. Personally I enjoyed this one very much.
Rich porter. Suddenly a lot of bitterness in the taste and not too much chocolate and coffee. Good aftertaste.

Dark brown with a little beige head. Aroma is earthy, cocoa, coffee and roasted malt. Rich coffee and cocoa taste, bread, english hop, some notes of olives. Bitter aftertaste. Great beer but could be better with less carbonatation.

Nesten sort, med tett, brunt skum. Deilig, myk aroma av fløtekaramell, kakao, rosin og malt. I munnen kommer det frem bitre kaffetoner og et mørkt, fyldig maltpreg. Dette er et realt øl. God balanse med friskhet og lett sødme.
Black, medium white head. Caramel, roastiness and chocolate on the nose. Full-bodied chocolatey bitterness with hints of coffee and caramel. Finishes tingly, warming and lightly bitter. Lovely.
Very nice Malty smell, slightly reddish appearance, dark roasted taste, slightly chocolaty, slightly coffee, smooth...very slightly bitter finish

33cl embossed bottle. Such a shame I havent tried this before, but well there it was sitting on the singles shelf waiting for me. BB 6/15. Pours a dark brown with a tan head that doesnt leave much lacing.The aroma is an interplay of fruity and nutty with cocoa and coffee notes sprinkled in. Flavor is toffee, fullers yeast, again nuts, toasted grain, metal, subtle fruit and spices. Even vanilla in there. And it tastes fresh. Complex as they come, smooth and easy drinking. Right up there with Founders.
Bottle. Brown, small brownish head. Aroma of malt, raisin and caramel. Taste of malt, hazelnut, caramel and chocolate. Mildly bitter aftertaste.

In bottle. Dark brown. Red shadows. Beige head non persistent. At nose fairly intense, not very persistent. Roasted malt, coffee, a bit of dark chocolate, hezelnut, raisin. Medium body, soft carbonation. Sweet entry, very tasty in its roasty flavours, a bit dry final

shared with Konfuzzi. Aromas of toast, mild near fruity bitter chocolate, coffee, a tender touch of dark toffee, and maybe a hint of herbal/earthy hops. Taste makes them all reappear, this time with that obviously yeast-derived ripe sour cherry keynote. Subtle but pronounced coffee and bitter chocolate roast aftertaste. A thoroughly balanced, utterly fine Porter!

Pour is very dark brown with a thin off-white cap. Nose is dark caramel/fruit, some roasted grain and chocolate. I pick up more chocolate and roasted grain on the tongue than on the nose. I find it a bit thin, but its got a nice bitter finish that lingers. Quaffable

black color, off white head, smells of coffee, light smoke, caramel. medium body, good carbonation, tastes of coffee, chocolate, some sweetness but also bitter. long good bitter aftertaste. very smooth.
Dark brown pour with a healthy foam head. Nice dark chocolate nose. Taste is chocolate, roast, and cashews. Tasty.
Ive really enjoyed this one. Very balanced flavor and a good aftertaste. Not too strong or thin as some other porters id had.
500ml bottle. Dark chocolate brown with decent tan head. Roasted, malty aroma with some caramel. Taste of slight bitter coffee first but mellows quickly - some sweetness in there.

Pours a quite deep black color, topped with an average tan colored head. Standard pleasant roasted aroma, notes of caramel and coffee can also be picked up. Sweet start, roasty with some little bitterness and coffee notes later on. More than decent, this one.
de couleur tres foncer elle a un tres chocolater et sa goute un peu le lait au chocolat c est un porter qui un gout onctueux une a pas trop amertume
Bottle at home, 7th December 14. Dark, rich smooth. Good for the ABV, enjoyed it, not a patch on the Kernel Export Stout I had after though.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Tumbler glass.

The porter at his finest ! Great, wonderful beer, nothing more to say about it !

Go try it !
In fles van 0.5liter. Donker van kleur met een matige schuimkop. Smaak chocolade/koffie achtig in een mooie balans...aanrader!
0.5l bottle at home. Dark colour. White head. First impression : caramel, coffee, somewhat smoky. Tastefully!

Bottle, 500ml. A light brown colour with a small head. Aroma is sweet and malty with blackberry notes. Flavour is rich with mocha and Christmas cake - sweet, very malty and fruity. Moderate carbonation. Delicious.

Bottle, 50 cl. Pours a dark brown, almost black. Has a big, brown, fairly long lasting head. Aroma is very malty. Chocolate, roasty and caramel malts. A hint of hops as well. Dark chocolate, slight coffee, and overall nice, dark and roasty. Taste has a fairly high chcolaty bitterness up front, but turns more sweet and mellow pretty fast. Ends of with a bit of roasty and hop bitterness. smooth, medium full body and medium carbonation.

Pours dark with a small tan head which quickly dissipates. Looks a lot like cola. Malty aroma with a hint of roastiness. Very soft taste with slightly bitter end. Slick mouthfeel, little carbonation but enough to have it tingle the tip of your tongue. Very nice porter, not too complicated but an easy to drink and enjoy.
Pours dark with slight tan head. Deep roast burnt malt flavours. Medium mouthfeel. Roast burnt malts chocolate flavours

roasty, chocolate, some coffee in aroma; black, opaque, weak dark red reflexes, medium beige foam; medium sweetness, medium bitterness; medium body, quite thick feel, average carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very good beer, quite high drinkability, balanced

Butelka. Aromat karmelu, espresso, czekolady. Kolor ciemny bursztyn prawie nieklarowny, wysycenie srednie do wysokiego, minusy za brak piany. W smaku karmel, biszkopt, przypalony spód od ciasta, orzechy laskowe, słodka czekolada. Przyjemna kawowa goryczka, bardzo sesyjne piwo, wysycenie mogloby byc ciut nizsze. Jak na angola to wyjątkowy rarytas, polecam.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a soapy head. Aroma of burnt toast with a hint of chocolate. Taste like almonds. Pretty smooth and easy to drink.

Taste is full of chocolate, coffee, and toasted bread. So much flavor from this beer and a medium bitter aftertaste. Long finish of chocolate notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
A coffee coloured porter with low head. Aroma is malty, roasted, coffee. Taste is light bitter sweet. Low carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Bottle, 500 ml. Pours very dark ruby with a small amount of soapy tan head which doesnt stick around too long. Aroma consists of strong notes of dark malts, slightly burnt wholemeal toast and black coffee, with smaller notes of dark fruits, toffee, molasses and dark chocolate. Edges of wood and earth throughout, but the big note is still that toasty one. Taste is a fine sweet/bitter balance; the caramel, muscovado sugar and molasses square off against the dark roasted malts and black coffee with neither side emerging as a clear victor. Finish is a bit sweeter overall with a lingering beady, cereal-y yeast note. Body approaches full with no watery characteristics whatsoever, while the texture is still relatively thin and lightly carbonated. Somehow quite refreshing, all things considered! More or less the gold standard for what a good porter should be, going some way to living up to its extremely high regard. 

Edit 17/03/2016: detecting a little bit of roasted nut and vanilla in the taste now (towards the end) and more chocolate fudge cake on the nose as it warms up. Still ridiculously drinkable despite the extensive flavour profile!

On tap poured dark brown w/ med tan head. Moderate roasty sweet malts. Initial taste is moderate sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are almonds, dark chocolate, toast, and rich malts. Full bodied yet easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beer engine pour at Khyber Pass. Was billed as a cask draft but as the dark ruby brown pour was clear under bright light it must be the pasteurized version. Regardless, a great traditional English Porter. Large frothy beige head. Complex subtle notes coming from the dark roasty malts. French coffee and cigars. Leather jacket. Cocoa toffees. Hints of dark stone fruit. Faintly sweet and bitter. Has a remarkably creamy body and dry finish. Feels both effortlessly light and notably substantial.

Very dark brown color, very little head.

Roasted coffee aroma. Hops pretty subdued.

Fairly light body for a Porter. Very slight oily texture. Moderate carbonation. Finish is moderate in length, some carbonation.

Taste has just a tad of sweetness, overall a nice balance.

In summary this is a pretty good, though not great beer. I would like to see a bit more complexity.
Nice dark brown pour with a light tan head. Dark chocolate and caramel aroma. Flavor matches. Very smooth. Excellent.

Poured from can, deep dark brown with low creamy beige head. Aroma is complex and inviting, notes of chocolate, coffee, dark bread and syrup. Taste is bitter sweet with notes of toffee, caramel, dark chocolate and coffee. Nice bitterness in the finish.

Tap @ the Taphouse Sydney. Black with a small creamy head and solid lacing. Aromas of dark chocolate and earthy, nutty coffee. Incredibly complex flavour profile of chocolate and coffee malts interlaced with earthy, bitter hops. A thoroughly English porter. Magnificent beer. The best porter I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 500 mL, already knew london pride although not its porter, had to try it, and gotta say, so delighted with the decision. pours on a pint, brown head that lingers for a bit, deep dark, no light passes through, smells strong, hoppy and since there, can expect some complexity, 1st sip is a loud "mmm!" ... enters with some bitter chocolate but quite easy to drink and then some smoke coffee, after it there is a cereal sensation that stays for a moment with its quite balanced bitterness. is the best porter ive drank and may look for more of those. Awesome beer.

Black-brown body, beige head, many fields of lacing.
Aroma; coffee, dark chocolate, flourish dark hops, cocoa, notes of liquorice, prunes, raisin, fruit peels.
Taste; fruity dark chocolate, some hops, cocoa powder, nuts, almond, roasted dark juicy malts all over. Finishes with dark chocolate, coffee notes, flourish hops notes. Good enough body, soft carbonated, no holes. Overall decent porter, I would say.
[50cl brown special bottle, abv5.4%, BB06MAR15]
500ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of roastiness, coffee and a hint of smoke. Good combination of sweetness and bitterness.
Deep red brown color, beige head. Roasted malt nose, licorice, coffee, dried fruit, burnt sugar. Coffee and licorice taste, milk chocolate, nuts, dry finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle 330ml. Clear deep red with small beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, cherry, milk chocolate, coffee notes, light sweetness, a bit spicy. Sweet chocolate flavor, dark fruits, cherry, caramel, light hoppy bitterness. light carbonation, light to medium-bodied.

Bottle. Deep aroma of roast, chocolate and a musty earthy note reminiscent of mushrooms. Slightly salty, soy sauce-like taste, soft, creamy mouthfeel. Slightly sweet, light to medium bitter. Initially the aftertaste has some coffee, then it shifts to chocolate. Very good.

Deliciously Dark

chocolate, brown, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter,
Can in Slovenia. Pours dark brown with a tan head. The aroma is bread, caramel, coffee, some hops. The flavour is smooth malt, coffee, chocolate, bread. Light-medium body. Very drinkable.
Mørk brun farve med beige skum- Lukt av røstet malt, kaffe, bek og lakris. Smak av sjokolade, kaffe, tobakk og humle. Lett bitter ettersmak. Vinmonopolet.
Duft av noe krydder, røyk og frukter. Dyp mørk brun farge, nesten sort. Lite skum, tynn ring langs kant. Smak av røyk, sjokolade og frukter.
Bottle pour is coffee-black. Light, malty, cocoa nose. Palate is rich, dark, pumpernickel bread, finishing off dry and refreshing. Overall, an outstanding porter.

Drink cool 10-12°C.
Eye: Pours a dark but clear reddish-brown with a small white and rapidly dissipating head and almost no carbonation.
Nose: very complex in the nose. smells sweet but lots of dark roasted malts as well. coffee, sweets, also fruit but nothing distinctive really, spices and licorice in the end.
Mouth: dark bread, pumpernickel, roasted hazelnuts, just a bit watery and metallic and just one sip.
Palate: hazelnuts and dark malts.
Overall: very nice porter, but unfortunately not the best or finest in the world, had better ones for my taste. not as complex in the mouth or palate and couldnt get fruit except for the nose.

In bottiglia. Colore marrone scuro, con qualche riflesso rubino. Schiuma poco presente e poco persistente. Aroma di tostato, vaniglia, liquirizia, cioccolato. Al palato bassa carbonazione, corpo medio/leggero, sentori corrispondenti a quelli trovati nellaroma con finale un pò troppo abboccato che alla lunga non facilita la bevuta.

On tap. Pours a deep brown with a tan head and lacing. It has a solid dark malt and toast aroma with a flavor that is malty with a great toast and coffee finish over a medium, smooth body.

500ml bottle poured in a chalice.
Super-classic British Porter. Simple and delicious beer.
A: Pours a clean dark brown color with a big and bubbled beige to brown head which disappears leaving many lacings around. Beautiful
S: Simple. Roasted malts, basically
T: Wonderful. Smooth. Deliciously bitter. Brown bread, some notes of chocolate. Roasted malts, yeasts and hops in the end

[ BA Review @ 9/11/2010 ]
Vloeibaar hout. Een heel straf, donker, eentonig bier. Je moet hiervan houden.
Hard to argue with the ratings on this beer. Complex and rich while avoiding the unbalanced overly complex character of lesser porters.
Delicious, sweet porter with lots of roast and chocolate flavours coming through. Nice. Tasting at Plonk.

Single from total wine and a tick off the most ratings list. This one may not be as good as it rates in my book but it is still a surprisingly good beer. Unique with the roasty malt and bitter English hops on the finish. Lots of bittersweet coffee. Like a lot. Creamy texture. Really nice for being so easily available.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 500ml bottle bb10/2014. A velvet deep oak brown to black pour, faint beige but lush cap. Immediately appealing aroma of wood-cured molasses, liquorice, tar, filter coffee. This pleasantness turns into sheer, hands-down revelation upon taking a first sip of this bodied, yet creamy, light velvet Wiener mélange of a porter that pushes all buttons: bitter chocolate meets cigar tobacco, strong espresso and charred red berries. Elegant finish adding some distinct hop character and combining all those flavours in a dry coda, preparing you for the next sip or new glass. World class. // Rerate 2015-2016-5 (BL1): well-paced complexity when enjoyed as room temperature (14C): bitter chocolate, roasty to even smoked notes (sourdough bread crust, tobacco, ash), caramels. A masterpiece in balance between body, an almost lager-like sessionability and depth of flavour.

Aroma: caramel and toffee, hint of chocolate and coffee. Maybe toasty.
Appearance: dark brown with a light brown head. 
Taste: the best part! Toasty malt and caramel, coffee, and maybe toffee. 
The aftertaste is very different from the taste and is strongly toasted. 
Overall, an excellent beer, good for cold weather and very drinkable. Awesome!

Couleur noire avec forte mousse beige. Bon nez malté, chocolaté avec note café et tourbe. Gout malté, chocolat noir, note grillées, caramel, fruits noirs legers. Bien ronde et longue en bouche. Corps un peu leger, mais aromes biens complexes et intenses. Pas mal

Aroma is roasty. Chocolate. Earthy. 
Pours a dark brown. Tan head.
Taste is caramel... chocolate. Metallic. Roasty. Oak. Super complex. Very true to the style.
Palate is smooth. Hops are earthy. Fade well. 

Really solid beer. True to the style and nails it.
Highly enjoyable with lots of chocolate, caramel and roasted malts. Fairly high in carbonation and a wee bit on the watery side.

500 mL can. Pours the darkest brown you can think of, light passes only on the edges of the glass. A massive head of mocha foam sits on top and never leaves. Leather, earth, chocolate, spicy hop and mildly roasty malt character. Bitter roast through and through with a touch of caramel sweetness. Finishes just on the bitter side of rounded. Moderate body with modest carbonation. See this at the LCBO all the time and never bothered to grab one until now--glad I did.

Espuma cremosa, cor castanho claro com boa formação e persistindo uma fina camada até o fim.

Quanto a cor. apresentou a característica cor marrom escura e intensa, com um certo brilho avermelhado.

O aroma foi o que mais se destacou nesta cerveja. Aroma de malte torrado, alcoólico e intenso, um pouco doce. E muito bom!

Sabor inicialmente me pareceu com mel... Seguido por sabor de malte queimado e álcool. Final bastante amargo, com notas de café torrado.

Bem intensa essa cerveja. Não creio que seja possível tomar mais que uma delas por vez sem sofrer as consequências. 

No final, "pediu" para que eu comesse algo doce.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Birra che si presenta Marrone scuro, come una tavoletta di meravigliosa cioccolata al latte sciolta e riproposta in lattina, quasi fosse un incantesimo di Harry Potter. Bevuta in lattina, presentava una meravigliosa schiuma beige fine e cremosa manco fosse il cappelli di un italianissimo cappuccino. Al naso è molto spoglia, , con odori però abbastanza distinti : orzo tostato, caffè, qualche avvisaglia di cioccolato fondente o magari di biscottini al cioccolato. Alla stessa bocca si presenta nella medesima maniera, proprio per sottolineare la sua coerenza. Ancora orzo tostato, caffè e leggero cioccolato; una porter che ha un corpo da medio a leggero, e riesce ad essere molto ?scorrevole? senza risultare mai troppo acquosa, mantenendo sempre un?ottima intensità dei sapori.  Poco carbonata e correttamente secca, termina con un retrogusto amaro e tostato dove troviamo, per finire in bellezza, caffè, una nota di ?cenere? ed anche una, molto sottile, di vaniglia.  Godibilissima

Bra rostad porter! Trevlig len, kroppen är ganska lätt för en porter. Mycket smak. Choklad bla. Fint!

Bottle from some shop in Tallinn harbour. Pours a dark brown whereas in the glass its black with a red glare. Head is creamy and laces well. Nose is a thrilling dark roastiness and coffee with sweeter cocoa and chocolate notes, and some caramel in the distance. Taste is at first coffee roastiness and chocolate sweetness, then continuing with a fairly pronounced hop-driven bitterness. Medium body, carbonation is quite flat, finish on the dry side. Its really good, and whats especially good about it - its widely available! The kind of beer I keep returning to.

Chocolate, coffee, leather, bread and toast in the aroma. Almost black with a red tint. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full body with a soft carbonation. Overall a rich Porter with layers of flavours. Brilliant!

BBD 11/15/14. Clear pour that is almost as dark as a stout, but has a dark ruby cast. Slightly below average head volume and retention, but laces well. Nice nose of caramel, coffee, toffee and a slight burnt chocolate smokiness. Medium bodied with a texture that approaches creamy. Slightly below normal carbonation with just a touch of effervescence on the finish. The excellent flavor profile is complex and balanced. It begins with coffee then flows into a light caramel sweetness coupled with toffee. Hops come forward in the middle with a light flavor and bitterness over a smoky chocolate. The finish is somewhat dry and leaves you with a lingering chocolate smokiness with a mineral character.
Pours black. Aroma and taste are chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts. Great tasting porter.

Bottle. Beige head. Darkbrown to Black. Aroma is roasted coffee, chomp, some sweetness. Taste is but burned, roasted coffee again, vanila. Spicy, bitter and dry finish. Body is medium to thin. Great porter. Looking forward to the tap.

Bue en bouteille de 50cl, couleur marron, mousse moyenne effervescence inexistante, une bière très café et chocolat au nez, saveur que lon retrouve en bouche mais avec un côté lait plus prononcé style café macchiato ressemble à un café frappé si cest très froid.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 Quite sweet. Chocolate, Caramel, a bit of Vanilla. full body, long finish. Lovely.
bread, chocolate, dough, leather, dark brown, clear, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, creamy, medium body, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Brown short head, some lace. Black. Highly malty, bread and roasted aroma. Sweet, strong, minerals, toffee, dark chocolate. Excellent porter, rich, complex and tasty.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a nice tan head. Big roast malt aroma, lots of chocolate too. Taste is similar with some added notes of vanilla. Nice heavy body, nice finish. Excellent.

11.2oz bottle. Deep brown-burgundy body. Thin beige head. Roasty sweet chocolate aroma. Sweet, nutty tinged brown malts. More like a Brown Ale than I had remembered. Butelka; barwa brunatna z rubinowymi refleksami. Piana drobna beżowa, ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat palonych słodów, czekoladowy, kawowy, ciemnego chleba, karmelu. W smaku delikatnie palone, kawowe, czekoladowe, chlebowe, karmelowe. Goryczka palona na średnim poziomie. Gładkie na języku.

Bottle. Dark with a big head. Its really quite rare that I smell lots of things in a beer, but here notes of dark chocolate and roasted malt seemed to fill my nose as I poured the bottle. Even my wife who is not keen at all on porter or stout beers liked the smell.
Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate as in the smell, some sweetness, a little watery maybe but I guess this is due to the relatively low alcool? 
Roasted malt dominates in the finish.

50 cc can from Systemet. 
Dark ruby body with creamy dark beige head. Heavily roasted aroma with espresso and dark chocolate.

Can. Overall nice, as advertised by the brewer: riich, dark and complex. Fine, smooth foam.

From 0,33l bottle. BBD: 19 JUN 2015. Pours clear dark brown liquid with red light reflects, small brown frothy head, Aroma: excellent, smooth creamy, light espresso, dark chocolate, cherry, plums, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, roasted malts, dark chocolate, plums, at beginning light metal off taste - perhaps from the bottle cap. Bottle @ home from Saveur-biere.com - Color: ear black beer with small carbonation and small brown foam. Smell: roasted malt domination with caramel notes. Taste: nice complexity of roasted malt and caramel with sugar cane note. Really good sensation on mouth. bottle. Aroma is roasted malt. coffee, caramel. Taste follows the same. Slight sweet followed by dry finish. Very good.

Transfer from BA review on 11-9-12-
 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  Pours a deep brown color with a one finger cream head. The head has a decent level of retention, eventually fading to give a nice level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is a wonderful blend of sweet chocolate and caramel, dark fruits of cherry, a bit of coffe and a good roasted brown bread smell. It is sweet and dark in aroma. Very nice.

 Taste  The flavor begins of more brown bread with some notes of caramel sweetness. The caramel sweetness is enhanced as the flavor moves on and is meet by some mild chocolate flavors. These flavors create a rather sweet and bready flavor. The flavor then begins to dry out ever so slightly in the end with some bitter sweet chocolate and coffee flavors coming to the tongue. The mix of all the flavors combined together well and leave a very pleasant cocoa espresso flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  For an only 5.4 % abv beer the body of the beer is on the smoother and creamier side with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. The feel is wonderful for all the dark and bittersweet flavors of the brew accentuating them and allowing them all to properly mellow on the tongue. 

 Overall  This is a fantastic brown ale. It has a great flavor with fantastic transitions. It has a great feel and a wonderful smell to boot A very good one to try if you have the chance. Delicious.

500 ml can. Clear dark brown with tanned head. Smell is sweet malt with coffee, chocolate and dried fruit. Taste starts sweet with malt, dark fruit and chocolate and continues dry with coffee, herbs and hops. Medium bitterness and low carbonation. Nice and balanced.

bottle. Deep brown with one finger head. Solid porter marred with some slight off flavorings. Maybe thats just the "complexity" that other people note, but doesnt seem quite right to me. Still, fairly enjoyable.

Bottle. Appearance is very dark, a slight brown tinge at the base. Two-finger mocha-coloured pillowy head which slowly sinks. Aroma- lots of chocolate malt, dark fruit hints, blackcurrant, liquorice, cocoa powder, milky coffee, some hops detectable. Taste is lovely- smooth, hints of dark fruits which give way to milky chocolate, some coffee, hint of espresso, hop bitterness, a bit creamy but not an overly full mouthfeel. The finish is quite long. An excellent porter.
Caramel, toast, chocolate mixed with coffee. Leaves an amazing caramel aftertaste. Amazing porter.

This should be the standard for the porter style! Carbonated dark pour w/ a thin tan head that leaves some lacing. The aroma is a delicious blend of chocolate & roasted notes. The mouthfeel is light & creamy all while carrying through this beers complex flavor! Its nearly a perfect balance between bitter & chocolate sweetness! Exceptional for the style!
Mørk rødbrun med lavt lys brunt skum. Brendt malt, sjokolade og brendt karamell. Søte smaker av sjokolade og karamell, hint av blimsterbitterhet i avslutningen. Lite kullsyre.
Well balanced. Toasted malts aroma is chocolate. Flavour is sweet at the right point.

Appearance: clear, deep brown with beige head.
Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate
Taste: chocolate, bitter, sour sour

Overall: very nice
Pours a dark reddish brown with a small, creamy, tan head. Roasted malt aroma with chocolate and coffee notes. Flavour is caramel, roasted malt, chocolate and a bitter coffee end.

Reviewed from notes. 
This was poured into a pint glass. 
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute leaving a really nice looking foamy clingy lacing sticking around the glass. 
The smell had a nice sweet to roasty to earthy chocolate maltiness combining wonderfully in a light bitter under current of coffee. Continuing on as it warms, theres a nice light vanilla arising to complement the rest of the flavors. 
The taste took all of those previously mentioned flavors and combined them pretty well. Theres no aftertaste but it has a decent dry sweet chocolate finish. 
On the palate, this one sat right at a medium on the body with a slight sessionability about it. 
Overall, I say this was a wonderful English Stout to have again.
Small to no beige head. Dark cola. Roasted & sweet. Very balanced. Tongue biting. Crisp hops. Good.

Botella de 500ml. Copa de Vino. Color ámbar oscuro con tintes rubí a contraluz. Corona bronceada que se disipa lentamente. Aromas torrefactos redondeados por matices subyacentes chocolateados y cafetosos con leves notas de caramelo quemado. Entrada maltosa con sabores de café, chocolate y ligero amargor. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Paladar cremoso y algo sedoso. Leve amargor herbal en el seco final. Notas suaves de avellana y madera se despliegan en el prolongado retrogusto. Muy bien equilibrada y deliciosa.
500ml bottle. Wine glass. Dark amber color with ruby tints to the light. Tan head & slowly dissipated crown. Roasted aromas rounded by chocolaty & coffee hints on the backside & slight burnt caramel notes. Maltous upfront with coffee & chocolate flavors. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Creamy & slight silky palate. Slight herbal bitterness into a dry finish. Light notes of hazelnut with slight woody hues are shown in a long aftertaste. Very well balanced & flavorful.

500ml bottle. Brown body with a mediun head. Chocolaty, with a low carbonation.

A pleasing beer to look at. Color is deep brown with rubby high lights. Has a tan or beige head thats about average, nothing special.
The aroma is of rich raosted malts some coffee and chocolate.
A very good tasting beer that is complex as stated on the label. 
Starts bitter roasted malt taste, then a nice belt of maybe smokey coffee and some sweet cocoa. Finishes smooth and dry in flavor, maybe even a bit of biscuit at very end. Sweet.
You would think that this beer should be thick and chewy but its surprizing light in body. Not watery.
There really is not alot to dislike about this beer.
I think the flavor and its complexity are the best part of this beer.
A little bit more foam for presentation wouldnt hurt either too.
Drink well my friends
Direi che è decisamente un buon bere, forse me lhanno data un pò troppo fredda, ma va giù che è un piacere.

Wonderful porter. The benchmark for all London Porters in my opinion. Complex and perfectly balanced. Chocolate and coffee with ideal bitterness. Lovely ruby black colour. Incredible.

Dunkle Farbe, erinnert an Cola, kaum Schaum. In der Nase starkes Röstmalz, Bitterschokolade. Am Gaumen starke Kaffeenoten, dunkle Schokolade, Malz, leicht bitter gegen Ende mit guter Balance. Weiches Mundgefühl.

12A. Brown Porter

Pours a very dark brown with a finger of light beige head. Almost like a Dry Stout on the initial aroma with delicate roasted scents. A fine example of the British style, much different than North American Porters. Fullers does a fine job and this brown bear with a crimson streak is no exception. The big tan head releases smokey, roasty, chocolate, light coffee and nutty fragrances. Its a bit sweet, a bit smoked and with a bitter balance. The curvy, medium/heavy body is like a thinner Guinness. I enjoy drinking it a bit warmer to really get the flavours out of it.

Can. Much better than I remembered it. Pours a dark beautiful oil colour, no head or carbonation to speak of. Smelled kind of like black liquorice to me. Tastes of chocolate, coffee, burnt toast, and smoke. Body is medium with a slick oily feel on the tongue. Aftertaste is of bitter coffee and it coats the tongue. Have to remember to drink this beauty more often.
I havent had this baby in years. Thinner dark brown pour. Roasty aroma, with some coffee. Caramel and chocolate, some light smokiness. Classic stuff.

Wonderful porter. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head that completely dissipates. Crazy nice aromas of dark chocolate, coffee and toffee. Nice lightly bitter taste with a few sweet malts. Lovely pillowy carbonation, bitter chocolate aftertaste.

Couleur brun-rubis avec un moyen col de mousse. Arômes: caramel, malt torréfié, levure anglaise et houblons. Saveurs : malt, malt caramélisé et malt torréfié, levure anglaise et houblons.
cereal, roasty, black, tan foam, light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, full body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2014 Dark brown, nearly black with some red touches. Compact, beige foam, but not very persistent. Chocolate, coffee and raisins highlight on the aroma, also some herbs and caramel. The taste is very rich in chocolate and coffee, also with toasted caramel, raisins and nuts. Classic English Porter. Perfect introduction to the style.

Quando parli di porter parli di una birra di questo tipo. Colore scuro impenetrabile e schiuma pannosa. Aromi intensi di cioccolato caffè e liquirizia. Ottima sensazione in bocca dovuta alla scarsa carbonazione tipica dello stile e al basso grado alcolico.
Luppolo leggero.
Finale lunghissimo e mai stancante. Una capostipite dello stile!

Pours purplish brown with a fair, creamy, beige head. Roasted malt aroma with liquorice, chocolate and coffee notes. Not over-roast. Taste light sweetness and bitter. Robust body, creamy texture. Subtle carbonation. Well balanced.

This is the typical England Porter. Smooth flavor, mild aroma, and dark color. If you want to go traditional, this is it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark reddish brown with a small, creamy, tan head. Roasted malt aroma with chocolate and coffee notes. Flavour is caramel, roasted malt, chocolate and a bitter coffee end. Medium body, rich, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Well balanced.
500 ml can from the LCBO. Pour black-ruby colour, not opaque, with tan head. Mild roasted malt on the nose. Tastes like sweet roasted malt, cola, coffee, cherry. Very nice porter.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Black with tan head. Nice licoricy touch, weak roasty, some chocolate. Very well balanced, quite dry, very easy going, roasty, chocolate, licorice, quite nice body and not that watery for the 5.4%.
Bottle 50cl. Black with a beige head. Nice nose of malt, liquorice. Rich taste with roasted malt followed by a light bitter finish. Medium length.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2014 Bottle. Aroma: chocolate, roasted malt, espresso, caramel. Chocolate/coffee flavour all the way, with hints of hops and fruits. Not very complex or bold, but Very solid and good tasting Porter.
Chocolatey, a bit of dark fruits, mild sweetness, hint of tootsie roll flavor, good stuff.
Black, with light, soft carbonation... Coffee, chocolate, a bit of fruits, very balanced. Creamy mouthfeel, very good beer!

Fruity malts, chocolate, coffee, sweet caramel, toffee, brown sugar, and almost a faint butterscotch on the nose. Incredibly drinkable. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, roastiness and faint hops. Finish leaves nice chocolatey aftertaste with slight bitterness. Beautifully balanced. I can easily picture myself drinking this as a session beer for a BBQ or steak cookout.

-jozi craft- black with creamy head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, molasses, liquor and floral hops. Creamy and round mouth feel. Aftertaste is hoppy, caramel, roasted and lingering noble hop finish. Overall: excellent. A big beer

Not much of a head but a huge salty liquorice and coffee aroma paired with dark roasty malts. Medium carbonation and body, a bit salty sour taste which is much stronger than I was expecting. Quite bitter too. Maybe a tad stronger body would suit this beer even better. Finishes smooth. Good one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2014 Invitante sin dal colore, scuro e quasi impenetrabile, carbonazione giustamente quasi assente. Al naso e in bocca note forti di caffè e cacao. Finale ricco e lunghissimo. Ottima porter. Bevuta in bottiglia ad ABC a Roma

Botle. Pours a black body, with a large white head that diminishes slowly, leaving a fair lace. Aroma of coffee mostly, with notes of chocolate. Pretty light taste, notes of coffee. Nice carbonation level, medium to full bodied, oily texture. Nice.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2015 Almost fully black, minimal tan head. Coffee and cocoa nose. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate, roasted malt . Very strong coffee finish. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. 
(Metro 0,33l bottle)

A beautifully made London Porter. Black in colour with a beige head, which is nice and firm. Adequate carbonation. Slightly burned aroma, with a taste of black treacle and coffee that is complex and mouth-filling. A long rich aftertaste. A well-balanced and great tasting beer.
Nice, hazy, dark brown color with small white head. Creamy. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, caramel. Nice bitterish coffee aftertaste. Very good.
Very dark and intense porter. It has a strong taste of dark chocolate and coffee. One of my favorites!
Bottle, pours a deep dark brown with a tan head, tastes sweet of chocolate, roasted malt, and fruit, slight bitter finish with a coffee flavor, very good porter.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Very dark brown color, almost completely black, with reddish hue and small tan head. Full body, soft carbonation. Very strong coffee aroma with dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel. Medium sweet taste with bitter finish. Excellent.

Bière brune foncée aux reflets rubis, peu effervescente et peu mousseuse. Le nez offre un bon mélange café moka / chocolat noir. En bouche, les saveurs se présentent sous un jour à la fois riche et doucereux. Les saveurs maltées sont exquises. Rien ne dépasse de la trame; tout se dessine avec minutie. Le café se corse et devient plus amer après quelques gorgées, mais rien ne dérange. En fait, il sagit dun porter exemplaire sans réel défaut si ce nest que celui dêtre conservateur au possible. Un délice Anglais.

Light body. Too much carbonation. Nice, light aftertaste.
Thats not how a porter is supposed to taste, is it?
Nothing special, this one.

Porter molt fàcil de beure ja que té poc alcohol, amb tons a caramel i a fusta.
Porter muy fácil de beber, ya que tiene poco alcohol, con tonos a caramelo y a madera.
Drank from a bottle at home. Good and sweet. Theres even some chocolate in the taste. The colour is nice but could be blacker.

500ml Bottle at home. Black colour with a small white head. Medium body, strong carbonation. Malty aroma, some chocolate, some caramel. Strong roasted aftertaste. Nothing is out, just a plain but very good Porter!

Canette de 500 ml achetée à la LCBO Rideau à Ottawa. Dégustée le 18 avril 2009 (pint). Bière noire opaque. Col épais biege crème assez durable. Assez effervescente, bulles moyennes. Légère odeur de café crème, de noix de Grenoble. Très douce, très sucrée, assez amère en finale. Goût de café prononcé, de sucre. Peut-être un peu trop douce, pas très complexe. Pas trop lourde, se boit bien.

Bottle shared with S&G.
APPEARANCE: black beer, little to no head.
NOSE: sweet, light.
TASTE: sweet, light, mocha, coffee. Watery in general.

A nice, black beer with a firm stout-like layer of foam. Nice aroma of the roasted malt. Nice bitter taste where the malt is very present. It moves on into a bitter aftertaste.

Een mooi, zwart bier met een stevige stout-achtige schuimkraag. Lekker stevige aroma van gebrande mout. Goede bittere smaak waar ook de gebrande mout weer naar boven komt, en dit gaat over in de nasmaak.

I was surprised to see that this beer scores a 100. I tasted it in a blindtaste and really didnt like it. Dark red color and watery palate. Aroma of mocca and caramel was ok. The taste is really dull though. Tasted to me like red wine with cola. Thats not what Im looking for in a porter.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 13.4.2014
Red wine aroma, malt aroma. Black body, light brown short head. Taste is complex, somewhat confusing. Citrus notes, roasted, wine, dark chocolate. Slight sour tang, bitterness. Some sweet fruit-malt notes, balancing the bitterness. Mouth fill is watery but full, carbonation is quite strong. After taste is slightly sweet with hints of malt and coffee. 
3/29/2015
Bottle 330ml. Pours dark brown with a medium tall beige head. Aroma of dark malt, roasted notes and coffee, slight fruitiness. Mouth feel is light and slightly watery with medium low carbonation. Flavor is mildly sweet with some light roasted bitterness, very well balanced. Flavors of dark roasted malt, fruity hops, bitter roastiness, sweet dark caramel, coffee. Flavors are pronounced but light. Ends nice and long, with fruity coffee and hops flavors, slight sweet. Very light and easy yet full of flavor. 
5/11/2016 
Bottle, 330ml. Flavors of chocolate, espresso, malt, sharp, sweet, floral, gentle bitterness, maple. Thick, full body, medium carbonation.

Purchased at Binnys in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a Saturday afternoon while listening to records and watching baseball. Appearance is a moderate pitch black with a thin tan head, looks nice. Aroma of nice chocolate and cocoa, light caramel. Taste goes down lightly bitter with great chocolate notes, light nut. Pretty good porter, happy to have had one of the most famous porters around!
Another excellent beer by Fullers that is a benchmark of its breed. Has everything one would be looking for in a Porter - without any of the faults/tradeoffs found in many other brews.

God forbid you ever come across this beautiful bottle as it adds way too much to the price. Classy though. 

A wonderful mouth feel and a classic. Very simple but hits the nail in the head. The chocolate notes beat out other brews that have added chocolate. All the flavors you want in your porter and zero flaws. Find it in a can and its a steal. 

I really value complexity in a beer which this definitely does not have. I feel I may have over rated this but I am going to stick by it.

Bottle from Bilka. Dark brown color with a tan head. Malty aroma with coffee notes. Flavor is malt, dark chocolate, coffee, hint of caramel. Good creamy texture. Nice smooth palate. Light bitter finish.
Dark brown body with a tan head. Malty aroma, some chocolate, some caramel. Sweet taste, notes of chocolate, coffee, some smokiness. Thick texture. Very soft carbonation. Really nice.
Awesome dark beer! Everything that beer should have is right in place. Hard to find in Russia.
This is very smooth and easy to consume. I was expecting a stronger taste but it doesnt really matter. There is the hint of familiar good sliminess that comes with Fullers ales. Approved.
5,4%. 50 cl. flaske. Mørk øl, med dejlig smag af lakrids. Fantastisk god øl.

See: Dark almost black. Minimal tan head. 
Smell: Dates, coffee hint plus sweet chocolate. 
Taste: Sweet at first, rich dark chocolate and coffee then hops and bitterness come through at the end. 
Pallet: slight zing from light carbonation. Silky and rich mouthfeel. 
Delicious!

Big nose of date, plums, molasses malt, with no apparent hops.
Pours dark brown with some ruby highlights. Big fluffy tan head, and laces well on the glass. Has delicious complexity of flavpurs from malt to molasses to various fruit-like esters. Big and thick. Caramel malt overrides, but with some chocolate and roastiness. London yeast leaves some fruity esters nd some basenmenty mushiness. Some licorice and somerasins in the aftertaste. Medium carbonation and full palate. Delicious complex beer, with a low hop level. Mm.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2014 This is a classic beer. Everything is right on. Clean aroma, good foam, great dark, yet smooth taste. Lots of roasted coffee flavor, nut, and cocoa balanced by an appreciable hop bitterness.  This is the Porter that American micros cannot duplicate. Note the subtle esters in the nose.  Just a fantastic beer!
UPDATED: JUN 27, 2014 Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color marron. Sabor a malta tostada, chocolate.
Angenehmes Röstaroma. Geschmack dann vorwiegend nach Kaffee und Schokolade, sehr ausgewogene Bittere. Schönes rundes Bier, das man auch mal über den ganzen Abend trinken kann.

สีดำเข้& ฟองน้อย& 
กลิ่นหอ หวานนิด& ขมหน่อย& หอมๆ กลิ่นไห&

Butelka 0.5L. Ciemnobrunatne, prawie czarne. Piana obfita, ładna, drobna, beżowa, dość trwała i oblepia ścianki szkła.
Aromat lekko palony, drożdżowy, chlebowy, drewniany, lekko wędzony, orzechowy. Całość przyjemna, nie bardzo intensywna i nie słodka,
W smaku dość intensywnie palony, kawa, kawa zbożowa i gorzka czekolada. Lekko kwaśne. Lekkie nuty żelaziste. Goryczka wyraźna palona.
Ciało średnie-, dość wytrawne. Wysycenie niskie do średniego. 
Pije się bardzo lekko i przyjemnie poza nutami żelazistymi na które jestem wyczulony. Bardzo dobry lekki porter, który przez wysoką paloność i lekką kwaskowatość przypomina stout.
Backlog. Fullers beers are always iconic this is no exception, a truly fine beer that is only surpassed by its cask-version.
Aroma with roasted malt, dark in color with brown/red tone. Taste of roasted malt and dark chocolate with dry finish. Good carbonation with good mouthfeel. Fine beer.
Redbrown with nice yellowish foam that lasts. Some lacing. Malt, ryebread, chockolate in the aroma. Malt,chockolate vanilla with burned bitter aftertaste. Medium body high in carbon

Bottle, 0.50l. Pours dark brown with small creamy brownish head and fair lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate with some toffee and woody notes. Taste starts with moderate sweet chocolate and roasted malt, following isslightly herbal and fruity, while finish is moderate bitter. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation in palate. You cant miss with this one...

Pours a deep brown with bright orange highlights and a tall tan head. The smell is dark roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, mild licorice and dark fruit. The taste is roasted malt, chocolate, mocha, dark fruit ending dry with a bit of molasses to balance. Medium/full in body and somewhat creamy with compact nicely done carbonation. Well, this one lives up to its reputation...an excellent beer!
Very nice,. Aroma is great, pour lacks a head, but then thats the story of my life. Fantastic bitter wash in the mouth and lovely balanced coffee, raisin, coffee notes. Mucho enjoyable.

500 ml, flaske, 5,4 % ABV, gave fra laboko - tak, 13. marts 2014.
Ibenholt-farvet engelsk Porter med 1 cm tykt moccafarvet skumtop. 
Dejlig duft af mørk chokolade og ristet malt. Noget morgenmads-duft ligeså. En smule metallisk oveni.
God traditionel porter-smag af kaffe- og mørk chokolade-bitterhed. En lillebitte sødme at spore. God smag i.f.t. alkoholstyrke. 
Et fint afstemt indhold af kulsyre, lige under middel. 
I denne %-klasse er det klart en Porter at foretrække.
Nicely complex, rich on chocolate, some smoke, and nicely balanced bitterness. Refreshing, tasty and well carbonated as well.

Bottle 0.5L.
Dark brown body with an average, frothy, tan head, mostly lasting with a fair lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty aroma (roasted, light caramel) with notes of coffee, chocolate, nuts, licorice (more evident when the beer warms up a bit) and maybe some raisins.
Moderate-to-heavy bitter flavour with light sweetness; moderate bitter finish and roasted coffee in the aftertaste. 
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

500ml can. Pour dark brown with a thin head. Deep chocolate and caramel aroma. Slight toasted oak flavour. Just a touch of bitterness on the finish and minimal carbonation. Not as nice a flavour as the aroma would have suggested. Fair but not special.
Taste is getting better by the time. Very interesting fresh spicy taste at the end. Very good porter (definitely recommend) but thats it, dont have this own something.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Almost black beer with beautiful dark ruby reflections, thick creamy head. Aroma and taste is dark fruits, coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Great finish, very drinkable. Excellent.
Uma Porter muito equilibrada. O seu amargor não se sobressai. Maltes torrados que não são enjoativos.

This is an excellent porter. 500 mL can from the LCBO. Pours a deep chocolate brown. Modest head that persists. Toffee and chocolate aromas that continue on the palate. Nice log semi-sweet finish. Delicious. It's like a dessert. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, Schokolade, Kaffee. Geschmack röstmalzig süß, Schokolade, würzig.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours with a dark red and brown color - mostly towards the latter. Thin, but creamy - cappuccino-ish - brown head. Aroma is a complex-rich mixture of clear chocolate notes, roasted malt, caramel, Liqurice, toffee, coffee, some earthy notes, hints of dust, woods and breads. Flavor follows the nose with some variations. The sweetness of roasted malt is balanced with proper, and more present earthy note - along a weak bitterness in the dry end. Chocolate as well. Not that dominant as in the nose. Soft to average carbonation. Medium bodied. Great variety nothing too dominated, albeit nothing particular worth mentioning. Just plain good Porter!
An aroma of roasted chokolate. Flavour is roasted chokolate with bitter notes and a sweet and chokolatey aftertaste. Color is dark brown with a light brown head.
Roasty/burnt flavor along with coffee, fades into a creamy chocolate milk taste. An excellent porter, one of my favorites.

Aroma: Very weak, coffiee, roasty, maybye some herbs from hops.
Apperance: Almost black, but clear beer, with small head reducing to small ring.
Taste: Beer is dry with proper bitterness. Beer has very nice flavour, i can feel some cocoa and coffiee. 
Nice palate - light body, thin texture proper for light beer. Weak carbonation makes it very drinkable.

Nice, drinkable beer.

Bottle - Dark Reddish-Brown, almost Black, in colour. Very Malty; roast/burnt malt, lots of dark bitter chocolate & espresso coffee with cream, caramel, toffee & burnt sugar. Sweet roasted malts balanced by an earthy bitter hop edge, giving a nice sweet/bitter balance. Rich, smooth, complex and full-bodied. Long roast malt and bitter chocolate finish. Fantastic beer!

50cl new straight bottle. Pours dark brown, with brown head. Dark malts, caramel, chocolate and everything that is promised is there. A good complex brew, but the texture and the body of the batch, that is bbe 30/11/2014 is just awful. I know, that it varies from batch to batch, but this time it looses to Local Estonian porters in price/quality. Expected much more from top 5 porter. Will seek it on tap in London and rerate.

Brun/Svart med lavt skum. Aroma av lakris, mild sjokolade og mild kaffe. Litt anonym. Smaken er vesentlig mer interessant, her er det kaffe og lakris, samt mild sjokolade og ristet malt. Medium konsistens. Mild bitterhet.

0.5 l bottle. Dark brown with a redish colour. Light brown medium head. Coffee, chocolate, luqourice and malts. Earthy and grass. Liqurice and coffee. Nice roasted and nutty aftertaste. Medium body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a black-brownish hue, with a one-finger cappuccino-like head. At nose classic smells of toasted malt with a bit of butterscotch. It is very well carbonated and also it leaves a nice lacing around the glass. At mouth is a bit watery, with a nice long lasting bittersweet finish. Aroma is dominated by the traditional flavours of roasted and medium roasted malts, like nuts, caramel, toffee. Overall is a nice porter, though the bottled version seems lacking of body and character, compared to the fresh cask one.
From a pint can bought at Systembolaget. Beautiful foam but unfortunately too warm when I had it but I was I a so what can you do? Quite enjoyable though and I am probably going to have it again.
La sto bevendo mentre scrivo... Una birra sublime! Qualsiasi altro commento è superfluo...provatela!!!!!

Bottiglia 50cl bevuta a casa.
Color caramello pieno con schiuma fine e persistente.
Grande tostatura al caffè, meravigliosa in bocca, carbonata in giusto.
Un must!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Très bonne Porter, j apprecie son gout malte, fort en alcool.
Soft en bouche
Hate d en connaitre d autres
had yesterday at SB party..dark,complex,smooth..very good for a lower ABV porter..

0,5 l bottle 
brown color with some red "flashes", clear and with a stable tan foam head. 
 roasty, toast, coffee, chocolate, cereal, herbs, earthy, woody, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, creamy, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Dark brown pour, tan head sweet coffee licorice smell maybe dark chocolate. Strong coffee flavor, smoky with prunish licorice background flavors. Full palate stimulation, great porter for a cheap price!

Chocolate and toffe aroma with presence of dark fruits mostly prunes and with hints of smokiness. 
Really dark with thick beige head 
Bitter roasty taste mostly coffe but with some tartness in the background. Long lasting bitter finish
Full body, soft carbonation creamy texture 
A nice go to porter that never disappoints
Dark brown pour, good sized khaki head. Roasty aroma with a bit of chocolate. Taste of toffee, molasses, chocolate, roasted malt. Fairly smooth mouthfeel. Medium body.

I cant believe Id never rated this. One of my favourite porters, Im glad we have a steady supply in this part of the world. I always have a bottle handy. Dark brown->black, with a lovely creamy head, it has a fine aroma of dark chocolates and a touch of caramel and cherry. Delicious flavour of dark bitter chocolates, some roasted malts, butterscotch, vanilla, plums and that prefect, very light touch of expresso. Medium to full-bodied, it is creamy and velvety, does feel perfect in a pint, indeed.

500ml bottle. Pours very dark brown. You can just see a bit of a ruby tinge in good light. Thick caramel coloured head that stays for a while. Aroma is of toffee, roasted malts, barley and a little chocolate. Nice smooth mouth feel. Roasted malts,molasses,a little toffee and a dry finish.
Keg. Black with beige creamy head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, licorice. Sweet and roasty taste with slight bitterness. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle from McTapps, big thank you, Sabine.  Very dark brown color with small beige head. Strong coffee in aroma together with roasted malt. Taste, roasted malt coffee, cocoa beans, caramel. Coffee bitter finish with hoppy notes. Good.

bruin/zwart met rode gloed en schuimige bruin/kaki kraag
aroma is vol van zoetigheid en chocolade, de smaken zijn matig zoet, matig bitter, niet al te sterke porter, redelijk moutig , koffie en chocolade. 
medium body, wat dunne en gladde textuur, afdronk wat bitter. over het algemeen een dun/lichte porter waarbij de bitterheid lang op de tong blijft hangen.

A: Almost black, but can be seen through in light, with red overtones. S: Malt, Caramel, coffee. Some fruit. T: Starts slightly sweet with coffee, goes into hop bitterness, finishes hop bitterness and roast with a hint of sweetness lingering. M: Suddenly pretty carbonated. A bit watery. O: A decent Porter.

Very dark porter with mouthfeel that's just right for the style and a pleasant roasted malt flavor that evokes chocolate and coffee subtly without being overwhelming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tremendous porter, truly the one that all others are based on or at least pay homage to. Aroma of toast and roasted malts with just enough resiny hop notes to provide the balance but not overshadow the velvety chocolate finish. Delicious
Mild hop and malt aroma. Nice clarity. Light caramel head and dark, deep ruby beer colour. Strong english smokey malt flavours, well balanced overall. OK mouth feel.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 Aroma of chocolate malt and suggestion of liquorice. very smooth creamy taste, coffee aftertaste and really well balanced flavours. Not much on the bitterness side making this complex but refreshing.

Growler fill at state line..nose is great coffee spiked with vanilla some toasted almond..mouthfeel is light bodied..quite clean refreshing easy to drink porter..not getting the usual porter chocolatey roasted character typical of American porters..but this is an English porter..does leave a good lingering coating of porter all around..pretty good but far from the best out there..

Una porter che ti riempie la bocca. Gusto molto ricco, con cioccolata, caffé, eleganti note tostate e sentori di frutta scura. Se erano davvero così le porter che bevevano i marinai londinesi, cera da invidiarli! Il cuore di tenebra della più tipica tradizione birraia della town, davvero eccellente.

A: dark chocolate brown with a fluffy brown to tan head as you would expect.

T: chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts with only a slight bitterness to it. A semi sweet chocolate backing comes through the middle. Breadiness, smokiness, and toffee at the end. Hangs around with roasted malts.

Its as if Jesus returned and spat in your mouth. Heavenly.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Bottle from Waitrose. Dark brown body with a medium beige head. Excellent lacing. Wonderful chocolatey aroma with hints of vanilla, digestive biscuit and Twiglet ash. Lovely flavour - peppery spice, chocolate, gingerbread, black cherry and prunes. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Light carbonation. A sensational, well rounded Porter - incredibly complex. I suspect it would be even better unpasteurised.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2014 Pours translucent black with a slight tan head. Aroma has zero hoppiness. Slick mouthfeel. Taste has hints of coffee, chocolate and caramel. Just a hint of bitterness on the backend. Been looking for this beer for months and it did not disappoint. This is a fine beer.

huge expectations can be the problem. well balanced, nice feel, but just too nice. would like some kind of twist somewhere. or just a bit rougher, darker etc. like the dryness, not so sweetness and overall taste.

Deep chocolate aromas with caramel undertones.Pours a reddy brown with a head that dissipates fairly quickly. Smooth on the palate with slight bitterness. Not generally a porter fan but this one has really made me rethink that position.

Aroma is full of chocolate and toffee. No hops on the nose. Dark brown color with an off white head which dissipated quickly. Chocolate, toasty flavor with a touch of licorice on the end. Roast and fruity esters are moderate. No flavor from the hops. Balance is slightly to the bitter side. Mouthfeel is medium body with a creaminess up front that finishes dry. Carbonation is moderate. Overall, a great tasting brown porter. Good drinkability. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Aroma has coffee and nut. 

Taste has coffee, nut, wood and syrup. Bitter middle- and aftertaste. Body isn't that strong, but as a whole this is a decent porter.

11.2oz bottle, from Party Source. Best before June 14 2014. Pours a near black color - slightly reddish hued around the edges. Good thin sort of bubbly khaki / light brown head.
