Dots of lace around the side of the glass. Very tasty creamy chocolate malts. Super smooth, crisp lighter carbonation. Light body. Lightly dry texture. Very easy to drink. Good moderate bitter taste. Light sweet. Light toastiness. Maybe some earthy hop character, hops mostly just provide a nice bitter taste to counterbalance that awesome chocolate. Awesome porter, much better than expected. One of my new favorites for the style, maybe the best british example Ive ever had. Supremely quaffable.

Dark, ruby/brown colour with big and rocky head. Some lacing on the glass. Very rich aroma is dominated by strong coffee, chocolate, caramel, resinous and nutty background. Taste is slightly sweet and quite bitter and dry in the finish. Soft carbonation. Medium body. Very smooth, perfectly balanced and easy to drink porter. Fabolous Beer!
Lovely porter... Smooth and full of flavour, but nothing heavy and overpowering. Lovely light chocolate malts, and hint of fruggles... Great example of the style.
UPDATED: OCT 3, 2015 Vaarojen Maratonin jälkeen jo useampana vuonna. Molemmista jäi hyvä jälkimaku. On hyvä.

Dark brown body, big tanned head. Aroma of dark fruits, chocolate, raisins. Taste of espresso, sweet malt, cherries, pine and chocolate. Fruity yeast esters at the finish. Solid bitterness, with a dark chocolate and light roast aftertaste.

500ml bottle. Pours black with a frothy beige foam head that leaves some lacing and aroma of chocolate, molasses, roast malt, coffee. Sweetish roasted malt flavour with dark fruits, chocolate & coffee notes plus some lingering bitterness. Rich smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, roast bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle from Waitrose Sunningdale consumed at home, 22/12/13.
Light black with a well appointed tan head that soon collaspes to pondwork and edgeing.
Nose is roast malt, eartthy cocoa, toffee fudge, biscuit crumble, brown bread, light metallicism.
Taste comprises roast malt, brown bread, brown sugars, earthy, cocoa powder, dark fruit tang, brown sugar.
Medium bodied, slightly prickly carbonation - a touch overcooked, drying finale with light sugar notes and roast.
Decent enough porter but way short of the 3.95 average which again outscores the superior cask version - more high US rating bias! It seems many of the top raters had this in their early rating days or it has hit high scores from folks with a smaller amount of ratings. It really isnt that great in the context of the thousands of porters out there !!!!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 500ml can. Dark pour with a large, creamy tan head. Sweet aroma of malts, chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Flavour gives a bit more coffee, with a slightly bitter finish. Body is a little thinner than expected, but otherwise a fantastic porter.

Best by: 3MAR11

A: pours a dark brown ale with under a finger of tan foam which falls rather quickly to a sheet (broken) of the same. No lace, and overly excellent clarity for the style.

S: barley, toast, brown sugar, some nice smoky tones here as well. Smells nice.

T: Nice and roasty beer. plenty of roasty malts, some dry coffee tones. Some interesting raisin notes as well. Some nutty flavors as well.

M: Medium on thin body for the style with moderate carb. dry finish.

O: quality porter for sure, not really stacking up with the greats for me.

Serving type: bottle

09-25-2011

A great porter that has a lot going for it. Dark brown, almost black with a red tint and a thin, disappearing, tan, non-lacy head. Smells of roasted malt, soft chocolate, toffee and coffee. People praise its full body but I found it rather thin. It was smooth though. Tastes of soft coffee, roasted malt and soft liquorish with a dry bitter chocolate finish. Very smooth and easy to drink. A great balance. As a porter its very decent. As an English Porter its amazing. Easily finished the bottle but it isnt the greatest porter in the world.

500ml can, pours dark brown with a medium sized creamy tan head with good retention. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee and muscovado. Light sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium-full body, creamy texture and average carbonation. A pleasant Porter with a likable roasted flavour, however I would have preferred it a bit fuller and stronger.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 0,5L can, BB 25.03.2014. Pours very dark ruby, almost black with nice light tan head. The head stays for a long time. Aroma of malt, a lot of chocolate, hints of caramel, bread. Taste is chocolate, toffee, roasted malts. Really nice mild chocolate bitter finish. Medium carbonation, a little bit creamy. Overall: textbook example of porter, but it is just really great beer.
Mmmm. Dark black. Tasty porter. Burnt and roasted, almost charred like toast. Nice bitter aftertaste.
0.5L bottle. Old motor oil with beige fluffy, fat head. Smoky vanilla, overcooked bread aroma. Quite smoke sauna flavor, enjoyable roasted malt bready, smoky normal bitter finish.

Bottle served at forty five degrees Smooth with great taste 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Aroma is coffee, caramel, malt. Appearance is very nice dark brown, nice, light brown-ish head. Taste is bitter, light sweet. Very good. A light dryness. Leaves an Espresso mouth feel. Amazing.

50 cl bottle. Aroma: burned malts, coffee, chocolate. Appearance: dark, opaque, light head. Taste: medium sweetness. Palate: medium body, thick feel, long finish. Overall: nice beer, but would be nicer with a thicker head.

Chagrined to say Ive never had this. Ouch. Not sure how that happened but this pour from tall can is rich dark strong coffee colour with a thin cap that laces the glass like Jack Frost. Fantastic blueprint porter.

500ml bottle from the brewery shop. Pours dark brown with a reddish hue, thin beige had that doesnt hang around. Big roasty aromas, alongside blackcurrant, liquorice, coffee, chocolate, and the merest smoky note. Really good nose! And the taste delivers! Medium to full body, slightly sticky texture, but overall very impressed with this.

Aroma: Blackcurrant, prune, chocolate, coffee, vanilla.
Appearance: Black with deep ruby edges, small tan head.
Taste: Slight sourness, roasted coffee, a hint of chocolate.
Palate: medium bodied, creamy with soft carbonation and a long coffee finish.
Overall: Classic English Porter.
Dark brown with small brown head. Aroma roasted malts tofee Coffee. Taste roasted malts some hopp bittrness. Nice.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a dark red brown beer with a good creamy white head. Smells coffee, toffee and dark chocolate. Tastes vanilla, smooth, silkey and chocolate. Loving it! Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very pleasing porter. Nice dark colour, small foam. Very malty aroma with roasty notes. Decent, mellow bitterness. Impressing, but not overwhelming.

Bottle from Proof Bottle Shop. Deep clear brown with a finger of tan head. Fair lacing with good head retention. Tons of caramel in the aroma with some noticeable toasted malt. Taste is still lots of caramel and dreads, with some deep maltiness. Great mouthfeel! Good carbonation, medium to full body. Perfect for the style!

Bottle at home from Sainsburys. Dark ruby red caramel colour with a persistent cream head. Aroma is roast chestnuts, dried fruit, prunes, and coffee / choc. Later there is a soapy edge to the aroma. Flavour is dry roast barley. choc, acrid ashy charcoal. Moderate mineral water character. Some fruits esters.Lingering dry roast ash. Palate is moderate carb, velvety. Classic porter. A touch acrid for me.

Creamy, dark liquid. Average sized brown, creamy and long lasting head. Excellent lacing. Leaves a good wide and compact film. Delicate coffee and chocolate aroma, with hints of cinnamon and vanilla. Medium body, soft carbonation. Bitter finish. Roasty notes, coffee, black fruits, licorice.
Ristet malt, humle i god, lang tør eftersmag. Lav carb, men alligevel behagelig prikken på læberne. Helt ok!

Clear, dark cola brown with a fingers worth of tan head. Generous amount of runny lacing.
Dark chocolate and coffee flavors with notes of toffee and nuts.
A very smooth, creamy medium body with a light amount of carbonation thats perfect in this beer.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 Bottle from AmmersinO, Vienna. Dark body, almost black with some red reflections, beige medium creamy head that dissipates pretty quickly. Beautiful deep aroma, very much roasted, dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, raisin, some sweetness, even a bit smoke. Taste is sweet, dark chocolate, cocoa, caramel, coffee, with a smooth light smoky bitter-sweet finish. Medium body with a great sticky texture. Very tasty, smooth, perfectly balanced! Surely a benchmark porter, but there are even some better Porters in my opinion.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Flasche von Töpper, Wedding. - Ein sehr kräftiges, schweres Röstmalzaroma dominiert. Danach die Fullers-typische warme, ganz leicht honigartig-süße Fruchtigkeit. Anklänge von Kaffee und Bitterschokolade, zarte Säure (wie bei Kaffee). Trockener Abgang; extrem langer, sehr bitterer Nachtrunk. Dabei schlank und mit nur 5,4 % leicht zu trinken. - Großartiges Porter.
Very dark and smooth with a slight red glow. Not much head but a fine roasted aroma and taste.

Mörk. Mycket sötma från malten, memmig i smaken. Ganska lite humle smak. Aningen brända toner i smaken, lite efter beska men framförallt sötma i eftersmaken, som stannar en stund på tungan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Zeer donkere roodbruine kleur met een creme kraag. Zoetige caramel, drop en honinggeur en iets geroosterd. Smaakt lekker bitterzoet, met iets van caramel en geroosterd.

500ml bottle. 
Oh West London 
Is wonderful
Oh West London is wonderful

AR:Roastey malt aroma with some sweetness
T:rich taste throughtout with a light hoppiness in the finish
AP:dark Body with thin head that dimishes somewhat fast

Pours a dark red brown beer with a good creamy white head. Smells coffee, toffee and dark chocolate. Tastes vanilla, smooth, silkey and chocolate. Loving it! Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.

331 ounce bottle. Pours a dark black with a red hue and a half inch tan head. Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, smoke and coffee. Similar aroma. Has a near full body with a dry and bitter finish. Satisfying and enjoyable. Well worth having again.

500ml bottle, pours cola black with a foamy white head. Aroma is teriffic, a balance of chocolate, caramel malts with vanilla, rich fruits, raisin, all comes together really nicely and rich and oily textured, carbonation low to average. Finish is nicely balanced roasty bitter. Superb beer.
Great refreshing porter. Dark amber color with brown head. Aroma of caramel. Taste of chocolate and caramel. Bitter aftertaste.
made me a of londen porter. Fruity start and chocolate aftertaste. Light on the tongue and dry finish with a slight bitterness

Bittle. Nice creamy head. Coffy and dark chocolate aroma w/ bit of metalic smell in the side. Nice balanced bitter/malt taste with full creamy body. Long bitter finish of dark choclate.
Great beer.
Definitively my favorite porter. Chocolate, coffee, rich, creamy and delicious. On a cool fall evening, this beer is always at the top of my list.

Pours a dark brown with a thin beige head that receeds into a small rim that leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is roasty, chocolatey. Some good coffee notes, too. A bit of ash. Taste is dry-ish and only slightly bitter. Flavors of caramel, chocolate and a little fruit. Mouthfeel is thin and a bit watery, carbonation level medium. A good porter that needs a little more body.
Kaffe, sjokolade, dyp karamellisert smak, fyldig skumtopp, lang ettersmak som gradvis endrer karakter. Soleklart topp 3 noensinne :) Brun lykke på flaske !

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2013 Pours black, head disappears. Smoky burnt wood earth aroma. Aroma hits straight away. Aroma follow to taste, burnt malts which leaves nice dry bitterness. Low carbonation which does not have an over influence. What lifts this is the body and mouthfeel. No worries of watery aftertaste. Full smooth oily body which makes it highly drinkable. Excellent porter.

Black color with nice beige head. Strong aroma of roasted malt , chocolate , coffee, raisins. Taste of coffee, brown sugar, nuts , roasted malt and hint of fruits. Long bitter aftertaste. Very good . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very, very dark. Almost completely black. Nice beige head that disappears quick.

Aroma: burned sugar, hops, grass, coffeebeans, liquorice, christmas cake.

Later more fruits, over-ripe cherry, and blackcurrant. Aftertaste has tobacco, burned sugar, and a touch of sweetness.

Mouth: medium, but quite full for the ABV. Creamy. Not much carbonation which makes it slightly flat after a while. Slightly syruppy on the lips too.

Overall: very complex beer. Its not my favority profile, but really interesting and well made. But love the complexity and balance, will definately drink this again.

Bottle from liquor. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head. Nose shows toasted and roasted malts, nuts, milk chocolate and maybe some stone fruit. Taste is roasted malts, milk chocolate and slight coffee. Leads to a bitter finish. Great for the style! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black with white head. Aroma is mild malt. Taste is light choc with a very mild bitterness; smooth. As warms it becomes more mocha and complex. Mild bitterness which lingers slightly. Overall, good porter.

Espuma cremosa. Duração média. Cor preta opaca. No aroma o torrado predomina. Na boca: alem do cafe, chocolate, passas há um amargor leve e terroso, persistente, porem sem harshness.
Fiel representante do estilo. Drinkability acima do esperado pro estilo a meu gosto.
R$ 6 pilas em Jaguarão.

Nice deep brown pour with a durable sandy head that sticks around for a while. Aroma of bread, chocolate. If any beer has a perfect flavor, this is it. Waves of chocolate and caramel tempered by roast and bitterness. Interesting hop profile for a dark British beer, a little citrus and lingering bitter aftertaste. Mouth feel is silky and a bit too thin. 500 ml can.

Pours an average creamy light brown head that mostly diminishes. Body is flat black.
Aroma contains moderate malts (dark bread, roasted and burnt malts, nuts, molasses, milk chocolate and mild coffee, moderate hops (citrus fruits like lemon and orange), light yeasts (horse blanket) and sweet fruits like raisin and plum, honey and licorice.
Flavor goes from light acidic to light seeet and light bitter in the finish.
Body is quite full with thick creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Smooth and complex. Very good.

On tap at Crown & Anchor in Monterey, CA. Pours almost black, hints of brown at the edges. Almost no head, slight lacing.
Nose is molasses. Perhaps a hint of prunes. Flavor is predominately sweet and malty, but a pleasant touch of hop comes through. Full body. Mild carbonation. Toffee finish. 
Pretty good brew, but I wouldn't call it the best in the world.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours black with thick long-lasting brown head. Aroma of roasted malts. Sweet taste with roasted malts and chocolate, with enough bitterness.
Deep black colour with a medium brownish and lasting head. Sweet malty aroma and a rather complex taste of coffee and chocolate and spices.

Aroma of cocoa, dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, hint of nuts, licorice, earthy, opaque dark brown with ruby shimmer, tan frothy head, creamy, disappears quickly to thin film, good, stringy lacing, soft sweet taste of chocolate, roasted coffee, nuts and some vanilla in combination with earthly bitter undertones, creamy texture, medium body without being as heavy as it appears, taste continues in finish with growing bitterness, well-balanced beer
Bottle. Pours thick dark brown. Aroma is coffee, malty, chocolate, nuts and some yeast. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Great porter.
500 ml. bottle. Pours almost black with a small biege head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee. Well balanced easy to drink Porter.
Mild aroma of malt, rich dark colour with a nice head, smooth taste, complex taste of phenols, malt, smoke and chocolate. Creamy finish with a palate of smoked malt.

Pours dark creamy, light tan head.

Smell is huge roast and hazelnut.

Taste is smooth creamy, roasty vanilla and coco.

Easy drinking.

I cant imagine it gets much better than this.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 The colour is deep brown. The head is a beige film leaving irregular laces. Medium body. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, dry fruit. The flavour has the same notes. It is rather dry, well hopped, with fine malty acidity. The same picture in the medium long finish. Grassy aftertaste. Very good. My love with this beer grows as I try it another time.

Bottle--well, what can I add after 2300 ratings? Ive liked all of the Fullers products and the porter can be used as textbook example of the style. Deep, dark brown beer with tan head, aroma of roasted malts and coffee, taste includes chocolate to knock down the roast flavor. Nice aftertaste.
Canned. Dark brown beer with a creamy tanned head. Sweet malty, dark dried fruits aroma with coffee and licorice notes. Licorice,coffee and chocolate in taste. Excellent.
50 cl bottle from Spanish supermarket. Pours black with beige head. I didnt have the time to chill it down, - drank it room-temperature. Malty aroma. Hints of chocolate and coffee. Good porter.

I know I shouldnt be comparing it to Meantime Chocolate Porter at 6.5% and Lion Stout at 7.5% but thats what Im doing right now and it stands up very well against them. Aroma of burnt toast and rubber, tan head, quite thin for its strength. Taste of bitter chocolate, roasted malt & hops. Very long and pleasant aftertaste, nice. I cant wait for their strong stout launch next month.

Pour dark brown almost black with a thin tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of dark malts and coffee. Malty taste with some bitterness from the hops and dark malts. Medium body with a very smooth intense taste thats not overdone. Probably the best porter in the entire World.
Aroma forte de malte tostado, para total, contra o sol percebe um vinho, sabor marcante, chocolate amargo, seca, pede mais, por ser uma das primeiras que tomei no estilo virou referência.

500 ml. bottle, pours a dark, almost black colour, with an off white head that leaves a big lace. Smell is earthy, coffee, dark fruits, chocolate. It goes caressing your tongue with a coffee palate, then comes a chocolate, cherries and dark fruits. Coffee liquor like Kahlua or Tia Maria comes to mind. More complex than what I really said, its a great beer.

A jet black body is covered by a minimal off-white head that laces nicely. The nose is intense with notes of roasted coffee beans and some chokolate. The taste is sweet with a strong bitter undertone that leads to a long, pleasant and somewhat dry finish. The mouthfeel is full and syrupy with a mild to medium carbonation that works well here.

Pours brown with some transparency and a yellow tan head that settles into a nice ring. Aroma is bittersweet roasted malt with chocolate and darkfruits. Taste is also dark sweet malts with chocolate, coffee and a touch of bittersweet hops. Quite and complex and one of the better porters I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from the LCBO.
Pours a nearly opaque black, with a creamy brown head. Aroma notes are jammed with big espresso, coffee, dark chocolate, plum, date, vanilla, black liquorice, and roasted honey oats. 

Tasting notes include bitter dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, graham, espresso, and a slightly dry bitter finish. This is an amazing porter, I am surprised I have not tried it before!

Bottle 0,5L
Color: almost black, against the light ruby. Beautifull, tenacious, lucidly brown foam. Aroma: roasty malts, dark chocolate, coffee with milk, coffee liqueur - very very nice. Medium body with smooth, creamy texture. 
Taste: Dark chocolate, sweet coffee, raisins, roasty malts, some hazelnuts, smooth hops - pretty complex. Wonderful aftertaste and long finish - perfectly balanced between sweetness and a bit bitterness. Great Beer!!!!

This is a very good brew. It is not what Ive been use to in the peter world. Its not a thick heavy porter.its nice and light very drinkable. Its light yet has loads of flavor. Pick this up if you see it.

Big rocky tan head. Aroma is light roasted malt with notes of mocha and Worcestershire sauce. Smooth sweet smoky roasted malt flavor. Notes of milk chocolate, light roast coffee and Kahlua come to mind. Subtle flavors with nice balance make this a world class porter.

Pour is dark brown with beige head and little lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, light cocoa, coffee, a bit smoky. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, grassy and earthy hops, moderate sweetness. Medium-low body and medium carb. A very good porter.

A very good beer, in glass is a dark beer, low carbonation, with a small head who rapidly dissipate. The aroma has increased notes of of chocolate and caramel. At the taste a nice coffee and chocolate flavor its perceived. Great taste, great smell, good appereance.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 Dark brown with a few bright/red tinges in the light. Smells like nice coffee but bit different. Roasted toasty coffee/chocolate/liquorice thing with bit of fruit and subtle sweetness. A long warming and balancing bitterness as well. Delicious :-)
Bottle. A rich and complex porter with a smooth body. The benchmark that all porters should be judged against.
Had this numbers of times and it is usually very good. Had one at heathrow on tap that was bad. Caramel and some sweet malt. Nice drinkable beer.

Dark with a off white head that evolves into a thin layer. Aroma is dark roasted malts, coffee, licorice, chocolate. Aroma is sweetish with some light hops and more coffee, caramel and chocolate. Great porter!

Pours dark brown with a small white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is very malty and roasty, full of coffee and chocolate. Taste is roasty; robust malt character that features coffee and chocolate dominates. Dry and light bitter finish introduces some balancing hoppiness. Medium bodied, averagely carbonated, a bit creamy palate. Rich, balanced, full - considering the abv - and interesting , a classic porter.

Bière noire qui laisse filtrer du rouge à la lumière, parfaitement limpide, effervescence moyenne, surmontée dun bon col beige, mousseux et dense. Arômes étonnamment fumées, légère torréfaction (café et chocolat noir), herbes, foin, céréales, un petit peu de mélasse, et aussi une odeur un peu étrange qui fait un peu «cuir» ou «animal délevage». Ça donne un bouquet intéressant, riche et complexe. En bouche, lonctuosité est intéressante. Au goût, on retrouve le malt torréfié et fumé, le chocolat noir, un petit peu de mélasse et du houblon bien herbacé, lamertume étant de faible à modérée. Ce nest pas vraiment sucré non plus, lharmonie des saveurs est excellente, cette bière est très bien construite.

Fullers London Porter is black beer with decent head
The aroma has a dose of roasted coffee, house flavor and touch of fruits. Pleasant toasted flavor, a hint of licorice and coffee-like. In fact, your mouth tastes like a cup of coffee, you might think that I grind coffee beans on your mouth.After taste of chocolate and suitably bitterness. 
Reasonably full-bodied beer, which is overally excellent at a suitable balanced porter for my taste

11.2 ounce bottle. Translucent brown color with reddish hues. Big rocky tan head. Aroma is light roasted malt with notes of mocha and Worcestershire sauce. Smooth sweet smoky roasted malt flavor. Notes of milk chocolate, light roast coffee and Kahlua come to mind. Subtle flavors with nice balance make this a world class porter.

This is one of the finest beers in the world, hard to believe considering how popular it is, and readily available in almost every liquor store, but it really is fantastic. It is perfect for a cold day, or pairing with a rich dessert or a gamey meal, hell, this beer is perfect at any time. It has such a rich full flavour and aroma of chocolate, vanilla, cocoa and just a hint of smoke. It pours absolutely stunningly, perfect body and head, and brilliantly smooth palate. I think this porter sets the bar for all porters and can never be matched.
Dark color with beige head. Malty aroma. Roasted malt and coffee flavor with dry malty aftertaste.
Sabor intenso a torrefacto pero se disipa rapidamente, sin retrogusto. Espuma persistente y color oscuro intenso.

Pours a clear black with red highlights and a nice frothy and lacey brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and latte. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a nice bitterness. Finishes medium dry with some sweetness, overall a great porter.

Can from tallinn. Coca-cola colour with medium, long lasting head. Malty, hopsey aroma. Some burned flavour. Light texture but Not watery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle dark red nearly black color wth nice not very long tan lasting head aroma is roasted malts some Coffee Taste is roasted malts some hops palate is rich and oily aftertaste is slightly bitter liked this very much great porter
Good scent. The taste is really good it also. Not too dry. Long and good aftertaste. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Aroma: sweet malty roasty
Apperance: dark ruby brown and very clear when backlit. Dense tan head.
Taste: malty roasty w a moderately strong after taste which is balanced between roasty malt and hops bitterness.
Palate: medium-light body.
Overall: excellent Porter.
Mörk öl med nästan vit skum, smak av kaffe och choklad, men inte så mycket som jag hoppades på, lite för tunn kropp!

Really deep dark red - basically black, with a quickly diminishing beige head. Aroma is yeasty, bready, faint coffee, and caramel, chocolate malt. Taste is sweet with a light bitter finish. Oily texture with light carbonation. OK but not the best porter Ive ever had.
Buena Porter. Color negro translucido con reflejos rojos y espuma color crema. Aromascsuages de maltas torrefactas. En boca es ligera con notas acafetadas y un final amargo equilibrado.
roasted malts,coffee,chocolate.just a little bit richer and just a little bit more complex would make a world of difference.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 From a bottle. Very pleasant aromas of roast coffee, smooth feel and rich flavours of bitter chocolate. Very dark with a thin head, like it a lot

Bottle from Total Wine. Pours a dark brown pour with a khaki head. Nose is chocolate, dark fruit, licorice, and toffee. Sweet graham cracker and some toasted malt. Sweet toffee, graham cracker, and dark fruits. Some licorice, roasted malt, and cocoa. Nice.

Draft at Royal Mile. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Very roasty chocolate on the tongue. And does this one linger long after you drink it. Theres no doubt as to what this contains. Very nice!

Poured from a bottle it forms a tall lasting tan head on a very dark copper liquid which a flashlight was required to confirm as very clear. Head slowly subsided to a thin veil with some lacing left on the glass. The aroma is cofee and cocoa with malt notes of bread crust, plus the slightest hint of hop spice and a whiff of metal. Flavor is sweet malt at first which quickly gives way to cocoa and coffee with a small bite of roasted grain. There is some moderate hop biterness along with some soft fruity esters of the ale yeast, I want to say banana and cherry, but it is hard to pinpoint. The body is medium, almost "chewy", the carbonation is medium-low and the finish is dry with the lingering roasty bitterness. This is a porter I want to keep sniffing and sipping as it is rich and complex with a cocoa and coffee-like spirit cradled in other interesting notes that come out with every taste. A dynamite brown porter! My glass is now empty :(

500 ml bottle poured into English pint glass. very dark. 3 finger head that leaves some lacing. Nose has malt, chocolate, coffee. Very smooth. Coffee and chocolate notes with a slightly bitter finish. Excellent beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hur kan en här vara så högt rankad? Det är ju helt obegripligt nästan. Får väl testa igen nån gång. Det är lurt 

2013: hos blombergs på provning. Nu snackar vi världsklass. Fantastisk porter
@ Röhällavägen. Burk från Systembolaget (20:-). Rostad malt, lite kaffe, mörk choklad, russin, medelfyllig, både söt och lite syrlig.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2013 500 ml bottle poured into a Pint glass
Appearance....... black beer with head colour beige of almost 2 fingers
Aroma...............malt, roasted cofee, caramel,. Strong smell with a touch of malty aroma
Taste........toast spresso and chocolate with a sweet malty touch, bitterness appears soon lasting all the time, 
Mouthfeel........... full body and medium/soft carbonation
Overall............ a very nice porter, bitterness is present but in a perfect combination with this classic English style . One to revisit
Canned. Red brown body, creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts with coffee notes. Coffee also in taste, medium sweet in some time, light bitter finish. Good.

beige head disappears without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma of toasted malts, liquorice and coffee. taste of toasted malt with an aftertaste of coffee, liquorice, a bit earthy and slight bitterness. very soft and slick mouthfeel, soft carbonation and medium body. very enjoyable!  bottle 50 cl / best before 15 mar 2014

A creamy chocolate flavour. Beer is a clear dark dark brown with a red hint. Ehhhhhhhhhhhhhh. It's good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Almost black color with 1 finger off white head. Aroma of roasted malts, cold espresso, biscuits, nuts. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter, dark chocolate flavor. Light body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation. Really tasty.
Canned. Dark brown beer with a creamy tanned head. Sweet malty, dark dried fruits aroma with coffee and licorice notes. Licorice,coffee, tar, malty flavour. Nice beer :-)

Appearance: Dark ruby/brown with tight cm thick ivory/white head.
Aroma: Chocolate, smoky and roasted notes, slightly floral, toffee, bready, hint of resin and pine.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium/high bitterness, medium sourness with roasty bitter chocolate in the mix.
Palate: Thick, smooth texture and full mouthfeel. Dry in the mouth, medium body, average carbonation with an abrupt astringent finish.
Comments: Gorgeous. Left a glass lace.

Bottle. Pitch black with a small, slightly tanned head. Aroma is soy sauce, hints of licorice, dark and sweet chocolate, and coffee. Taste is pretty much like the aroma. Mouthfeel is bigger side of medium, dry but also smooth - nice. A very classic, extremely good English porter. Close to a perfect example of the style in my eyes.

Minimal head, dark brown color and a nice clear liquid. Aroma is like roasted coffee when cold, roasty hops when a little bit warmed. Taste has medium bitterness, again coffee and malts, roasted bread and maybe a little bit of bitter chocolate. Palate stays long on a bitter malty side. One true elegant, rich and balanced porter.

50cl bottle. Deep dark brown colour with small/medium off-white frothy head. Toasty aroma, with chocolate and malty notes. Some licorice presence. The flavour is a blend of chocolate, cookies and a slight touch of coffee. No hops. Medium mouthfeel, good carbonation. Average palate. Not bad overall.
This is an amazing beer in every way. It is deep and chocolaty with a nice English hop mellowing it out. The head is rich in appearance and the color is perfect. This tops my list for sure.

Draft. Aroma is dry and dark malt. The appearance is a slightly transparent dark brown with a lasting tan head. The taste is a very dark malt that borders between coffee and really dark malt. Palate is pretty dry. Overall, a very good porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by Peter Bognar. Finally a really good beer from Fullers. Aroma is coffee, caramel, malty. Dark brown colour. Taste is nice coffee, light caramel. Tasty enough. Slightly lower body, but easily drinkable. No perceptible alcohol. Good one.

Recommended by Paul the beer guy at Whole Foods Dublin. First of all, love the bottle. Poured into pint glass. Dark dark pour with minimal tan head. Deep ruby when held to light but mostly just black. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, sugar, raisins, malt, molasses, smoke, and licorice. Many of the same tastes. The label says rich and complex and they are spot on. Mouthfeel is full, thick, creamy. Soft carbonation. One of the best porters Ive had to date. So glad for the recommendation!

500mL bottle. Rich, brown black pour with a creamy tan foam. Aroma is chocolate, toasted malt, espresso, mild vanilla. Creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation. Very complex, cool sweetness, toasted malt dominance, smooth finish, mild bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 11.2 oz bottle served in a snifter. Distinctive dark bottle is dated "best before" Jan. 2015. 

Appearance: Sparkling clear; mahogany brown in color; multi-density tan head that fairly soon reduces to a durable ring and an island. Good lacing. 

Smell: nice roasted malts with toffee, and hints of coffee, licorice and chocolate. Hints of brandy after warming.

Taste: A load of dark, choco-coffee malt here, yet no off- or burnt-notes. Mildly earthy, bitter and spicy -- partly from the Fuggles hops. Some coffee in the aftertaste with dark roasted malts, a touch of dark fruit, and dark chocolate. 

Medium+ body; lightly crisp from start to the semi-dry finish; very smooth.  

O: "Rich, dark & complex", as advertised. An outstanding and flavorful porter that leans towards a dry UK stout.

Dark red almost black color, small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, some smoke notes. Taste is dry sweet with nice bitter finish and roasty aftertaste. Medium body and soft carbonation. Very drinkable and tasty porter.

Pours a dark black with very little head. It has a rich, burnt coffee aroma. The taste is of bitter malt, similar to burnt rice. It has a smooth, creamy texture. Perfect texture for a porter, and a very nice beer.

50cl bottle from cafe de la Gare.
Thick off white head. Clear deep brown pour. Lovely smooth porter. Excellent

Bottle. Pours a clear dark brown beer with a small amount of beige head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, light touches of vanilla and molasses. Flavour is bittersweet with coffee in the front of the palate. Sweet finish with a big sweet presence. Aftertaste is medium bitter with a dry mouthfeel. Very nice beer, great porter.

Strong smells of chocolate with a bit of coffee mixed in. The head disappeared fairly quickly, with remnants of the head clinging to the sides. Dark reddish brown in color. Excellent taste with the carbonation not getting in the way of the flavor unlike so many other decent beers.

This is the closest thing to a perfect beer that Ive ever had. Nice thick tan head, so dark you cant see through it and a superb mouth feel. There are strong hints of coffee and chocolate in this porter. I cant recommend it enough.

I looked high and low for these beers in Brisbane, then found 6 bottles at the wine emporium, fortitude valley, the beer is exactly what the label reads rich dark and complex, flavours of dark chocolate, good lacing, wow what a superb beer
Typical bitter european porter.  Not much sweetness.  Thicker than the 5% abv.  I dont see the big deal on this one.

Beautiful roasty chocolate coffee notes. Almost nutty. Smells so good. Appearance is about as brown as you can be without being black, thin ring of head. Taste is great, burnt and roasty at the beginning, and the finish makes me want to sob with happiness. Feel is great. Amazing beer.

Botte. Very dark brow with a tan head that quickly diminishes. Aroma is toasty with notes of licorice, smoke and coffee. Flavor is quite similar as aroma where smoky notes are more present, also roasted malts and light earthy hints. The final has coffee notes with a dry sensation.
Deep brown, with strong brown head, roasted malts and chocolate coffee chocolate coffee chocolate coffee. Fantastic beer, the bitterness is in perfect balance with the sweet flavors, really enjoyed.

50 cl bottle. Brown colored with a solid, creamy and slow beige head. Roasted aroma of cocoa and chocolate with delicious liqourice. Flavor has chocolate with notes of liquorice and coffee. Very nice porter.
Pours a dark Brown with tan head. Aroma dark chocolate coffee banana dark fruit. Taste followes the aroma very smooth medium heavy mouth feel.. nice lacing on the glass. Great beer!

UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 Dark cola brown beer with white head leaving lacing. Aroma is mild with licorice and some roasted malts. Flavor has salty licorice, dark bread and caramelly sweetness. Has a fair amount of bitterness on the finish leaving a roasty aftertaste. Medium palate with medium carbonation. Nicely enjoyable porter.
Pours a deep black brown. Aroma of coffee and cigars. Tastes a bit like smoke and raisins. Slightly thin for my style.
Bottle. Poured dark brown with light tan head. Nutty caramel wood aroma. Quite smooth numbs the tongue. Earthy nutty flavor.

Lighter than any other stout Ive seen, both in appearance and consistency.  Held to the light it turns dark red rather than remaining black like many others. Pleasant chocolate and coffee notes, with very little bitterness in the aftertaste.  Flavour is on the weak side.  Aroma is nice - chocolate and coffee appear with some other undetermined smells.  Slightly carbonated.  After rave reviews here, I was expecting more.

Out of a can, because thats all they sell here.

Pours dark, almost black with a ruby edge to it. Really pleasant aroma - malty, coffee and a toasty treacle caramel sweetness. Medium bodied with some fizz. Coffee, chocolate, maltiness and a pleasant bitterness. Good, and very, very drinkable.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2015 I was astounded by this piece of brewery. With an incredible creamy aroma of chocolate it was a true delite to taste this. Immediatly one of my top favorite beers.

12oz poured into a SA perfect pint glass.

A - Pours a dark chestnut brown with a fluffy tan head that provided very balanced lacing patterns.

S - Molasses, toasted caramel and chocolate malt, sticky dates, smokey overtones,

T - Creamy caramel, roasted malts, light smoke, hints of sour licorice, tangy yeast, cocoa, roasted nuts, raisins, has a roasted bitter finish.

M - Full body, soft carbonation, extremely creamy and velvety feel.

Superb! One of, if not the best porters Ive ever had.

Serving type: bottle

05-10-2012

Bottle. Best by August 2013.

Appearance - almost black with ruby highlights. Tan head dissipates quickly. 

Aroma - chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. 

Taste - chocolate at the front of the tongue gives way to a nice chicory-like bitterness. 

Mouthfeel - silky with low carbonation. 

Overall - an outstanding porter!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2015 Can. Dark brown body with a reddish hue. Tall beige head. Aroma has milk chocolate and very soft hints of coffee. Smooth roasty taste with more chocolate. Light hoppy finish. This is a nice porter indeed but I have come to expect much more from beers that make their way inside the 100th % here. Drinkable? Sure. Fantastic? No.
Re-rate: After having about 20 cans/bottles of this I must reconsider: yes, this is a fantasitc porter. One of the few beers that is drinkable even warm because its so chocolatey and milky. The key is in the balance. 
Re-rate: Several cases of bottles/cans over the years. Upping the scores even higher. This is the best porter and a quintessential beer. Again, the key is in the balance, not being quirky or extreme. Being supremely drinkable should be every beers goal. Fullers have mastered it. I would even say its the best dark session beer that I know of.

Dark brown, creamy medium beige head. Nose is chocolate hints with malt, a touch of nuttiness. Taste has a fair maltiness to it, roasty notes, sweetness and a coffee-bitter finish with dryness. Medium body with thin parts in the middle of the taste, silky carbonation, dry mouthfeel.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours pitch black with a short khaki head. Big roasted malt with a slight dark chocolate aroma. Taste is roasted dark cocoa, dark malts and a touch of soy. Slightly watery taste. Medium body. Easy drinking and not too rich.
500 ml can rated from backlog. Near black with tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and caramel. Taste is complex with chocolate, roasted malts, caramel and faint smoky notes.

Ottima porter di uno dei miei birrifici preferiti. Profumi poco pronunciati ma equilibrati, corpo pieno e gusto leggermente tostato. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 500ml can. Pours a deep ruby/brown with a half finger, tan head. Aroma has notes of dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, and a hint of smoke. Taste is well balanced. Dark chocolate, caramel,  a touch of coffee, and a drawn out ending. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Rich and creamy in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall a really nice porter. Big creamy mouth feel with lots of dark chocolate.

dark brown colour with some reddish tone, large brownish head, which becomeslowly  to a creamy laye; marvellous aroma of dried fruits, coffe, caramel and dark chocolate; taste of dark chocolate, roasted coffee and malt with some minimal sournes; definitely the best porter Ive ever tasted...now Im really close to like porters :)
Awesome porter. Smells of roast and coffee. Flavor is phenomenally clean and complex.
Bottle. Very red color color. Very light mouthfeel but not overly thin. Lots of Carmel in the flavor.
Bottle. Brownish burgundy with a small head. Caramely and malty. Really light body.

Just amazing. The second best porter that I have tasted. Sam Smiths is first, but this is very close. Who cares. Maybe this is even better. Like argueing whether a Rolls or a Bentley is better; pointless, but fun.

Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Malt,roasted,chocolate,coffee and light caramel aroma ; Clear dark brown color with smaller lasting head ; Medium sweet and lighter bitter taste ; Long finish ; Fuller body ; Superb porter.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2015 On-tap. Dark brown, nearly black color with a nice tan head that fades quickly. Caramel, coffee and chocolate aroma. Taste is pretty complex with a mixture of chocolate, roasted malts, with light caramel and smoky notes. Smooth and creamy. Delicious brew.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours black with red nyanses and a brown white small lacing head. Nice roasted and licorice notes at first sip following with coffee, some fruity probably raspberry notes and a dark chocolate finish. Many layers of good complex taste. Very nice porter.

Poured from an 11.2 ounce bottle into a snifter. Pours a darker brown with a thin beige head of foam. Aroma has notes of molasses fire roasted cherries, and licorice. Roasty. The taste is toasty and earthy with a dry, fairly dark chocolate bitterness throughout. Just right on the palate. A near sessionable porter.

Aroma struck me as being very smokey, which I wasnt expecting. Then the roasty and charred smells came and then it was chocolate and coffee. Taste is same with a nice creamy mouthfeel and, surprisingly for its ABV, a bit of warmth in the finish. An extremely balanced beer, so balanced, in fact, that it comes across a little, er, bland, or unadventurous. But, nice beer though, though.

Source : From SAQ, 500ml bottle.
Appearance : Dark brown with a nice tan head.
Aroma : Brown sugar.
Taste : Alcohol, sugar taste and lightly bitter, 
Palate : Medium carbonation.
Overall : A good beer but can be more refined.
Dark choclolate, raspberry and stable aroma. Creamy dark coffee and cocoa taste with a pleasant finish also containing red berries.

500ml bottle at Cork Cricket Club. Surprised it taken me so long to try this one. Pours a deep brown with a nice big tan head. Aroma is nice blend of coffee, biscuit and chocolate. Medium malt sweetness and a nice roasted bitterness. Smooth, full and roasty finish. Very, very good porter.

Smokey notes, the strength makes it smooth, opens the pallete nicely. Aroma is very smokey too, almost like smoked bacon.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

500 ml bottle bought at Olivers The Delicatessen in Central.
Clear deep blackish brown colour; One and a half finger head and lovely crumpety beige foam which last for 1 minute; Sticky lacing and active carbonation; Fragrant aroma of roasted malt, dark coffee, burnt toffee, dark chocolate, sugar and light grass; Pleasant and tasty light sweet taste of dark roast malt, with strong smoke, burnt toffee, black coffee, dark chocolate, very light liquorices, strong nuts, dry biscuits, citrus and strong grassy hops; Medium body, not so thick but really creamy palate; Taste profile is very smoky, nutty, and roasty dark malt with tasty black coffee and light chocolate in a creamy background. Not as rich as Youngs Double Chocolate Stout, but its smooth creaminess is more than made up any deficiency; Hoppiness is moderate to light grassy nose, good limey citrus in taste, and a slow and penetrating light bitterness and astringency last til finish; Fairly dry after taste, very easy and creamy to mouth.

Comments: I know I shouldnt compare this one with Youngs Double Chocolate Stout, yet they share so many similar characters I think I should give it a fair run with YDCS as a reference. It has really good aroma and taste, esp. the smokiness and nuttiness are simply outstanding. Great creamy mouth feel as expected. Because its not intended to turbo - Chocolaty taste, so its cocoa-ness may be not over the roof as YDCS. Plus its body is not quite thick and rich enough. Still, this is a labour of love, true to the tradition, and definitely worth revisiting. Recommended.

500ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Roasty and some smoky aromas. Pours dark, with vanishing tan head, some lacing. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is malty, roasty, some spicy, a bit watery.

Bottled. Pours pitch dark with a lively tan head. Aroma of prunes, roasted nuts, coffee and chocolate. Quite dry in the beginning, then comes a sweet and fruity part, and the finish is dry again with notes of dark chocolate and coffee, and a sour touch. Low carbonation and a bit of an oily mouthfeel. I have to admit that expected more flavours so I find this a bit flat. But still not bad at all.
0,5l glass bottle. Some malt in aroma, maybe some dark chocolate string. Alittle yeast there, and veery bitter. Not your ordinary porter. Some taste stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014 02.05.2013. Head: dark beige, medium, frothy, medium retention. Colour: almost opaque black (technically dark red-amber).  Aroma: roasted, malty, dark bread, caramel, chocolate. Taste: roasted, sweet, medium bitterness. Some astringency in after-taste. 7/3/7/3/15
Aroma: dark chocolate, dark roasty and oily bread crust. Taste: chocolate, roasted mats, not really sweet, but does not have that almost acidic roastiness of a stout.Light bitterness. Burnt/ashy and malty aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 (Bottle): Pours a near black with a small tan head. Aroma of black coffee, dark chocolate and a hint of vanilla. Lovely full body with an exceptionally good flavour of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, smokiness and liquorice. Fantastic.
Bottle. Dark brown color, near black. Frothy beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and hops, Medium sweet taste, medium bitter finish. Oily feel.

11.2 oz bottle from Wilburs.  Deep, dark brown with a tan head and patchy lacing.  The aroma is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and earthy.  Similar flavor with caramel and bready malts adding to the smooth complexity.  Medium body with a creamy feel and soft carbonation.  Sweet chocolate, light bitter finish.  Nice.

Bottle @ home from Supermarket. Profumo complessi di caffè, liquerizia, caco amaro e luppoli che ricordano la resina dei pini.  Di colore scuro, ha riflessi rossastri solo sullunghia inclinanado lievemente il bicchiere. La schiuma è cremosa come la panna di un cappuccino. Il gusto è di liquerizia in primo piano, con caffè e cereali totasti in sottofondo, e fnale luppolato non molto lungo. Corposa il giusto , carbonatazione appena acennata regala un bel dopogusto vellutato.

The color is a very dark reddish brown with a small tan head, and the aroma is reminiscent of roasted malts, chocolate, and maybe a touch of smoke. The taste is slightly sweet, slightly umami, and a touch bitter, which isnt too terribly impressive, but the long hearty finish, medium body, slick texture, and soft carbonation combine nicely on the tongue.
[@ Öl och whiskymässan, Malmö] Mörk med brunt skum. Kakao kaffe och bröd. Tycker den kunde varit lite mer kraftfull i smak och aroma.
Bottle pours deep amber, brown and ruby edges. Nose of roasted black coffee. Sweet with some light fruitiness, roast and very mild astringency. Body is creamy.

Pours opaque and black with very subtle ruby highlights.  Massive creamy light tan head which endures.  Roasty aromas abound, coffee and chocolate feature prominently, also some sweetness like vanilla.  Gorgeous deep and full bodied flavour, mirrors the aromas but also introduces some dark fruit and has a long and moderately dry and slightly bitter finish.  Wonderful porter, never had a bad Fullers London!
Dark brown, light brown head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts and smoke. Full of taste but also easy drinkable. Very good beer!
En fantastiskt god och välbalanserad porter. Len och krämig och lagom söt. Choklad med en liten bränd eftersmak.
This was my first porter. Not very much aroma at all, but good flavor and smooth. Trying jose marti soon. Comparison to come.
aroma was lacking but made up for it on taste which was roasty and chocolate. good porter

Black. Aroma: Chocolate, coffee, licorice, sugar and malt. Overall its a very sweet aroma. Taste: The taste of licorice is more prominent, along with the coffee, very dark chocolate flavours as well. Roasty flavours appear as well. The mouthfeel is crispy. Super-sessionable beer. Never gets old.

Tasted in September 2011. 
Aroma: Chocolate, coffee and smoke notes. Very well balanced, strong and complex.
Appearance: Black with red glints, head is showing an average thickness, creamy and dense texture and a very long lasting.
Taste is pretty standard with coffee, chocolate and smoke notes but the mouth feel is very round with a full body and oily texture. Finish is very smooth with coffee  bitterness. Standard and excellent porter.

Bottle 0.5l from local Alko, Vantaa. Colour is almost black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and hints of smoke. Chocolate dominates. Mouthfeel is superb. Wasn´t as good as I expected but still great beer.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2015 Delicious. If I wanted to explain to someone how I imagine a porter tasting, then this is it. The best example of a Porter. Not overly chocolatey, but still sweet, creamy, balanced. The aroma after the pour is something divine, dont skip it!!! It left me feeling warm and toasted. Bottle at Cat and Canary (London).

Aroma of roasted barley, malt, chocolate and coffee, some slight english floral hops. Taste of roasted barley, chocolate and slight nuts. nice mouthfeel with perfect amounts of carbonation. Nothing wrong with this porter!

3/18/2013	Coffee, Mold (thats sounds bad, but its a good smell)	8	Dark black appearance.  Small head.	4	Chocolate, toasted malt.  Smooth.	8	A bit dry.  	4	A really nice beer.  A classic.  Bold enough to be tasty and interesting; light enough to drink easy.  Wins the side by side comparison against Sam Smith Taddy Porter.	16

Bottle. Pours a deep red, almost black color, with a fizzy light-brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and what seems to be a hint of citrus. Taste is like the aroma with a smoky and bitter aftertaste. Medium body. Surprisingly good...considering what I expected. ;-)

Muy buena, con toques a café. Lo que reza en su eslogan es cierto: además del café, notas otros matices como esos toques de chocolate negro. El trago bien puede durar lo suyo y disfrutarla despacio. Notabilísima relación precio/calidad. Excelente equilibrio: nada de extremos.
Pours dark brown with a thick lingering head. Aromas of coffee and chocolate; very rich. Loads of flavour with a touch of bitterness in the finish. Very nice porter.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2013 Pours a beautiful deep dark brown with a good beige head. Nose: coffee, roasted malts, licorice. Creamy, rich, complex with little bitterness. Very well balanced. Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 Bottle"home... Dark brown pour with a dark beige head. Roasted malty aroma with dark chocolate and some licorice. Taste is lots of chocolate, roated malts, coffee and caramel. Finish is medium bitter.

Pours a deep brown color with a roasted almond coco aroma.  Taste is chocolaty with a quick dissipating aftertaste.  A slight bitter aftertaste that is surprising for a porter.  Overall a decent beer especially for the style.

Belle robe noire et foncée, de même quun collet généreux beige. Porter à 5.4% dalcool qui offre un nez de chocolat sucré avec des pointes subtiles de café torréfié. En bouche, le goût du café prend plus de place, mais le chocolat demeure. La bière est crémeuse, juste assez effervescente. Elle descend vraiment bien, comme on dit. Riche et complexe, cette bière me semble équilibrée. Bonne manière de sinitier aux noires : peu damertume et beaucoup de place aux arômes chocolatés : pointes de mélasse et légère acidité au palais, mais rien de dérangeant, au contraire. Sapparente beaucoup à une stout irlandaise, à mon avis. Cheers!
Pours a very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Taste is similar with roasted malt and coffee and chocolate and bitterness on the end. Very smooth and satisfying drink.
Dark and thick on the pour win a small frothy head. Rich smokey chocolate scent and flavors with a nice smooth hint of coffee on the palate. This porter was med-full bod.
Bottle from Ocado; dark brown pour with tan head, toasty malt & choc aroma, dark chocolate taste with roast malts coffee dried fruits a bit of vanilla, a classic porter.

Deep dark brown with beige to brown medium head. Bit lacing.
Aroma.. roasted malts, chocolate, some hops, licorice
Sweet with light bitter finish.
Its very nice, but I would wish fuller body.. bit to thin in comparison with other heavy weights.
Cerveza negra, con espuma de color marrón. Olor a café americano. Sabor a grano tostado, café, regaliz, pimienta. Cuerpo bastante más ligero de lo que me esperaba. Poco carbonatada. Muy recomendable.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Oct 2012 - bottle - smokey and chocolatey, very well balanced and drinkable, mild, mid-body, not very bitter.  Flavour isnt very strong, but the flavour balance is good.  Would have no qualms about having this again, but wouldnt rush to it either because it didnt have much wow factor. (3.4)
Nov 2013 - bottle - Short review due to session.  Understated smokey smell.  Body medium, carbonation medium.  Taste - molasses, crayon sweetness.  OK.  Last beer of the night at 2am so that might be a factor in my perception of this one.  (3.4)

Bière très sombre, limite noire. Reflets rubis à la lumière. Elle dégage des arômes puissants de malt grillé, café, mocha, cacao. Une fois en bouche ça se développe en toffee et le sucre prend une bonne place. Amertume et astringence légère sur une longueur moyenne. Une excellente Porter qui manque tout de même un petit peu de corps.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2014 Bottle->pokal.  Deep brown, small tan head.  Aroma: malt, dark fruit, chocolate.  Taste: rich chocolate and roasted malt.  Smooth and silky.  Excellent.

Appearance: Dark Brown with tan head.
Aroma: Light roasted grain 
Flavor: Dark malt, coffee
Palate: Medium bodied
Overall: Very balanced and hits all the right notes.
Pours dark with a foamy head. Bitter aroma of coffee beans. Chocolate flavour and a nice touch of hops. Smooth and delicious.
Pours dark brown almost black ith agreat beige head. Aroma is of coffee, rosted malt. Flavour is sokey, roasted malt, light bitter end.

500 ml bottle, at home. Poured into an english pint glass.
Very very dark brown colour, almost black. with a soapy beige head, almost two fingers tall, with average retention and good lacing left around the glass.
Very intense aroma of roasted malts, rich chocolate aroma right after that and some coffee on the background.
Taste follows the aroma, agian lots of roasted malts and a slight bitterness because of them, then the chocolate kicks in and stays on the aftertaste too, without covering the bitterness but working along with it.
Full and rich on the body, and good amounts of carbonation.
Overall, delicious!
dark porter colour with strong pale foam. Great taste a bit bitter mixed with caramel chocolate. it have nice aftertaste. i agree with others that this porter ir one of best porters

Bottle from Rakuten. The aroma was weak, maybe I drank it too cold... the flavor, some sweet caramel/coffee/toffee maltiness. The flavor is a nice roasted coffee/chocolate taste, very smooth with a really nice mouthfeel. Nothing really special but a very solid porter...

Dun noir charbon presque totalement opaque ; on discerne du rouge très foncé à la lumière. Effervescence contenue mais présente. Au nez, beaucoup de chocolat noir et de café ; on perçoit aussi, au travers, des relents de pommes. Saveurs de café en premier lieu (mouture très noire), avec du chocolat et du cola ; effervescence à peine chatouillante. Une vraie porter anglaise, pas parfaite mais certainement louable : des saveurs franches et directes, une belle personnalité et totalement "by the book". Savoureuse.

50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Buskerud storsenter. Pours dark brown with a two finger brown head that leaves a good lacing. Aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. Well balanced taste between coffee and chocolate with a good discrete bitterness in the back. A bit on the creamy side but it lacks some depth. Overall a good one.
Quite smooth for a porter and a little salty with malty, chocolate flavour. Goes down very well.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2013 appearance: almost black dark brown beer with a brown head. Not much foam unless you give it a good poor. Loses the foam quite quickly. 

smell: caramel / licorice sweetness and coffee scented malts. 

taste: Caramel and dark chocolate sweetness, tart like. Followed by a licorice and coffee, slightly bitter and dry, finish. 

mouthfeel: Its thinner then a Guiness. Doesnt have that creaminess to it, but makes it more refreshing and easy to drink. Medium carbonation. 

overall: I like this stout. Its thinner then most, but is packed with flavor. Its not hiding in subtleties, but just delivers the coffee, chocolate, licorice and caramel flavors with a nice balance of sweetness and a light bitter. If i had to criticize it, id say its lacking a bit of depth. Its not something id drink all night, because it starts to bore a little after one. Although to me, this is quite common for a stout. It may be a little too sweet and straight forward for me to enjoy even more. But its one of the better stouts out there, so id say: recommended!

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pours dark brown, with a thick white head. Great aroma of roasted malts and chocolate. Mouthfeel is pretty decent, and a rich flavour for its low abv. Its tastes of roasted malts, coffee, licorice and chocolate. Very nice indeed.

500 ml. bottle @ home. Pours a very dark mahogany brown / black, flimsy mocha head. Smells of cheap chocolate & chocolate milk, chestnuts, malts & something metallic. Taste is touch bitter UK hops, chestnuts, touch metal, cheap chocolate and chocolate milk, odd paler malts, substitute coffee, somewhat artificial. Medium, lightly creamy body. Not bad but bit of a poor mans ST Mokah or Rogue Double Chocolate.
Good porter. Very notable notes of caramel and coffee. Tasteful when in mouth and a nice aftertaste.
Sabor cafe, muito boa. Aparencia escura. Aroma de cafe com caramelo. da pra sentir gosto forte

Light brown medium head, pitch black colour, burned brown sugar smell but not very sweet a bit like pancake sirup, bitter soft coffee taste when drunk cold its even like some kind of coffee milkshake, some light watery mouth feeling

First on nose - express roasted malt, far away coffee. Foam is medium, creamy, brown beige, thin lacies. Color- almost black + deep, deep purplish. Palate is obviously watery, creamy too although cant catch any thickness  in texture. Taste is dominant roast bitter in acceptable way, bit hops also. Aftertaste is a bit sour/sweet, average dry finish. My opinion is that this brew is way too not complex in flavor.

Dark brown to black, untrasparent color.  Beige to brown, medium sized, thick, medium fast falling head, lacing. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Aroma: Roasted malt,  dark chocolate, soft notes of coffee, minimal notes of earthy hops. Taste:  Malty, roasted malts, dark chocolate. Finish is pleasant, crisp and moderate roasted.Good balance between malty sweetness and roasted bitterness. High drinkability and complex aroma. Good, easy to drink beer.

Pours a deep brown almost black, dark fruit rasin not quite plum, a little thiner
for a london porter, overall not bad i would buy it again.
Dark, very dark ruby with small off-white foam ring. Aroma is coffee, taste is nice bitter, coffee, toffee, some smoke. Nice long lasting bitter coffee aftertaste. (Velp 201302)

Pours a dark black with lots of slightly off white head. Nose is smoke and coffee as well as a slight sweetness and a lovely maple syrup note. Flavor is sweet and rich. Taste is maple syrup and coffee, slight citrus bitterness on the finish. Full bodied and smooth drinking, with good lacing. Very tasty.
Really nice taste and aroma, this is a good thing to drink. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]
A very dark beer, although not very thick and not heavy. With almost no head it pours nicely. Caramel, coffee and smoke notes. A very good beer!

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 8/II/13 - 50cl bottle from Mitra van Bergen (Eindhoven) @ home - BB: 13/II/13 (2013-145) 
Clear purple brown beer, nice creamy beige head, pretty stable, adhesive. Aroma: caramel, mocha, grains, hay, horse stable, coffee and cream. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body, creamy texture. Taste: mocha, dark chocolate, bitter touch, coffee, hint of caramel. Aftertaste: coffee, bitter touch, little sour as well, mocha, coco powder, dry hoppy ending.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 Really dark brown looks with smallish cinnamon brown head. Dark chocolate, roasted coffee on the aroma. Pretty basic porter. Coffee and dark chocolate flavors. Quite high carbonation but rich texture. Traditional porter.

Coffee, caramel, toffee, and cocoa aromas.  Very dark brown-black with some faint ruby, and with a light tan head of moderate retention.  Dry, with flavors of tar and dark chocolate, and complete with earthy, roasty bitterness.  Medium bodied with average-low carbonation, and a clean, roasty finish.
Bottle at hua hin, thailand. Reddish black color, light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Smooth mouthfeel, chocolate, medium body.
Nera e con una schiuma nociola e pannosa. Liquerizia e tostato, densa e oleosa. Avvolge con decisione.
Decent aroma, appearance, taste and palate, overall memorable. Rated from the bottle.

A: dark fruits mixed with faint chocolate. A: pours a dark ruby with a one finger head. No lacing. T: raisin, vanilla, licorice and chocolate round out a smooth drink. Palate is medium bodied. O: this is a nice english porter. Will try again.

Pours a transparent very dark brown colour with big light brown head and some lace. Aromas of chocolate, moderate roasted malts, toffee, nutty, bready. Flavours are roasted malts, dark chocolate(contributing to some bitterness), nuts, biscuits, mild bitterness.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur brune-noire et opaque. Nez de malt rôti et légèrement terreux, moyen de café, léger de chocolat noir avec des notes de houblon floral, de fumée de cigarette ainsi que des traces de caramel. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune  texture crémeuse.  Notes de réglisse noir et de fumée de cigarette avec de faibles traces fruitées (raisins vineux et cerises) et de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche rapidement suivi dun goût de grains de malt assez rôtis (faibles traces brûlées), dun léger goût de chocolat noir et caramel doux avec des notes de mélasse terreuse puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses avec un léger goût de café. Post-goût moyen-long et aux notes sèches, moyen-léger amer de rôti, léger de houblon herbeux avec des notes de café et de chocolat noir.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a small off-white head. Aroma is mellow roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and oatmeal. Very easy drinkable, smooth chocolaty and coffee taste with a mild malty bitter aftertaste. Medium body.

On draft at elephant and castle DC. Pours a dark cola color with a thick creamy beige head.  Malty aroma with some raisin notes.  Smooth, rich mouthfeel with chocolate and toasted malt notes.  Slightly bitter finish.  Nice porter.

50cl bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus. Dark brown to black color with a nice dark deep red glow coming through. Full sized beige head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma has malts, oatmeal and chocolate. Taste malts, chocolate, roasty, full body, slightly liquorice wood. Very complete full bodied taste for a beer of only 5.4% ABV. Wow!

Bottle thx to benzai. Dark brown with a nice red glow, small off-white head. Smells oatmeal, roasty, coffee  chocolate.. Quite an amazing smell. Tastes oatmeal, chocolate, roasty, bread, ?hostie?.. Amazing beer. After a few sips some liquorice comes through. Did not expect this. Great aftertaste. Very nice body for its abv, silky, fitting carbo.
Très sombre, presque noir. Carbonation moyenne. Un nez fort de chocolat. Le goût initiale est de chocolat et malt torrefier qui devient du café en finale. Très bonne.

Milk chocolate aroma, dark malts. Dark and thick, with minimal brown head for a porter. Delicious taste, dark chocolate, roasted malt and a bit of a metallic flavor but not too distracting. Well balance long hop bitter finish. Medium bodied, regular carbonation. Good porter
"The" Porter. Ne cherche plus, cest elle. café , un peu de chocolat sans l amertume dune Guinness. Densité, corps modere

Deep brown body with dark ruby highlights and a tan head. Aroma of Coffee and roast, bittersweet chocolate, maybe a touch of liquorish. Taste of strong roast, chocolate, burnt toast,  nice body. Bitter roast palate. Excellent porter.

Dark brown with yellow pour. Head is off white to tan. Aroma is sweet and fruity for a porter. Feel is to thin. Taste has coffee, chocolate and sweet malt. Not a great example of a porter, bit an enjoyable beer.I like it.

Rich and dark like it says.  Strong but not overpowering dark chocolate taste.  Very good.

Maku on odotetusti paahteinen ja siinä on myös suolaisuutta, lakritsaa ja kahvia joukossa. Suutuntuma on hyvin mieto, jopa yllättävän mieto. Kokonaisuutena erittäin maistuva ja monimuotoinen portteri, tyylinsä parhaita Suomesta saatavia.

Bottle from Waitrose Supermarket, Ipswich. Poured black with large frothy head which soon disappeared. Certainly rich and dark, and very nice, though not convinced by the claim of it being the worlds finest porter. Toasted caramel evident.
Botella. Color negro con espuma blanca y persistente. Aroma a tofe, caramelo y chocolate. En boca es fina y sedosa con muchos matices de regaliz dulce y achocolatada, muy equilibrada, una delicia

Flaske fra Polet: nesten helt svart. Skummet er nøttebrunt og tett, og blir hengende på glasset. Aroma av kaffe og mørk sjokolade. Smaken likeså, kompleks og fyldig med et snev av humle. Stor munnfylde og herlig ettersmak. På slutten av ettermaken er der en antydning av blodappelsin som skaper en god friskhet. En klassiker innen genren, og virkelig noe å strekke seg etter for oss hjemmebryggere! I tillegg har Fullers en vakker flaskedesign, virkelig en av mine favoritter.
Sweet and roasty notes of toffee and coffee on the nose. Sweet toffee up front develops into rich nuttiness before the lingering mocha finish.

Bottle. Gift from Neko-chan. Thick chocolate, mild sweet coffee nose. Very dark brown, no head, little lace. Medium-bitter chocolate initial; mid has more chocolate, some anise, and ashes; fianls has a tangy edge, and is smooth, with a fine bitterness. Medium body. Well made, tasty. Not over the top, but just right.

This beer is an example of what a fine Porter should taste like. They say this was the beer of the working class in London, I can see why. Finally a Porter that is strong, but not as coffee tasting as a stout.

Pours a deep brown with a tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, and dark fruits. Taste is very mellow with subtle hops in there but the malts dominate here. Carbonation is very soft and the bitterness is rather tame. Overall it is a very drinkable porter, and one great example of the style.

Huge brown head. Clear black colour. Astonishing creamy, roasty caramel aroma. Delicious spicy taste and a softly unfolding roasty, coffee palate that tickles your tongue. Maybe the best beer I have ever drunk.

I would never give any beer a perfect score, save this one.  Best porter anywhere, ever.  The richness, complexity and overall flavour are divine.  Excellent for reading by the fire, post-dinner, with dessert or even just for a refreshing autumn or spring day.  In the right mood - even a summertime possibility!  Fullers makes great beers, but they dominate this category for sure
The best porter I have had so far! Nice dark colour. Great caramel, chocolate, coffee, roasty aroma and taste. Definitely must try if you enjoy porters.
Black body offwhite head.  Aroma has roasted malt, acid, dark fruits. Flavour has coffee, roasted caramel, ash, acids. Palate is really full for such mild porter.

Bottle at home. 
Slightly burnt aroma, notes og coffee. 
Dark brown color with reddish tan, small offwhite  head. 
Burned barley taste notes og coffee, a bit watery but really nice. 

Bolton Brew Rocks !!
50cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark color. Thin to medium head. Medium carbonation. Coffee aroma. Medium bitterness.
Här är portföljen till brädden fylld av högskolepoäng i ämnen som briljans, gemyt och smakexplosion. Några år till i skolbänken och doktorshatten kan hämtas ut i receptionen.

text: 11.2 oz bottle pours an opaque dark brown with fair tan head and good lacing.  Aroma is full of chocolate, roasted malt and coffee, with some dark fruits.  Taste is cholatey sweet with a tad of bitterness and chalkiness in the finish.  Body is medium to full with slight carbonation.  Mouthfeel is oily.   This has everything I expect in a porter, and is the one to beat.

Bottle. Pours an almost black color with a moderate white head. Nose is a little roasty with some hints of toffee. Taste is just a tad bitter. Not too bad on the palate. Not the easiest drink, but OK.

500ml can. Pours medium thick white head. Colour black with amber hue. Yeasty on the nose with some hop. Taste is pronounced chocolate and coffee with some dates and plums. Medium sweet. Finish is long and spicy. Wonderful porter.

Pours a small off white head, a glazed lacing. Very dark brown color. Quite thick body, a bit oily. Aroma of cookies and confectionery, hint of coffee. Taste of dark bread, sugar and the classic porter chalk in the after

500ml bottle - so this is THE porter, hey? It looks a deep ruby, near black body, with a decent white head. Now for the big test, it has a delicate smoke to the nose, a bit of espresso, a bit of cocoa, The first taste has a dry touch, feels like many decent stouts, a mouthful of burnt toast and oatmeal, it is really nice. I wish it had a bit more substance, then Id be coo-ing.

Dark brown to black in colour with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate and malt, similar flavour with a little bitter coffee finish.

Pint bottle from Waitrose (3 for a fiver at present.) Served cool, poured into a small chalice. Rich dark ruby with a tan head. Chocolate and licquorice aromas. Milk choc, licquorice and dark fruit flavours. Big juicy mouth filling palate and silky texture. Simple, and delicious. Nicest beer Ive had for a while, and possibly the best porter ever.

Weak aroma of roasted, chocolatey malt. Good head and overall appearance. Flavor makes up for faint aroma for sure - silky, lingering cocoa malts with nuttiness, coffee roast, and something else I cannot quite describe. Classy beer. Can be savored or sessioned. Great example of the style.

Can 50cl. Pours a small off white head, a glazed lacing. Very dark brown color. Quite thick body, a bit oily. Aroma of cookies and confectionery, hint of coffee. Taste of dark bread, sugar and the classic porter chalk in the after.
