es la mejor porter que he tomado hasta ahora,olor a cafe,malta tostada,cocoa un aroma refrescante y ,al paladar malta tostada con un balance aromatico entre cafe, cocoa, malta y lupulo.pronunciado que queda bien balanciado levemente persistente. Una delicia
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
I often mock the British beer scene for being too boring and archaic, but sometimes a traditional British brew really hits the spot. Case in point: Fullers London Porter. While not the most robust or complex beer ever made, it definitely is impressive for its ability to be so tasty and so smooth for an old world style brew.

I poured an 11.2oz bottle into a nonic pint glass.

Appearance: Deep dark ruby red thats seemingly opaque black. Forms a huge, tan, frothy head which lingers and leaves gorgeous lacing on the glass.

Smell: Classic porter aroma of black licorice, milk chocolate and dark malts.

Taste: There actually isnt a lot happening with the palate to Fullers London Porter, but whats here is just so good. A blend of slight confectionery sweetness, a hint of coffee bitterness and a lingering chocolate candy aftertaste are the three main components to this brew. Its simple, yes, but theyre so enjoyable for their distinctiveness and the way they all transition together. Not quite as sickly sweet as many stouts, and has less bitterness as well. I think this may be the absolute best beer to give to someone to show that "dark beers" can be flavorful but not intimidating. Light sweetness and light bitterness create for a perfectly balanced, delectable body.

Drinkability: As satisfying as the palate is, I think what really makes this such a good beer is just how easily drinkable it is. The body is on the thinner side (for a "dark beer"), but its not thin or watery per se. Its velvety smooth across the tongue and might even be considered refreshing for a moment there. The aftertaste isnt completely clean, but just enough to leave a pleasing taste that doesnt dry out the mouth. At 5.4% Fullers London Porter is dangerously drinkable because it could easily be sessioned all day, even though its a tad too big to technically be a session beer.

330 ml bottle into pint glass, best before 8/6/2013.  Pours crystal clear dark reddish brown color with a 1 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Spotty soapy lacing clings to the glass.  Aromas of big milk chocolate, caramel, toffee, cream, roasted malt, coffee, toast, light dark fruit, and light herbal hops.  Fantastic aromas with great balance and strength.  Taste of milk chocolate, caramel, toffee, coffee, roasted malt, cocoa, citrus, toast, and herbal.  Good amount of citrus and roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, coffee, caramel, toffee, roasted malt, toast, cocoa, and herbal on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic flavor balance and robustness; zero cloying flavors on the finish.  Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied; with a creamy and lightly slick mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol presence is invisible, with zero warming noticed on the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic English porter!  Great flavor robustness and balance; and extremely smooth to drink.  Simply outstanding.  I cant believe I havent had this before.
A perfect porter with a very deep body. Chocolate tone are combined with a caramel taste. Complex to describe but it fits. It is balanced.

Fullers London Porter has a thin-to-medium beige head and a dark brown or almost black appearance (ruby under direct sunlight). There is not much lacing associated with this. The aroma is of rich, dark-roasted malt, chocolate, dark coffee, and sweetness. Taste is the same, with chocolate powder and some burnt aspects. Bitterness is low. Mouthfeel is low medium, and Fullers London Porter finishes refreshing, mellow, and highly drinkable. Overall, this really is a world-class beer! RJT

How should I know indeed. Hes not the best, and I normally prefer East Coast, but in terms of pure enjoyment Id say Snoop. Lodi, dodi, we likes to party, we dont cause trouble, we dont bother nobody. Again, not original, that would be Slick Rick. I once split up a fight between two youths who were fighting over Snoop because one had dissed the Dogfather. Brilliant. Hes mates with Willie Nelson as well., smoking buddies apparently. I love Snoop. I love this beer. Many thanks to The Bish for the kind gift of a cracking porter. May I kick a little something for the Gs? Laid back...

Pours dark cola, red tints, rough-bubbled light brown head.
Aroma is roasty, coffee and chocolate.
Flavour is a nice, smoky malt...vanilla, chocolate.
An absolutely wonderful beer.
Truly worthy of its stats.
Coffee aroma. Rich super dark brown colour with a velvety caramel head. Nice coffee taste and a sweet malty fruitiness.
Bottle. Brownish head. Wonderful, smoked malty aroma. Dark brown colour. Rich, deliciously malty, smoked taste. Dry, pleasant palate. Fantastic.

Black with a red tint. Big beige head. A rich roasted aroma filled with chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Sweet, bitter and roasted, the taste is very rich but extremely well balanced and in no way overpowering, some faint acidic notes from the roasted malts. The smooth slightly bitter chocolaty aftertaste just keeps going and going. On the palate, once again, balance is the key, a rich mouthfeel without losing an ounce of drinkability. This a beer you can either sip and savour or simply chug like a madman, but I guess that is a bit of a waste. The one beer I always try to have in the fridge. I say try because I keep running out for some reason.
Do this beer a favour and let it warm up a bit before you drink it. The more robust flavours come out. Caramel and bitter chocolate on the nose and tongue

Oscura, ligera, de finísma espuma que desaparece totalmente. Aromas a chocolate y malta tostada. Tiene poco cuerpo y no está muy gasificada, por lo que añadido al hecho de que no tiene mucho alcohol se bebe con una facilidad pasmosa. El boca el sabor que predomina es el del chocolate amargo, que se mantiene agradablemente.
Bottled. Very dark red-brown with a reasonable light brown head. Aroma has a balance of chocolatey malt and floral hops. Velvety smooth rich malt in the mouth, then a hoppy fresh finish. Very good.

Very dark brown colour, almost black, with a consistent, longlasting and dense beige head, very beautiful aspect. Aromas markly pronounced, to black coffee and dark chocolate and a slight presence of alcohol. In mouth, it begins with a mild bitterness which turns into a coffee sweetness to lead to a definitive end of a earthy and very tasty bitterness. Perfect development, a palate between rough and oily, high-bodied but not heavy. Very, very good beer.

Possibly the best porter at the moment. The aroma of dark chocolate and coffee takes the impressions. The head stays for a long time like a crown. Very nice. Now the taste is equally divided between the chocolate and the coffee but a hint of caramel makes an appearance. The balance changes a bit as the beer gets warmer. Aftertaste equally great. Drink it with a piece of 70% chocolate at the side.

33cl bottle.black colour, brown and huve foam (but foam doesnot standstill so long).. Aroma is roasted malt, some coffe and also sweetnees! Very complex.taste is mainly roasted flavours and coffee. Great beer..

473mL can. Pours black with a fine, butterscotch head. The aroma is of toast, dark malt, and a bit of vanilla. The taste is up-front, chocolate richness and bitterness, with just a touch of sweetness. There is a slightly different, dryer bitterness in the finish from hops. The full body defies the reasonable alcohol content.
On tap pours a darkish brown. Aroma and taste is coffee and chocolate. Good porter

500mL bottle.  Pours clear black with deep red highlights and a thick off-white head.  Aromas of dark chocolate, roast coffee and a little grass.  Mild sweetness, low bitterness, roasty, slightly biscuity.  Light-medium bodied, soft-average carbonation, a little astringency and a lingering finish.

Pours black with a small khaki head. Aroma is huge roasted malts and a little coffee. Taste is the same but adds a nice chocolate note. Palate is indistinct. Very tasty.

text: Bottle. Small head. Dark brown. Plenty of roasted toasted licorice malty notes. Sweet dry taste and finish. Solid firm body. Agree very nice Classic porter.

From notes: Poured deep, almost opaque, brown-to-black with a 1-finger tan head.  Rich aroma with roasty and chocolatey notes.  Full-bodied, with a nice, lingering creamy finish.  Nutty and chocolatey flavors, with a touch of bright citrus at the back and a nice, roasty note in the finish.  Have to agree with a previous reviewer...if you like porter, find this one.

Bottiglia da 500 ml. Si presenta con un bel colore tonaca di frate molto scuro e una schiuma fine, compatta di color nocciola carico molto persistente. Al naso i profumi sono discreti con sentori di malto tostato, cioccolato fondente e liquirizia che si ripetono poi in bocca ma in maniera più marcata soprattutto nella liquirizia, il finale è mediamente secco.

Could someone do some photocopying for me please? I need to get 500 pages copied in the next 3 minutes or the sky might fall in. If they dont Im going to combust with urgency. This is an issue that needs resolving, if it is not I will create a fuss the likes of which you will regret having created. There, thats better. And breathe... ahhh.... beer....
Bottle at brewfellas. Pours very dark with very nicely retained head. Aromas of chocolate and coffeeYou would expect the alcohol would be slightly higher for this exceptional beer. Amazing beer.

Bière noire aux reflets roux foncés, col brun pâle et crémeux, mousse fine et adhérente. Arômes de malt grillé (pain brûlé) et de cacao. Épaisse et onctueuse en bouche, assez pétillante, sucrée, amertume moyenne, elle laisse en bouche des saveurs de cacao et de rôtie brûlée, finale houblonnée. 

Un excellent porter, équilibré, pas trop sucré, assez amer, complexe.

For once something as good as advertised.  They say its the worlds greatest porter and as far as my experience has been so far, I agree.  The aroma is packed with dark chocolate and coffee with malt that is deep and stays in your nose.  This is a very dark and thick beer with an off-white head that dissipated quickly with some creamy brown lacing.  The taste is like the worlds finest dark chocolate meets the worlds finest coffee.  Its a perfect mix that is thick and smooth in mouth feel and leaves a nice mocha after taste.  Overall, this is the best porter Ive had the opportunity to try and a staple through the fall and winter when I can find it.  Usually Costco has a mixed pack with this, the ESB and one other.  Well worth buying for 6 of these.

Malt, cream, coffee, chocolate, and roast in the aroma.  Taste is smooth and malty, with chocolate, coffee and nut.  Nice roast coffee bitterness in the finish, and a very creamy mouthfeel.  If you like porters, this is one you need to try.

Veramente unottima Porter.
Poca schiuma ma un aroma intenso tostato e caramellato. Al palato ha un gusto pieno e per nulla ruvido. Caffè e aromi affumicati completano un lungo e gustoso finale
UPDATED: NOV 8, 2012 Can. Dark brown almost black colour with a thick tan head. Roasty chocolate aroma. Flavour is sweet, roasty.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Deep dark brown - blackish in colour, staple head. Taste of dark coffee and espresso combined with some beef cube flavour.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Once again Fullers convinced  me. A huge mixture of a German schwarzbier and a Guinness. Heavy in look and maybe in taste but very drinkable and full of aroma. Grade A beer.

Opaque black color. Nuts and smoke on the nose. Smoky and
chocolate on the palate. Medium bodied with a slightly creamy texture. Slight bitterness on the finish, well hopped in the English way.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2012 Bottle. Transparent rubyred-brownish with a frothy rather quickly diminishing tan head. Lovely tobacco-like nose, nuts, licorice, dusty wood, forgotten memories, roasted malts and a mild earthy note in the aroma. Flavor is sweet roasted malt, light chocolate and licorice with a smooth smoke note. Sticky mouthfeel. Dry roasted medium bitter finish, with a hop bite that tingles the tongue in a perfect manner.

Never noticed I hadnt rated this one yet. A beer Ive enjoyed quite a few times over the years whenever I could actually find it. Produces up a lustrous, darkest ruby that shimmers when held to the light. At cellar temperature when poured it raises up a thickset, creamy tan head that adheres a frost down the length of the glass. Rich chocolate, Madeira and Kopiko toffee meets earthy, smoky peat, heavy loam and heather on the aroma - so thick and all consuming. Creamy, rounded and smooth on the palate. Rich, burnt sugar front; dark powdery chocolate comes in before a heavily smoky, bitter, charred wood backend. Nice level of earthy hops and malt on the finish. Very long swallow; a continuation of the complex flavours of the palate with inklings of liquorice, Madeira and ash. So much presence, so much volume for a pasteurised, filtered  porter of such strength. A lovely brew. One to keep hunting down! (50cL, no date stamp, Liquor Barons, Ocean Reef)

chocolate, toast, resin, earthy, black, clear, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, oily feel, creamy, soft carbonation, lightly bitter, 

Not sure what the fuss is about - a regular English Ale but without the conditioning of the cask (of course).  Not bad overall with a very nice creamy black pour and brown head forming proud in the pint glass.  Aromas of chocolate/coffee were subtle, mouth feel slightly slick, with lighter than expected bitterness in the finish.  Thin bodied, but expected for the style, and understated alcohol - although not a Porter fan, this was a decent pint.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2012 Dark brown with a thin tan head. Roasty, malty, cocoa, chocolate aroma. Taste follows aroma - chocolate, cocoa, roast malts, with a subtle bitter dry  hop backbone. A thick, oily creamy mouthfeel and smooth, low carbonation. What a porter is supposed to be. Re-rated after I had on draight - creaminess makes it even better.

Aroma: chocolate, dark fruit, hints of coffee. Appearance: a deep dark brown with ruby highlights with a mostly diminishing tan head and fine lacing. Taste: god! This what a porter should taste like! Dark roasted malts, chocolate, a hint of of dark fruit, and slight hop bitterness in the finish. Pallet: SMOOTH full bodied with minimal carbonation. Overall: one of my favorite porters. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with a creamy, fully lasting, brown head. Aroma main drivers are roasted, toasted malts, with some coffee and dark chocolate hints. The taste is again characterized by roasted malts, mild coffee, caramel. Leaves a well balanced flavor, between bitter, sweet, and dry, with a pleasant watery texture. Great example of a porter.

Wonderful aroma of coffee and roasted malts with a solid hint of chocolate. Dark brown, almost black pour. Thick, two-finger caramel brown head. Taste is that of the smell amplified with a bit more chocolate. Great roasted chocolate aftertaste! Palate is creamy, not unlike Guinness. Medium body with a bit of carbonation. Nothing overpowering and quite easy on the pallet. Very easy to drink and a perfect example of what a porter should be. Definitely worth seeking out.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Very dark brown, pours a finger head, thin lacing remains throughout. Smells of roast malt, rich dark chocolate, slight coffee and hop presence. Taste follows aroma, roast malt at first blending with bittersweet chocolate and black coffee. Hips come in mid mouth and linger with the coffee no alcohol presence. Nice carbonation, medium mouthfeel, not as thick as I preffer, but not thin.  This is one of the best porters out there. I compare this to Founders Porter.
This to my mind is what porters are all about. Lovely choc and malt flavours with a good supporting hop bitterness. A really lovely porter in the traditional style.

One of the best porters that are widely available. Chocolate and coffee are both present, very rich roasty taste with a small bite of hoppiness. Rich and complex, as their slogan goes. This is what I buy when Im not feeling adventurous, just wanting a solid beer that can guarantee enjoyment.
Muito boa.

Can. Very dark brown with an almost beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted coffee. Tastes more coffee and it has some good bitterness to it.
Slightly dry and flat.

Very dark brown pour, light brown head.  Nice roasted dark chocolate aroma. Dark fruit, a little molasses and vanilla. Creamy. Sweet throughout. Lasting cocoa finish. Its not complex but its simple and flavorful. Good proper porter.

Thought Id try this as I like Porters. However, this is an unpleasant drink. It tastes like the hops have been burnt. I cant finish the point. Ive drunk about a third of it in an attempt to aquire the taste, but Ill be pouring the rest down the sink! This is not nice - avoid.
The head is medium-good, the body is red. It smells bitter chocolate, a bit coffee. The taste ia chocolate-bitter, coffee-bitter. Good 11/12/11/12/12/12

A: The color is a deep, dark brown with crimson / ruby highlights that emerge when held to the light. The color is deep, but the beer is not opaque. After a vigorous pour, the head stands in at nearly two inches thick, rising to the crest of the tulip glass. It gradually fades over a few minutes, leaving ample lacing in its wake.

S: The aroma grows stronger as the beer warms, but overall, its the weakest aspect of the beer, in my opinion. Nice notes of chocolate and subtle roast aromas are the most prominent scents.

T: The beer tastes quite good. The beer leads off with a heavy chocolate flavor, followed by subtle coffee notes. The roast character is subtle, with extremely little hop presence in the finish. Overall, the flavor could be a bit more aggressive, or bolder. However, the beer is balanced very well and its quite easy to drink and enjoy.

M: Carbonation level is great. The beer is light to medium bodied with alcohol presence virtually non-existent.

D: A solid example of the style. Its not my favorite porter, but I definitely recommend it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-07-2010

Pours a dark red-brown with a smallish tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, smoke, and bread. Flavor of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Long lingering bitterness all the way through. Very good.

11.2oz bottle - pours dark amber with brownish head and spotty lacing. Nose is roasted malts and coffee. Flavors adds dark chocolate. Dry and bitter finish. Easy to drink and somewhat light but very tasty. Getting a light licorice aftertaste.

Pours a dark brown from the bottle with thick, frothy tan head that dissipates and moderate lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, and dark fruits. Taste follows suit, but a sweet flavor comes through first, followed by a slightly bitter finish. Great porter overall.

Draught at the Porter and Sons. Coke coloured, a little clear, beige head. A little coffee and toffee aroma, some roast, roasted potatoes and a little wood. Bitter, chocolatey taste. Sleek, lively carbonation, medium body, rich chocolate finish. Good.

A - Pours what appears to be black but has a red hue when put to light. Small compact head that is stays small and creamy

S - Robust roasted malt, fresh brown bread, coffe, cocoa and a bit of a sourish tang as well that surprised me

T - Roasty flavors similar to the smell. heavy on the roasted malt bit of coffee and the finish is where the brown bread comes in

MD - Smooth adn Creamy. the carbonation tickles th etongue at first but softens quickly. A very easy drinking beer.

Great easliy found beer that Very good. When found on Cask it is AMAZING.
Very dark red colour, reddish foam. Mild roasty smell. Pleasant on tongue. A bit watery, strong coffee sweet taste. Very good beer, a bit watery.

Medium strong aroma has french roast coffee and salty licorice, bit suryp. Hops add nice perky touch. Coulour is red/black to black. Medium lenght beige head leaves lacing. Dry and roasted. Medium bodied with standard carbonation, long dry finish. A pure example of its style succeeds where it should. Nice balance. Not much nuances but good pure and tasteful flavors.

500ml can. Creates only marginal tan head - heck, let's just call it a lace. Dark opaque body (Lovibond 37) with ruby highlights.  Negligible aroma... Tastes amazingly smooth though. Very complex but not heavy. Watery palate, mostly flat. Rich texture and light chocolate finish. Neither sweet nor bitter. Not bold but not boring. Very interesting.
Black pour with light brown head... Expresso aroma.. Taste is awesome...some nuts smoke coffe.. Well put together..very easy drinking

#38
Die Farbe eines Guinness mit kaffeefarbender Crema obenauf. Ein intensives Kaffee-Röstmalzaroma mit Zartbitterschokolade. Der Antrunk ist nicht so vollmundig wie erwartet. Geschmacklich ebenfalls schokoladig, kaffeeartig, ja gar etwas fruchtig nach Steinobst. Der röstmalzige Abgang wird dabei angenehm vom kräftigem Hopfen unterstützt. Ein tolles, facettenreiches Bier zum schlürfen! Zur Perfektion müsste es -für meinen Geschmack- noch einen Ticken kräftiger, ja voluminöser ausfallen ;)
Fazit: Für mich bis dato das überzeugendste Fullers!
En skön porter med tunn kropp och mycket rostad malt i smaken. Slutsats: ett bra avbräck från vanlig öl.
0.5L can. Pours dark black with a tanned head. Nose of light roasted coffee. Aroma of sweet dark chocolate and a coffee. Nice sweet, yet mellow. Surprisingly good considering it was in a can.
Ive found out that it was chocolate+coffe flavored right after my first sip and its even more than just a beer for me since then.

Balance, this sums up this excellent beer, which was once the most popular beer style in England albeit 120 years ago. Brown malt is the key to this beer style and engineering. Coffee and chocolate nose, slightly smoky, slightly hoppy, slightly sweet finish. Difficult to find in any London pub.  Brewed this beer many time from Graham Wheelers book. An classic and unrated beer style.

500ml bottle. Clear deep red glowing dark brown with huge, firm, creamy, lacing, off-white head. Dark malty, roasty aroma, grassy to herbal hoppy note, decent milk chocolate and coffee background. Taste is initially dry roasty dark malty, evolves via a slightly salty note to explicit grassy hop, before again a dark roasty malt touch takes over; mineralic touch throughout, carbonation matches perfect; lasting dry, grassy hoppy finish. Rich, manifold, perfectly balanced Porter.
I just love that coffee and chocolate aroma and a full body, and thats why for me my favorite beer is this, until now, I still need to try others

Bottle @ Beer OClock 2 in Bucharest.

Dark brown colour with a creamy beige head.

Aroma has notes of roasted coffee, chocolate, caramel, malt, raisins,blueberry, dry soil.

Full body, bittersweet taste, lively carbonation, creamy texture, bitter aftertaste.

On can from bolaget Strømstad.
Black color, good foam.
Aromas of coffee, chocolate and malty notes.
Medium body & complexity .
Good bitterness
Enjoyable

Wow, it certainly lives up to the reputation. The aroma is big coffee with notes of chocolate in the back. The beer is a transparent black with a creamy head the fades quickly leaving little islands of foam to the bottom of the glass. The taste is again coffee and chocolate with an additional umami like note of presence. The beer is towards the sweet and roasty side, but is nicely balanced by a delicate bitter finish. Full bodied and velvety smooth. A true classic.
Full-bodied, dark porter with coffee aroma. The taste ir lightly sweet, with some bitterness as well. Low carbonation with long and tasty finish. Recommended for all stout fans.

On tap at the British beer company. 
It comes to the table in a proper English pint a solid dark brown color with beautiful ruby highlights when held to light. Creamy tan/brown head shows great retention and covers most of the glass on the way down. Smells heavy on the chocolate, but also has generous helpings of caramel, brown sugar, earthy, and mineral aromas. The flavor leans to the malty side with chocolate and caramel dominating the flavor. Theres an earthy and mineral flavor that does nicely to cut through the malt and provide some balance. Medium body with a light to moderate level of carbonation and a creamy sweet mouthfeel. This is a really nice porter with a great expression of chocolate malt. I might have to drink more of these.

50cl can from Systembolaget. Pours very dark, almost black with a beige head. Malty and fruity aroma with some smoky and roasty notes. Sweet and fruity with mild flavour of roasted malt, dark fruits and a hint of coffee and chocolate. Finishes lightly hoppy and bitter. Slightly chocolaty aftertaste. Nice porter!

Bottle found at the local supermarket. Funny thing is, I was looking three days for it while visiting London and even good pubs that had the "Fullers" logo did not have it. I found it in the local store in New Jersey the day I got back from England!

Pours deep brown color with significant head. Aroma is rich and delightful and flavor is equally bold. I love the hint of smoke. A very rare combination of flavorful and drinkable brew.  Excellent.

Bottle from Waitrose. A deep brown/black colour with ruby hints. Nice off-white head. Aroma is roast malty, slightly creamy, chocolate and coffee. Initial taste is slightly sweet, a bit of alcohol, malt, then drier, with some ash bitterness in the finish. Drinks very smoothly, a nice porter.
Inköpt på systembolaget, provad 2010-10-29. Mycket god, mustig och med en fantastisk fyllighet.

Smoky aroma is a joy to invite into the nose with its quality coffee, licorice and molasses notes and hints of charred wood, yeast and - anchovies? Pours a rich, cool sable that is just a kittens whisker above midnight black with a thick and fine-bubbled, it not too persistent, buff head. Flavor does not disappoint - smoked wood, roast coffee and licorice dominate the flavor but let through hints of treacle and herbs. Full body has plenty of fizz and leaves a nice smoky, slightly hoppy, slightly sweet finish. I can see - er, make that taste - why this is a top rated Porter! Mud in your eyes!

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2012 Deepest claret, thin brown head; roasted malt character, smooth chocolate, a hint of coffee and some luscious raisin and cherry fruitiness; delicately sweet; velvety mouthfeel; some spice; an long, moreish, earthy hop finish; luxuriously good.
Simply just one og the best porters out there injoy it all the time :). But everything from fullers are wonderfull

Tap. Pours deep brown and clear with a small brown creamy head that eventually dissipates with good lacing. Aroma is strong roasted malts and coffee, plus a bit of chocolate. Taste is a bit sweet with coffee and roasted malt dominating, with a medium bitter finish. Rich and full bodied in the mouth.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2012 Pours a nice slightly translusscent black. Veery nice chocolate and malt aromas...maple too. Smooth and slick palate. Chocolate, and maple flavours balanced nicely with just the right amount of roasty bitterness. Yum.

Sample at Brewsapalooza. Pours dark brown with about a finger of nut brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and a little dark fruit. Taste is the same. Medium bodied with a somewhat thin texture. Soft carbonation and a long finish. Overall, very good. I would drink this again.
Black pour. Smoke, coffee, dark chocolate and burnt caramel aromas. Earthy, sour flavours with a hint of licorice. Earthy, bitter finish.

Bottle. Clear dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of burnt sugar up front with a little coffee, chocolate, molasses and lots of dark fruits, berries and plums. Taste is  a nice balance of chocolate, coffee, molasses, and dark fruits of the forest flavors, very cake-like, lightly spiced, plum, dates, raisins. Sloghlty sweet and sticky. Very pudding like. Doesnt smack you in the face with roasted flavours like some dark beers, focus is more on dark and ripe fruity notes. I enjoyed this more the more I drank

Im a huuuuge fan of this beer. While pale ales are all about the hop/malt balance and the stronger IPAs are about the balance between different types of hops, the key to porters is the balance between the chocolate, coffee, and malt flavours. I think Fullers hit the perfect note with this brew, with no astringency or cloying bite whatsoever. The dry smoothness of the liquid goes perfectly with the flavour. In a perfect world this would be on tap at every bar.
Bottle at bar. Dark brown color, beige head. Smooth, a bit sweet taste with coffee, plum, herbs, toast and liquorice. Roasty finish. Excellent porter.

May 28 2012. Can pours black, hint of mahogany in bright light, with tan tight head comprised of tiny bubbles. Head diminishes to ring and leaves little lacing. Not sure if can is a lot different than bottle but I was disappointed after hearing such great reviews. Aroma had sour twist of black olives or fig that is carried through taste and overpowered other flavours of malts and coffee. A lot of depth in flavour. A little too complicated for my preference. Good dry palate and slight bitter aftertaste.

12 oz bottle pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted malt and coffee.  Taste is the same with a hint of chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black as gets, and with a beige, creamy and lasting head. The aroma is powerfull for a porter, with lots of coffee, and some roasted malts and chocolate. Its very tasty as well, coffee and lots of roastyness. I even thought it was a bit smokey. Best porter Ive ever tried by far.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2012 Tried this back to back with Anchor Porter and I thought Anchor both looked and tasted better. Still, this is a good porter. Black with off white head. Roasted malts, coffee, some sweetness there, too. Enjoyable.
Try it next time you go out. I did not like sweet or floral drinks. So this was more my style.

From a bottle in America.
Nose has hints of chocolate and stronger notes of espresso.
Pours a nice frothy head that laces the glass; near black body with hints of red in the light.  
Taste has some sweet chocolate cake notes, espresso, some bitter chocolate notes.  Finishes with a lovely hops balance and bitterness to round out the chocolate.  Mouthfeel is creamy.  Overall very delicious.  Good session beer.

0,5l can. Dark brown color. Nice big thick, creamy head, stays. Roasted malts, chocolate, caramel in aroma. Flavor is pretty much the same with buttery smoothness added. Very easy to drink. Good beer.

Bottle from Waitrose for the Mass Online Tasting. Pours a very dark brown colour with a rocky light tan head. A lovely aroma of roasty malt, chocolate and caramel. Similar roasty malt and chocolate flavours. Mild bitterness with moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Very nice.

Almost a perfect.
This is what I want from a porter.
Nice black color, great aromas.
Roasted malts on taste and an amazing aftertaste.
Great beer.
Pours a dark brown, decent light tan head. Warm aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, and a hint of nuttiness. Smooth, with a mild bitter finish.

Malty and milky. Im slightly dissapointed by this beer, its got body and a nice bitter aftertaste that is quite dry. Sounds great? I can see why its a highly rated beer but the initial mouth is so lactose tasting that it almost spoils the overall taste. Imagine this milk-milkshake-milk stout-Irish stout -ordinary bitter-smoke, this beer covers all those tastes and in that order in the first 10 seconds of every sip. Not for me but if youre a fan of weaker stouts, lighlty carbonated porters or even if you like milk stouts then this may well be your dream come true.

500 ml bottle bought in Jumbo, Santiago de Chile. Pours a very dark and elegant brown-mahogany color with a fine tan espresso head. Absolutely perfect appearance. Aroma is malty with some roastiness. Initially I get notes of hay, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, lactose, almond nougat and mokka. Some hops can be barely noticeable but adding some complexity of dry leaves. Taste is strong, semi-bitter with very clear roastiness. Notes of bitter chocolate, fine tobacco, mokkacino and caramel.  Some light smoke in the finish. Overwhelming. Full bodied beer but not too heavy. Finish is roasty and leaves a torrified aftertaste. The best Porter Ive ever tasted by far and one of the best bottled English beers.

Bottle. Very dark pour with a smaller cream head. Big roasty coffee and chocolate aroma. Good full palate, especially for the style. Taste is also sharp roasty coffee with some chocolate, and a hint of black cherry. This is what a porter should be. Fantastic.

Brown 500ml bottle, best before April 2008, drank May 2007. 

Poured into a pint sleeve glass, it is dark, very dark mahogany, and a hint of red, with a fast shrinking coffee coloured head. I like the head to stay on my beers, this turned very quickly into no more than a wisp and collar around the glass. 

Aroma of rich coffee, dark chocolate, burnt caramel and some plum pudding. 

The taste is very similar to the smell, lots of chocolate, coffee and caramel flavours in there. 

Dry and a little watery for such a dark looking beer, strangely the chocolate, coffee and caramel tones do not stay for long in the mouth. It does however sweeten up as the flavours die. 

Too overpowering in the coffee stakes for me, the chocolate and caramel I can handle OK, but just a little too much decaff.

Beau liquide noir opaque ayant une mousse des plus typique, se dissipant lentement, qui laisse une belle dentelle classique. Nez de grains grillés, de torréfaction avec des pointes de chocolat foncé. Goût assez fidèle aux arômes, en plus, le chocolat épaulé par des saveurs de café et de mélasse prennent position. Légère amertume en arrière-goût qui vient nouer la boucle. Quel plaisir gustatif. (219-050512)

Black with a tan head. Dark chocolate coffee and roasted malts on the nose. Espresso, chocolate, a hint of dark cherries and sourness in the flavour. Very well balanced. Creamy mouth feel with a small bit of carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2012 Bottle 0,5 l - Beer OClock pub
Appearance: Clear dark brown color, with a average, mostly diminishing tan head.
Aroma: moderate -  roasted malt, chocolate, coffee.
Taste:  moderate sweet with a moderate bitter finish.
Palate: Body is medium, Texture is watery, carbonation is soft.

Porter is probably my favorite style of beer.  Mostly because they are low hops and have a dark malty bitterness to them.  And Fullers London Porter is definitely a good choice if you like porters.  Appearance and aroma are fairly typical of most porters, but the flavor is very full bodied.  If youre a light beer fan, stay away from this bad boy.  But if you really like bitter malty brews - pick up a six pack of this.
Aroma is chocolate/coffee and roasted malts.  Pours a deep opaque brown with a nice tan head.  Tastes like coffee with hints of chocolate and caramel.  A great porter.
Indeed the best porter Ive tasted.  Complex taste.  Nicely creamy, roasted malts, taste of coffee, chocolate and caramel.
poured from bottle black color with brownish head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Delicious porter with rich flavors.

Bottle 500 ml. Appearance: Dark brown with a medium beige head. Good lacing. Aroma: Nose is smokey with dark fruits. Slight coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. Taste: Dark fruits, chocolate and roasted malt. Slight bitterness. Smokey aftertaste. Palate is creamy. Overall: Very good porter. This beer is all about balance. Theres no particular characteristic who really stand out, but the balance is just incredible.

Bottle 500 ml. Dark brown color with a medium beige head. Aroma: coffee, roasted malt, chocolate and vanilla (?). Taste is very well balanced, mostly bitter with a little sweetness. An excellent porter that can be taken as a dessert.
Bouteille 500 ml. Brune foncée avec un collet moyen beige. Aromes: café, malt roti, chocolat et ce qui ressemble à de la vanille. Le goût est très bien balancé, principalement amère, mais avec une petite finale sucrée. Une excellente porter qui peut être prise comme dessert.
2012 - 04 - 23 500 ml Bottle. dar brown, almost black colour. medium creme head. spices and chocolat in aroma. sweet and bitter taste. dry palate

Originally reviewed Mar. 10, 2007:

a nice deep, dark brown, with a little bit of red. smells of rich, dark chocolate, and roasted malts/coffee. taste boasts a bitter coffee with hints of the chocolate. bit of a bitter aftertaste to it. good sipping beer, as it gets better as it warms. quite enjoyable.

Pours totally black with a tall frothy light brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and roatiness. Taste is also coffee with roasted malt and chocolate with some caramel notes leading to a roasty and bitter finish. I guess somewhat a standard porter taste but done very well.

Tap @ The Local Pub 
 
Clear brown color creamy beige strong and lasting  head coffee and roasted malt aromas flavors is malt and coffee dominated with moderate chocolate notes carbonation was average body was medium to light and the finish was biter with some chocolate lingering
Bottle. Dark brown, tan head. Chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, slight coffee, smells delicious basically. Taste follows nose but isnt as dimensional. Pleasantly surprised by this.

Bottle 500ml.
Pour very dark red/brown, with good beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Somewhat bitter, nice balance. Good porter.

Surprised that this is my first time rating this beer.  I think the last times had it it was on nitro and I LOVED it.  Still great on CO2 but it loses a little bit of the rich body.  Reddish brown pour in the glass with a dense cream colored head.  The head coasts the glass exceptionally well.  Coffee roast nose.  Taste is similar.  Sweet coffee, vanilla bean, and medium-dark char.  Full flavored for the low ABV.  The best porter out there?  Its definitely in the conversation.

A: Pours a very dark red body with a one-finger, mocha colored head that features decent retention and lacing.

S: Some roast, caramel, brown sugar, chocolate, and toffee. This smells amazing, to be honest.

T: Very roasty up front, featuring caramel and coffee sneaking up on the back end. I will say, the coffee finish is a little disagreeable with me, but otherwise, its fantastic tasting.

M: Nicely creamy, medium bodied, yet it features high carbonation, as well. Good combination. The finish isnt that dry, which helps keep the bitter aftertaste in check.

O: One of my favorite porters out there; its not perfect, but its easy to drink, complex, balanced, and bold all at the same time. Amazing.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2012 Pours a deep opaque ebony topped by a thick mantle of frothy brown cream. Delectable fragrances of molasses, caramel and chocolate waft above the crown. Very creamy on the palate. The taste is chock full of dark roasted barley, coffee, chocolate and a little molasses to finish sweet. Excellent porter - one of the best Ive ever had. Try it with read meat dishes or with burger/brats off the grill.

Almost black body, beige head. Nice mild roasted aroma, butter milk and lost of chocolate. But a dry hop character as well. Medium bitter flavour, dry ending. Especially good nose. This is not my favourite style but its drinkable and flavourful. At only 5,4% not an easy feat. Quality brew. (50cl bottle, reasonably priced)

Bottle (500ml, Sainsburys):
Strong, rich malts to begin with and some nice chocolate notes. Light sugar with some figs and a touch of coffee. Light alcohol towards the end but overall this is pretty well balanced.

Mahogany with a light brown and bubbly head that eventually settles to a small head a couple of millimetres tall after about two minutes. Retention is good.

Dark chocolate and figs kick things off here along with the faintest bit of coffee and alcohol. There is some rich malts and some burnt sugar.

Medium bodied and quite smooth, it is mildly carbonated but a little lighter than I was expecting although not thin at all. The taste is a rich some and with a moderately bitter finish.

Very rich with strong chocolate and roasted malts making up the majority of the taste. It was a well balanced and complex porter that I fairly enjoy and would most likely have again. For a porter it was surprisingly refreshing and went down well.

1001 Beers Blog:

Bottle from the local Mitra. Almost black brownish colour with a small dense offwhite head. Flat. Aroma full of coffee, mocca and cacao. Tastes full, bitter, somewhat sweetish, with again coffee and cacao. Reasonable long finish, with some liquorice in it. Very nice, every sip is a feast for the papils.

0,33l bottle from British Store, Budapest. Clear, deep ruby color with medium, short-life, light brown head. Sweet odor with much coffee, liqueur and spices. Intensive aroma with roasted malt, coffee, caramel and smoke. Dry, light bitter taste because of the roasted malt. Medium body with creamy textureand average carbonation. Intensive, roasted malty and coffee finish. Very good and delicious beer with intensive malty aroma. Its silky, mature and well-balanced.

I thought this was damn good, and had a ton of flavor for a low alcohol beer.  Pours dark but translucent with minimal head and lacing.  Nose is slight roast and chocolate.  Lots of flavor in the palate...chocolate, roast, hazelnutt, and a slight hopiness.  Finish is very crisp, a huge plus and rare for this sort for beer.  Super drinkable yet super flavorful.

Bottle, pours a red-tinged, dark brown body with a one-finger light brown head.  Aroma of sweet and lightly roasted malts, coffee, cocoa powder, and dough.  Taste is similar with the sweet chocolate flavors up front and the bitter cocoa and roasted malt flavors near the finish.  Smooth and creamy mouthfeel.  Long burnt malt finish.  Robust and complex yet highly drinkable.
Large heavy crown, almost black mahogany. Toasted, somewhat burnt aroma with tones of licorice. Slightly dry and a tiny bit tart.

Pours deep brown with small off white head head. Smell is malty along with coffee and roast. Taste is malty sweet, chocolate and some coffee roastiness. Finish is slightly sweet with a roast flavor aftertaste.

Aroma potente di cioccolato liquirizia e malto tostato e terra. In effetti parte benissimo al naso, e anche al palato inizialmente, con quelle note di cioccolato, caffè e liquirizia immerse in una matrice liquorosa. Poi però lascia in bocca quel qualcosa di stucchevole (che non so definire ma si avvicina a qualcosa di appiccicoso e dolciastro) e fa abbassare enormente la mia valutazione. Sopravvalutata? Per me si. Boh! sarò stato sfortunato con la bottiglia.

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark chocolate, some caramel, & coffee; Flavor of roasted/burnt malt, caramel, chocolate, coffee, and some hops; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, solid porter - but slightly overrated.

16/03/2012 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al 5th Stout&Porter Beer Festival. Nera, riflessi mogano, schiuma biancastra sporca, poco persistente. Aroma con note metalliche, non pulitissimo, malti tostati, cioccolato, una punta di luppolo. In bocca è dolciastra, non ben bilanciata, stucchevole alla lunga. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Si lascia bere, ma per me è decisamente overrated.
11.2oz bottle pours black with a thin brown head.  Aromas of liquorice chocolate nib hop resin and cream. Flavor is bitter cut with a creaminess.  Body is medium with a bitter finish.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 Chokladigare än vad jag minns från provsmakningen 120316. Godare oxå. Faktiskt smaskigare än en Guiness. Re-rate 170127. Mörkbrun med fint beige skum. Doftar lite bränt och maltig choklad. Smaken förvånansvärt fyllig, lite kavring och choklad. Eftersmaken ganska lång med toner av bränd beska.

Pours a dark coffee amber with a brown head and dotted lace.  The taste is a rich black coffee malt, set off by a soft bittering in the finish.  Overall, an excellent brew, but not the best presentation for my taste - Ive grown tired of coffee/chocolate porters, especially when the taste is clouded a little by leaving a chalky coating on the roof of the mouth.  Good, not great.

Bottle. Dark hazelnut black with nice foamy head.  Nice roasted malt nose. Flavour is wonderful. Roasted coffee beans with a little burnt smoke. Chocolate and a light bitter finish. Bitterness disperses rapidly. Great finish. A well rounded, mellow porter. Delicious.

From notes.  First reviewed 12/18/2011.  Poured from an 11.2 oz. special branded bottle into a pint glass.

Most of the beer in my glass has a mahogany or ebony color, but a good amount of the edge has a cranberry tint to it. A rocky beige head forms on top before fading to some scattered patches. No real lace to speak of, and it took a decently aggressive pour just to create any real head.

Deep bitter chocolate, burnt roasted malts, a bit of smoke, vanilla, some oak, and a touch of charred molasses give this complex aroma.

There is a touch of molasses sweetness up front, but this beer is fairly bitter all the way through. A bitter dark and charred malt brings a bit of tobacco and smoke with it, setting the tone for a bitter dark chocolate and lightly roasted coffee bitterness that persists for the rest of each sip. The finish remains bitter.

The burnt nature of the malt imparts a slightly acrid feel, and the residue left around the inside of my lips is bitter and oily. It is dry with a noticeable acidity to it as well. The carbonation is on the light side and neither is overly creamy or crisp. A medium body compared to other porters I have had.

This is not a bad beer by any stretch, but I would not choose it over any handful of solid American porters.

Aroma is subtle. Beer pours mahagony dark with a little creamy foam on the top. Taste has a nutty, wood-like bitterness and some dark chocolate tones to it. Soft carbonation, and a perfect hint of honey sweetness comes into the equation. Tall can

Draft pours a darker prown with small brown head. Tastes smells of chocolate, coffee, roasty, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, Nothing really special here seems kind of bland if you ask me bit coffee tastes soeme chocolate.I wouldnt go out of my way for it again.

honestly, a little disappointed. 
the sum of the parts is far greater than the finished article! weird
great aroma, full of chocolate and coffee. flavour is deep and complex with hints of liqorice and a touch of sweet roasted malt.
it just didnt sing in the mouth. a touch thin.
definitly better porters out there for my money.

waitrose. harrogate
Arome de chocolat noisette. Belle robe noire surmonté dune mousse moka. Goût de café corsé et de chocolat. Moyennement carbonatée. Un des meillleurs porter anglais.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Pours black colour with a foamy white head. Leaves a nice thin lacing. Really great roasted malty aroma with a lot of coffee and chocolate, mild hoppy. The same goes for the flavour, lots of coffee and choclate. It has a full flavor. Outstanding.

bottle  best before dec 12    pours black with tan head   lovely chocolate / coffee aroma . Medium to thick silky smooth body  with medium carbonation. Taste is toasted malts , dark chocolate , coffee  sweetish start blending into a long bittersweet end . A fabulous beer

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2012 (500mL can from LCBO) Poured cool into a nonic pint, it is a very dark brown with an inch of tan head. Aroma is coffee and malt with toasted cacao and a bit of anise and what I assume is Fuggles aroma. Taste is initially sweet dark and roasted malt, ashy chocolatey coffee and a moderate amount of bitter hops which combines with the ash for a dry finish. Mouthfeel is moderately thick, smooth and a little oily with medium carbonation. Maybe could benefit from nitro? Generally this is a superb porter, not overly complex but traditional and very very drinkable. Excellent value.

A good overall beer. Dark and crisp. Could sip on all night long. Good overall beer. Would love to have with a cigar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The aroma is of great bitter choclate, some malts. Poors red black with creamy head. Taste is choclate some coffee really good.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 Una cerveza con gran cuerpo, con cierto grado de complejidad, pero que a la vez es suave y cremosa, perfectamente balanceada, el lupulo es bajo; el aroma es cremoso, con notas de chocolate y malta tostada, aunque no tan tostada como en las stout; el sabor es exquisito, suave, chocolatoso, realmente delicioso; lo ideal seria maridarla con un postre de chocolate.
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2013 Pitch black color with a low brownish head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee and a hint of liquorice. Flavor is roasted malts and coffee with some hops. Nice one!!

Bottle. Aroma: Very malty, smoky, chocolate aroma with notes of vanilla and coffee. Appearance: Deep, dark brown with dark tan frothy head. Taste: Notes of chocolate, alcohol, and coffee, sweet and malty. Palate: Full bodied, fairly thick texture, soft carbonation, astringent and bitter finish. Delicious porter with a good mix of smoky and rich flavors and aromas.
Hoppsan..den var så bra som jag har hört. Så smakrik och så balanserad..Kaffe m.m. Lång eftersmak. Slutsats: Fan vad bra!

Location/Date:January 29th, 2012.
Appearance: Pours a dark brown opaque with red head.
Aroma: Aroma is of chocolate, malt, roastyness.
Taste:Roasty malt with some chocolate - nothing crazy as this is tradiational, but its done really well.
Palate:Smooth body, slick, quick aftertaste.
Summary: I can see why this is the highest rated beer from England and of the style. It simply sets the bar.

Pitchblack as former cotton ship content. Off-white head. Aromas cooked vegetables, cacao (raw beans). Palte medium thich oily, carboantion weak smooth. Aftertaste roasted malts slight dry edge of a finish. Not impressed.

Bottle at home. It pours very dark brown, with a light tan head. The nose is smoke, tar, treacle, burnt malt and some green vegetables. The taste is roasted malt, ash, charcoal, bitter chocolate, coffee, cola, treacle and plastic, with a dry-roasted finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Not bad, but not overly drinkable.
UPDATED: DEC 1, 2012 cereal, coffee, barnyard, leather, smoke, black, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, oily feel, full body, long finish. Great Porter from London

Tasted from bottle into a shaker. Poured a dark reddish brown with moussy beige foam, long-lasting with fine lace. Phenomenal aromas of rising dough, brown bread, molasses, mild English hops, fruity ale yeast esters. Flavors of rich malt sweetness, bread, toast, caramelized brown sugar, plums, toffee, coffee and cream, dark chocolate, raisins, tangy hops bitterness. Medium body, full mouthfeel, long-lasting fruity aftertaste. Delicious, a near-perfect beer.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2012 Cask at bull & castle. Looks as a porter should - deep ebony with a thick dirty brown creamy head. Delicious rich roasted slightly smokey aroma, taste of roast malt, chocolate, bitter liquorice; deliciously rich mouthfeel with a smooth and satisfying finish. Excellent stuff. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Bruhaus in Wellington, served cold. Not much aroma as served really cold. Rich dark colour with full tan head and good lacing. Aroma of sweat roasted malts. Smooth and creamy look, feel and taste. Caramel, almonds, roasted chocolatey malt taste that kinda left me feeling full after a couple.

Pours a deep opaque ebony topped by a thick mantle of frothy brown cream. Delectable fragrances of molasses, caramel and chocolate waft above the crown. Very creamy on the palate. The taste is chock full of dark roasted barley, coffee, chocolate and a little molasses to finish sweet. Excellent porter - one of the best Ive ever had. Try it with read meat dishes or with burger/brats off the grill.
How a Porter has to be. Creamy head, perfect balance of malts an bitterness, chocolate, coffee, roasted, a very friendly beer!

Draught @ BAJT on January 14. Pours deep reddish brown with  small mocha head. Smell is malty with dark bread, orange zest and weak coffee. Taste is malty sweet with cereal, chocolate and some coffee. finish is slightly sweet and slightly acidic with coffee. Very balanced, drinkable and pleasant.

Great beer. Dark brown with a thin, khaki head. Aromas of dark licorice, and chocolate. Tastes of dark chocolate, a bit of coffee, dark licorice, some dough, and smoky notes. While the taste is a bit one dimensional, it is extremely smooth and rich. Bittersweet finish, full bodied stout. Awesome.

(Flasche) Der Porter hat eine so dunkelbraune Farbe, dass man fast nicht hindurch sehen kann. Das Braun selber ist warm mit einem minimalen Rotstich. es ist klar filtriert und hat eine hellbraune, leicht cremige Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist voll und malzig mit einer starken, schlanken Röstnote. Der Körper des Geschmacks ist etwas zu schlank, leicht süßlich und weicht einer angenehmen, leicht adstringierenden Bittere, die aus dem anfangs leichten, dann sich steigernden Röstgeschmack entsteht. Im Nachgeschmack bleibt eine leichte, röstige Bittere zusammen mit einem, fast pelzigen, Mundgefühl. Die Karbonisierung ist recht stark aber gut so. Alles in allem ist es ein schweres, aber trotzdem erfrischendes Bier; sehr gelungen.

Bottle from Alko. This clear dark brown porter beer has a beige creamy head. Delicious aroma has roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. A bit sweet taste has is very chocolaty with roasted malts and coffee. This full bodied treat is very well balanced classic.

Bottle.... pours clear dark brown with a small white head..... The aroma is roasted malt with caramel and coffee..... The flavor is chocolate, roasted malts and some coffee.... a bit thin after my opinion.....

This beer is the standard for other porters to live up to. Has a good feel in the mouth and a great taste on the tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Kennyshomebrewing.blogspot.com
I always find time for this beer.  Pours a lovely dark brown with a nice creamy head.  Lovely roasted malts, hop and caramel on the nose.  Robust and bitter on the palate.  A true gentlman.

Can. Pours black with a thick and creamy latte coloured head. This is a great porter! Lots of coffee and chocolate. Light and creamy texture. Small milk sourness in the aftertaste. Superb balance. Highly drinkable.
Color oscuro, aroma a cafe, con cuerpo, mucho sabor, muy buena, excelente opcion para el final
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 This might be the avg porter (in a bottle).  I would rate founder?s porter higher when on draft, but this one is good.  Good balance - everything you?d want in a porter.

Bottle to pint glass.  Pours a dark amber ruby color with a somewhat sparse off white head.  Has a pretty good mouthfeel, and flavors of roasted malts & a faint coffee aftertaste.  Nicely done porter.
Rich coffee and chocolate aroma. Surprisingly light mouthfeel. Coffee, chocolate, roast malt, nuts, dark fruit and some hop bitterness. Long finish. Very good.

12oz pour dark brown with brownish head that lingered. Decent enough lacing for a porter. Aroma is of sweet malt and hints of coffee and chocolate. The flavor is the same sweet malt then the flavor of the roastiness comes in. Hints of coffee and chocolate are there. As it warms the roasted malts comeoutin greater detail. Very nice beer.

Pours cola-like with a thin beige head and good lacing. Chocolate and coffee malt are the initial aromas.  Dark bitter chocolate and coffee coat the mouth with medium carbonation. Its quite thin but flavoursome. Slight tart and burnt notes as the stout opens up.

Yeah its good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.  Deep medium brown color, clear, thick creamy tan head.  Malty, caramel and chocolate aroma. Full body, smooth with bitter finish.  Good porter

Bottle. Deep brown color with minimal tan head. The nose is sweet and smoky - vanilla, roasted coffee, dark malts. The taste is dry and sweet with a long semi-bitter finish. The palate is suprisingly light and a bit watery. Overall, good, but not truly elite.

Pours a very dark brown with a thin oily off-white head. Aroma is very malty, nutty, toasted caramel, chocolate. Flavor is nutty, dry, roasted malt, chocolate, earthy and bready; bittersweet chocolate and toast on the back end. Relatively thin-bodied. Very drinkable.

50 cl bottle. BBE 12.09.2012.
Originally rated on 20090215. (8+4+9+4+17)
Pours pitch black colour with a huge, foamy off-white head. Leaves a nice thin lacing. Aroma of dry mocha-like chocolate, mild coffee, ash, dark malts, wood, mild hoppy and dried fruit notes and distant hints of honey. Flavour of dry chocolate, mild vanilla notes, lightly burnt malts, some nutmeg, cacao and distant dried fruits. Full-bodied, dry and smooth palate with a bitter finish. Quite nicely crafted culmination of an english porter.
4426

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2012 Pitch dark black body with an off white head. Really great roasted malty aroma, with lots of coffee, chocolate. Smooth, sweet, roasted malty flavour with coffee and bitter chocolate. An awesome porter. (8/5/8/4/18)
Pitch dark black body with an off white head. Intense roasted malty aroma with lots of coffee, dark chocolate. Medium, nicely carbonated palate. Sweet roasted malty flavour with coffee and a dark chocolate bitterness. Excellent.

Bottle.  Black pour with a 2 inch brown head that recedes quickly.  Aroma of  baking chocolate something that is a little vinous.  Nice flavor of roasted malts and coffee. Finishes like a good highly roasted coffee.   Light body and light carbonation.

This brew is indeed what  a porter should be about.  No weird hops or off tasting flavors here--just chocolatey, coffee, toffee, and other roasted malt goodness!
I hope they never screw with this beer.  Such an original!  The only imported Porter that i have had that comes close is from Finland called Sinebrychoff.
This beer is perfect. It has a full flavor in which every sip is just as delicious as the last. I wouldnt change anything about it.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2013 A: Pitch black body. Large bubbly khaki head that vanished in an instant. Only the slightest traces of lace.

S: Milk chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and a hint of smoke.

T: Very much like the nose. Milk chocolate, and perhaps some bittersweet chocolate. Coffee and some smoky, burnt coffee.

M: Medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Lingering bitterness in the finish.

O: All around solid beer. The gold standard of English-style porters.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a dark brown but not quite opaque. Thick fluffy one finger head with decent lacing.

Smells of dark chocolate and coffee along with a little bit of dark fruit. Wonderful roasted aroma.

The taste is very chocolaty up front followed by the coffee. Dark fruit is present as well all though it is restrained. Plenty of roast with this one which leads to a pretty crisp finish. Mouthfeel is maybe a tad bit thin but still acceptable.

This beer is really the benchmark for the style and one that I will go back to again and again.

12oz bottle, best by March 3, 2012.  Served at around 50F.

Pours dark brown with a one finger light brown head that leaves a few clumps of lacing and holds a light cap.

Aroma is roasted malts, nuts, dark breads, some hints of chocolate and coffee, a bit of dark fruit and toffee.  Good strength.

Flavor mirrors the aroma with roasted malts, bread, nuts, some chocolate and coffee, dark fruit notes, some caramel and toffee, virtually no alcohol, some astringent tang on the finish.

Mouthfeel is light/medium bodied, good carbonation.

Good Porter, although Im generally more partial to robust American versions than classic English Porters, but this definitely fits its style category very well.

Two finger creamy tan head. Mild cocoa like aroma.Very dark almost opaque as I had to hold it up to a light bulb to see a deep ruby like color. Mild bitterness. Soft chocolate and coffee taste. I sense a chalk like feel to the chocolate which may be the coffee side kicking it, Has a rich soft feel.
Rich full-bodied porter, definetily one of the best Ive ever tried so far. The smell is a bit poor, but the taste is really awesome!

0.5l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. A near black body with a nice big and lasting fluffy mild espresso head. It has a dry cold-coffee aroma with tones of both chocolate, lovely sweet caramel, fudge, ice cream and even some candy and hints of licorice and brownies. Quite delicious indeed! Average so soft carbonated, medium-bodied and the mouthfeel is smooth as a babys earlobe. Great roasted flavors - not extreme in any way, just pure good old nice. Chocolate paper, wet espresso powder - all lovely blended together to a helluva porter. Really nice stuff this one, and by far the best Ive tasted from Fullers.

Apparence:  Noir dencre avec une belle mouse crémeuse.  Un mince filet persiste.  
Odeur de malt rôti sucré (un soupçon de chocolat) 
Goût :  Onctueux, crémeux.  Un peu de chocolat, un peu damertume, un peu de café, beaucoup de bonheur!  Je ne détecte pas de goût inhabituel, je doute quil y ait autre chose que malt rôti et houblon mais léquilibre est proche de la perfection.  Jadore! 
Arrière goût léger et sucré.  Pas darrière  goût acre comme pour la pêché mortel et dautres stout.

Bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a jet black body with a magnificent, long-lasting, dense creamy light beige head. Nose is licorice and leather in blended harmony, flanked by some milk chocolate and faint coffee tones. Taste is licorice, leather, coffee, dark chocolate and subtle notes of burnt caramel, all extremely well integrated. It lacks the fruitiness that Ive somehow come to associate with porters in general; Fullers London Porter is more in the stout (read: burnt/coffee tones) territory than anything else but this is solid material nevertheless. The mouthfeel is velvety and vivid, maintained by a soft carbonation and a thick mouthfeel thats never too cloying or demanding. The flavors are well integrated and I can see why this beer has such high ratings. The Mother of All Porters? Perhaps. At least one of the Great Classics of the Beer World.
I det närmaste svart, med ett rostbrunt skum. Fin arom av espresso men framför allt av choklad och honung. Besk och aningen oljig smak av mörk choklad och kavring.

Denmark, September 2009. Dark brown almost black , with a very dark medium head.. Malty and roasted malt aroma, with chocolate notes.There is a slight caramel sweet malt taste i nthe first sip, followed by strong roasty notes, lots of coffee and some chocolate. Bitter finish. nice.
This is by far the most delicious porter I have ever tasted. Sweet toasted flavors of chocolate and coffee, very well balanced by perfect hopping. Oily, delicious on the palate. I am a fan!
Pours dark brown with a nice head. Aroma sweet burnt malts, chocolate, nuts. Almost creamy texture in the mouth. Very smooth palate. Awesomely balanced. Not Bad.

Black, rocky tan head.
Strong burnt chocolate, liquorice.
Taste chocolate, coffee, burnt malts, long aftertaste.
Heavy palate.
Flavour just builds up too much for my liking, overpowering.
Jet black with thin, dark creamy head. Aroma is of roasted, charred malts. Texture is thick and oily. Flavour has bittersweet malts and cocoa.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2012 0.5 bottle. Clear liquid, very dark scarlet, almost black. Nice medium, creamy head of brown color and average retention. Roasted malt aroma, coffee comes in the background along with slight chocolate tone. Taste is slightly sweet with some bitterness which gradually pushes its way through to the finish where it dominates the flavor. Medium body and creamy texture, very soft carbonation although not completely flat. Astonishingly good beer, distinguishes itself from many mediocre porters and restored my faith in this kind.

Appearance - Black, ruby edges on glass, thick tan head which dissipated to very thin layer.
Aroma - Roasted malts, chocolate, bit of coffee, molasses, very slightly smoky, faint port wine, no hops.
Taste - Roasted malt, dark malts, chocolate, bit of coffee, touch of liquorice, touch of bitter hops, molasses, dark sugars, lightly woody, hint of earth, slightly vinous, very well blended.
Palate - soft carb, very smooth, silky, medium to thin body, coats palate well, good mouthfeel. Finish - smooth with rich dark malts, roasted malt, chocolate then a dryish woody slightly burnt toast coast takes over for a moment, then clears well
Overall - Beautifully made porter, understated and refined., quite a complex taste and palate, very easy to drink.

Dark brown ale, nice brown reflects. Almost totally opaque. Very thin head, disappears after a few minutes. Sweet chocolate taste in mouth at first gulp ; gives room to a strong coffe-ish, bitter after taste. Very good carbonation. However, feels a bit thin on the palate, compared to other porters. A good dessert ale, indeed, but it could benefit from having either a slightly sweeter taste or a thicker body (or a bit of both).
From bottle. Small tan head, gentle chocolate aroma. Medium sweety body, oily feel, long finish.

Pours a nice chocolate brown. Small tan head, Great nose on this beer smells liks roasted malts, caramel,chocolate, nuts and cereal. Nice chocolate roasted flavor out of this with a slight earthy note. Great porter one of my favorites.

Pours black with a medium tan head. Strong aroma of french roast coffee, some dark chocolate. Flavor is mostly coffee, malt, dark chocolate, toasty. Finish is a nice chocolate bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. I thoroughly enjoyed this porter.
På burk. Svart öl med beige skum. Doft av rostad malt, kaffe och lite lakrits. Samma ingredienser återkommer i smaken. En len gräddig känsla i munnen. En god porter.

Bottle. Pours a dark blackish color with red notes and a frothy beige head. Aroma is really nice of chocolate and roasted malt, burnt caramel, coffee, chocolate, liquorice and dark fruits. The flavor is again of roasted malt, grains and chocolate malts, along with dark fruits, a sugary note, liquorice, coffee, chocolate and some light sugary tones. The body is medium with a smooth silky mouth feel. Overall a classic English style Porter!

Deep brown/black pour with a thick khaki head.  Aroma of molasses, chocolate and coffee.  Molasses and roasty flavors with chocolate and coffee.  Full bitter lingering finish.  Full bodied mouthfeel with a subtle creamy carbonation.  Outstanding porter!

Pours the expected dark brown with a foamy off-white head. Aroma of roasted coffee and light floral hops. Smoky flavor with obvious notes of dark chocolate and espresso. Nothing is overwhelming as this beer is very approachable and quite sessionable. Very nicely done.

from can. Surprisingly good, I hadnt seen the rate beer score before purchasing this but i was in the mood for a porter and this is what was available. pours a suitably black colour with a smooth, thick, creamy head. malty aroma, roasted nuts, coffee, liquorice. the malts come through nicely in the flavour as does the coffee and chocolate notes. nothing out of the ordinary but what it does do it does well.

On tap at Bull McCabes.  Pours a beautiful dark brown, near black with a creamy tan head.  Nose of lovely chocolate malts, creamy and complex.  Tastes similar, with added earthy and slightly sour notes.  The classic English porter.
Pours black with Off white head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is medium sweet. Good Porter!!
It poured a dark brown color with a small head. The aroma was of roasted malt, chocolate and some coffee. The flavor was of roasted malt, coffee and bitter chocolate. Not a bad Porter.
Smooth tasting porter.  Well balanced, dark pour, hop aroma, complex in flavors.  Hints of coffee, chocolate dark malts with hops, full bodiedexcellent brew!

Bottle from Beers of the World.  Pours black as night with a quickly fading off white head.  Notes of chocolate, toffee, roast in the nose.  Very complex taste - theres a lot going on in here.  Roasty, dry chocolate, not very sweet, marshmallows, some bittering hops.  Outstanding.  This is the best porter Ive ever had.
Great aroma of coffe and chocolate, and a very dark colour, taste again is vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Overall a great tasting Porter.
On tap from Pub Italia. Pours an inky dark. Big sweet hit up front. Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, lots of depth. Big and thick in the mouth. Great beer.

Very lovely dark ruby colour, with a tanned head. Not much aroma of interest (a bit disappointing). taste is very delicious however! complex, chocolatey, deep and rich. Very well balanced, with no real carbonation, and nice mouth feel. Coffee bitterness comes through, with a lingering finish of dark fruit. A small amount of liquorice (weirdly some bovril too). Marked down because of disappointing aroma, and probably a little one dimensional for me. But this is definitely a lovely drink.

Aroma is coffee, root beer, roasted malt. Light bodied, sweet middle, dry woody finish, full spectrum of porter flavors - vanilla, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Exceptional balance and drinkability, this one is even thirst quenching and refreshing, very good.

Bottle from Csak a jó sör. Poured pretty much black, with a creamy beige foam. Caramel, honey, nuts, vanilla, dark chocolate, are the most dominant, well balanced with the right amount of hops. Fairly light body, with good carbonation. Sweet taste, with a roasted, dry finish. Smooth, easy to drink, this is a good one.

On tap at the Olde English Pub in Albany.  Pours dark brown, nearly black, with a small creamy tan head.  Aromas of cocoa, raisin, light coffee and mocha, and sweet toffee.  The flavor is creamy chocolate, latte, and mildly bitter cocoa in the finish.  Very smooth, creamy, and rich; very drinkable.  Really nice.  [850]
Bottle 50 cl. Black with a nice light brown head. Roasted malty aroma with chocolate and some dark fruits. The taste is bitter - sweet with a roasted and chocolate enidng.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2011 Exactement ce quune porter devrait être. Crémeuse avec des notes torréfiés. Tellement facile à boire. Ce nest pas la plus foncé des porter mais avec sa tête mocha onctueuse et sa couleur ambré foncé, on a une magnifique bière entre les mains. Amertume résiduelle agréable sur un fini assez sec.
Tap.  Pours a dark chocolate color with a medium head.  Very mild taste with mild carbonation.  A hint of smokiness in the flavor.  Pretty good as porters go.

clear and light in colour for its style. very carbonated and has a pillowy light tan head. Reduced aromas, from filtration i pressume, but very roasted malts and light charcoal. medium bodied brew with a creamy yet roasted note. easy drinking porter
500mL can from LCBO.  A perfect blend of roasted barley, toffee, chocolate, and coffee.  Almost definitely the best porter Ive ever had.

Can 50 cl. A black colour with a medium high, creamy, light brown head. An aroma of malt, toffee, coffee, caramel and chocolate. The taste is medium sweet. A full body, oily and creamy texture, flat carbonation and a medium long dry finish. A nice, creamy beer.
Keg. A superb pint that makes me wonder whether Samuel Smith or Fullers makes the definitive porter.  Rich, perfectly balanced making this porter neither wimpy nor overdone.

[Bottle at Thame food festival] Deep brown-black, with a loose tan head.  Chocolate dominates, with hints of coffee and roasted malt creeping in around the edges - all jolly nice.  But the greatest part is the incredibly smooth, rich, creamy mouthfeel. Beautifully made, beautifully balanced, makes you want to lie back in a comfy armchair and contentedly relax, letting out a  happy "aaaah..." as you do.  Lovely stuff that to my surprise had more flavour and was richer than I remembered the cask being.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 (Draft) Very dark beer with sweet notes of caramel malts, chocolate, and a nice touch of roast. It leaves a really pleasant aftertaste, in which caramel dominates. The palate is creamy, if a bit thin. Overall, its a soft and drinkable porter, yet it managed to impress me with the richness of its sweet notes.

(50 cl bottle opened on the occasion of my rating #200) Pours a clear, dark brown with rich toffee head and heavy lacing. A pleasant, not too demanding aroma of toasted malt with notes of licorice. Creamy on the palate, full-bodied, medium carbonation and a long, dark, bitter finish. The taste is moderately bitter. Surprisingly rich experience for the ABV. Girlfriend says: "Its nice but it lacks a bit of depth."

Its hard not to enjoy a good porter!! In fact I cant recall when I had a bad one. Probably the most enjoyable aspect of this brew was its thick and creamy texture and flavors that had me enjoying it from start to finish! This brew is so rich that one could easily forget that they were drinking a beer! While enjoying this brew my mind was racing thinking of various beef dishes that it would pair up nicely with; although it could very well stand on its own as a great dessert beer too!

Bottle- Pours a dark brown color with a good tan head that fades slowly and ample lacing. Rich aroma of roasted malts with chocolate and caramel. Trace of coffee. Smell is inviting. Roasted malt flavor with a mixture of chocolate and coffee. Nice trace of bittersweet chocolate and a dry finish. Medium body, very smooth and creamy. Excellent balance, very rich and delicious. Excellent Porter with lots of character. A good choice to compare other porters to.
Deep red/ryby brown color with small off-white head. Good oily and creamy porter.

Bottle. Pours a cola-tinged dark brown, almost black. Head is large, thick and beige and leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is roasted, chocolate, cocoa, coffee. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted, coffee. Dry finish with coffee, roasted malts and bits of ash. Palate is full.
Donkerbruin bier met lichtbruine kraag. Geur aangenaam mout met wat chocolade. Smaak niet al te intens, mout, chocolade. Lekkere porter.

Wow. Good stuff. Nose is burnt malt and hops. Taste is mild chocolate. Burnt hops and dark malts. The finish is lingering and leaves a slightly burnt taste in the mouth. Perhaps I used the word burnt a little too much. Anyway Im not really a Porter fan but this is good stuff.
Molasses and raisin add to the usual porter flavours, but didnt find it that complex or special overall. Creamy palate.
A wonderfully smooth and drinkable dark beer. Sweet roasty aromas. Flavor is velvety silk chocolate and coffee with a decent hop balance. Very quaffable. Superb.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Virginia Beach.  Pours the expected dark brown with a foamy off-white head.  Aroma of roasted coffee and light floral hops.  Smoky flavor with obvious notes of dark chocolate and espresso.  Nothing is overwhelming as this beer is very approachable and quite sessionable.  Very nicely done.

Bottle. Pours dark brown/red with small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt and coffee but also some earthy notes. Taste is bitter with a bit of sweetness. Palate is dry but smooth with medium carbonation. Finish is coffee and licorice. Excellent porter.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint. 

Appearance: Dark mahogany with a decent size head at first that leaves some nice lacing.

Aroma: Lots of roasted malts, highlighting chocolate and molasses. Some floral & spicy English hops as well.

Taste: Light roasted flavors with an emphasis on chocolate and molasses. There is also a nice layer of creaminess, almost giving the beer a cookies n cream flavor. Light spicy hops at the end.

Palate: Low carbonation with a ridiculously smooth and creamy body.

Overall: This is a very understated and elegant Porter, yet executed unbelievably well. Wow, I am really impressed.
Bottle: pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Its got a nice roasty toffee aroma with some raisins as well.  Flavors are on point with the same roasty, but sweet flavors, finishing with coffee.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2012 Body was black as night with a thin and creamy head. With earthy undertones, smelled lightly of a cappuccino with sharp coffee and chocolate notes. Tasted rich, dry and bitter of dark chocolate with a creamy mouth feel. A smooth coffee finish and dry earthy undertones provide a satisfied palate. This beer is elegant, delicious and a great after dinner drink.
10/10 i mörkhet. Luktar lite rökigt. Frisk, lite fruktig och lätt rökig i smaken med en mild rökig eftersmak.

Sweet raisin smell with a really small head.  Not entirely black in the glass, slightly brown.  Sweet rich flavor, almost too sweet at times.  Slick mouth feel that wasnt super satisfying.  I liked this, but the smell & mouth feel were drawbacks.
Fuggleshumlen tillsammans med välrostad malt skapar en välavvägt len porter med tydliga choklad och kaffetoner. Gott!

50 cl bottle @ Nurmo, BBE 14.07.2012
Aroma has goldings-like toffee, coffee and roasted malt. Flavour has toffee too with hints of chocolate. Coffee-like finish. I used to love this but now all I taste is toffee and goldings hops. Not bad still, perhaps I should try this a bit aged with lesser hops.

Bottle 500ml @ Sherlock Holmes Pub, Århus
Pours almost black with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
500 ml bottle.  Black color with a light tannish head.  Roasty chocolate porter.  Nice bitterness.

50 cl, bottled. Pours beautiful clear dark red with a tan head. Aroma: Roasted, chocolate, coffee, licorice, sal ammoniac. Taste: Medium sweet, mild bitterness (pleasant), hints of salt. Roasted flavours and licorice. Palate: Medium body, thin. Subaverage carbonation.

02-AUG-2011, bottle @home, from "Superbest".
Dark, dark brown with low beige head.
Fine coffee nose.
Roasted, sweet coffee and chocolate taste.
Very creamy with small bubbles giving less than medium carbonation. That and the sweet coffee taste makes it highly drinkable. Very smooth and nice porter.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 (Bottle 0,5l) (3.8.2011)
Strong roasty, strong coffee, bitter chocolate aroma. Dark black color. Minimal light brown head. Medium sweet, light chocolate bitterness, strong chocolate taste. Very sticky texture. Medium-full body. Long light bitter and sticky finish, also light alcohol-spicy notes. (8.3.8.4..16=3.9)
(Bottle 0,33l) (5.10.2015)
Aroma: Chocolate, dark malts, some alcohol notes.
Appearance: Dark brown color. Minimal, brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, chocolate, malty.
Palate: Sweet, long dry finish.
Overall: Good english porter. (7.3.7.3..14=3.4)

Bottle from Alko 3.8.2011. Very dark brown. Roasted smell. Thick beige head. Medium bitterness. Roasty with a faint licorice aroma. Alcohol pushes through somewhat. Full body, thick texture. Bitter finish.
