Bière brune foncée à la limite de noire de 5.4 % dalcool. Elle possède un goût sucré, léger goût de café et de chocolat. Peut-être de là son petit goût amère, mais très peu. Moyen col au versement.

Aroma is deep roasty malt goodness, coffee, some baltic notes.
Flavour deep bitterness with coffee and loads of roast. Very nice.

Bottle. Clear dark brown pour, thin tan head. Aroma of mild coffee, chocolate and roasted dark malts. Flavor is mildly spiced, some roasty malts and bitterness. Slightly sweet, great balance. Decent texure and very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2011 Poured to a 2 finger head. Dark in the center, almost red around the edges. Cannot see my hand through the glass, always a welcome sign. Full on the palate with a fair body. A lingering aftertaste. I am very pleased with this one. It lives up to its "rich, dark, complex" promise.

Pours dark brown with hints of ruby red on the edges and a fluffy tan head. Smells strongly of chocolate and coffee. Tastes like chocolate, coffee, and roastiness. Medium-full bodied with a smooth texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Fullers London Porter finishes with a roasted bitterness that leaves one longing for more.

Sötétbarna enyhén áttetsző. Elég sötét habbal. Édes étcsokis, hátul kávé.
Olajos, közepesen édes domináns gyógynövényes keserűség.
Karakteres és tartós kávés befejezés. Kevés földaroma.
Szerintem semmi kiemelkedő.
Dark-brown or almost black colour and a thin, off-white head. It has coffee in the aroma. It also has coofee in the taste and a bit of dark chocolate and cocoa.

Simply this is the style defining beer. Pours a rich inky black with a light beige head. The nose is cocoa, coffee and a touch of toffee. Taste is roasty, yet clean and bright. Medium full body but still drinkable in 100 degree heat, simply sublime.

A deep dark pour that develops a small, brown creamy head that dissipates with some lacing. Nose is fruits, roasted malts balanced with coffee and chocolate. Not too much bitterness resulting in a very balanced and drinkable brew.

A - Chocolate, coffee and caramel
A - Dark with thick creamy head
T - Light sweetness with controlled bitter...but the can gets in the way
P - Full and soft
O - Extremely good, but more of a stout

Deep clear reddish brown pour creamy beige head .... aroma is roasted, caramel and chocolate malts .... taste is roasted coffee and chocolatey with a caramel malt very good flavor and rich for a mainstream porter ..... dry roasted and lightly bitter hop in the finish .... great flavors great brew
Aroma of hard roasted, vaguely burnt, malt and licorice. Rounded creamy and smooth flavor with hints of roasted malt and chocolate. Good and easy to drink with a nice and soft bitterness!
Bottle from Alko. Originally rated on 27.9.2009. Great roasty and malty porter.

Poured a nice ruby brown color. Dark chocolate smells with sweet toffee hints.  Off white head that last. Smooth, creamy and oily beer. Very nice. Taste just like it smelled. Creamy sensation with dark chocolate, toffee, caramel and a bit of liquor. Long, a bit bitter, finish. A must to taste.Enjoy
500ml bottle. Deep brown colour, tastes of molasses with hints of chocolate and smoke. Overall, Very good.

Pours clear brown, a bit darker than coca cola with a khaki 1 finger head.  Aroma is very English and nutty with notes of chocolate, coffee, caramel, and bread.  Taste is leather, wood, chocolate and earthy hops.  Body is medium-full, creamy and finishes bone dry with mild astringence.  The body is perhaps my favorite part this beer as I did not expect it to finish so dry!  Overall, this is a world-class old world brew.  Very robust in character, this brew is still easy to put down. Fantastic.
Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a offwhite head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, coffee. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, caramel,some hops. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Poured a dark brown.  Aroma of roasted coffee, toffee.  Med/lite sweet, lite bitter.  Med bodied, creamy texture,  softer carbonation.  Nicely done porter.    Picking tastes of caramel, toffee, butterscotch, and some coffee.  Complex beer.   Smooth.

0.5 l bottle courtesy of Marko, thanks for sharing! It poured clear reddish body with medium sized brownish head. Roasted malt aroma, drier things mostly with little hop notes. Similar flavor, coffee, raisins, note of chocolate. Pretty full for the style with fine long and dry finish. A good porter indeed, but typically overrated in chain reaction, there are many tastier porters around.

deep dark brown liquid, pours a creamy foamy tanned/white head. keeps its texture. aromascape is wide; dark chocolate, coffee, dough, cereal, hay and bread, cream and vanilla, caramel, spices, a hint of smoke, roasted aromas. the taste is extremely well balanced with a soft coffee-like bitterness, deep sweetness compliments the tasty aromas. the palate finishes of the entirety with a medium full body and creamy texture. carbonation is low, works very well. one of my favourite bottled beers of all time, definitely one of, or maybe best bottled porters out there.

Deep brown with a very impressive creamy tan head. Aroma has a mild coffee bitterness intertwined with a light chocolate sweetness. Light caramel malt notes, toffee and a finishing nuttiness round out the other smells. Flavor is a very pleasant roasted bitterness that comes through early. A coffee and light dark chocolate present themselves in the middle with a smooth toasted ending. Body has a light density to it with a slight dryness to finish. Overall a great porter. Well balanced, flavorful and a low/modest nose that sets the tone perfectly for the brew. Definitely a brew I will pick up in the future.

Bottle 50 cl. Poured very dark brown in colour with creamy tan head. Lots of dark chocolate and roasted notes in aroma. Also some vanilla. Quite smooth and a bit sweet in flavour. Creamy mouthfeel. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Fine roasted notes in aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a solid black with a touch of ruby, rocky light brown head that lasted well. Aroma lacking/tame, of roasted malts and a hint of raisons. Initial taste a delicious whack of roasted malts followed by dark fruits then a long rich cocoa finish. Savoured this beer, and picked up an extra-long finish of leather (suprised me). Silky-oily on palate with a soft but noticeable carbonation. Great for nursing during a quiet winter night in while the other half is elsewhere (wouldnt want to share it). Also, gave me a semi-boner. Seduced.
Pours pitch black with a low brownish head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee beans and liquorice. Flavor is roasted malts and coffee with some hops. Good.
Bottle. Large light brown head over a clear ruby-black body. Aroma-taste of chocolate, wood, leather, drief fruits and rum. Mouthfilling, balanced with a sweet roast finish. Nice.
Dark colour with medium not so long lasting head. Rasted malt,caramel and coffe aromas. Rich taste of roasted malt, hoppy with bitter finish. Heavy bodied with oily texture

Bottle. Black/brown with a nice, light brown head. The aroma has notes of licorice, chocolate and malt. the flavour has notes of coffee, smoke and a brief hint of licorice and a nice bitterness. Its a nice, traditional porter with bite, but I wouldnt mind a bit more complexity.

50cl can. pours black with mahogany reflections, quite big head with some bubbles. aroma toasted, burnt caramel, licorice.
first taste is bitter and quite smoked, aftertaste is burnt coffee
body is quite full, milky mouthfeel but with soft carbonation. dry finish.
rich, dark and complex? yes, for a porter...

Süßlicher Malzantrunk mit deutlichem Kaffee-Touch. Ab dem Mittelteil süffiger, die Malznote wirkt nicht mehr so streng, obwohl sie in der Komplexität nicht abnimmt. Dafür wird sie wenig hopfig und etwas röstig, was zusammen mit der milden Bitterkeit nicht wirklich stimmig erscheint. Im Abgang nimmt das Bier stark ab und wird mild, fast zu mild. Denn so kommt das trockene Aroma zum Vorschein und kann sich ungehindert ausbreiten. Wenig nussig. 11/9/9/10/11/9

British Store, Budapest. Fekete szín, a tetején krémes cappuccino-habbal. Illata nagyon csábos: kávé, fekete csokoládé, pörkölt maláta és pörkölt magvak váltják egymást. Az íze először édeskés, pörkölt maláta, némi cukros kávé, fekete csoki érződik, de a füstös érzetű komló visszafogott keserűséget, illetve erős szájkiszáradást eredményez. Az egyetlen baja a túl könnyű teste, mert tény, hogy finom, kiegyensúlyozott és nagyon-nagyon jól iható porter, ám mégis nagyobb testre és ezáltal több ízre lenne szüksége, hogy igazán kiváló legyen.
nutty rich roasted and chocolately. A very light fuggle hopping. This is a very nice porter, they finally made a good beer!

Pours black with a healthy head that never completely goes away but laces nicely on the glass.  Aroma is of a dark chocolate.  Creamy thick mouthfeel with a straightforward chocolate tone.  Dry-ish finish with a dark chocolate aftertaste.  A good porter, but a bit plain for my taste.  It does the chocolate theme very well, but the complex claim on the bottle is missing.

Light brown creamy head. Dark brown colour with mahogany reflection. Aroma is malty with coffee, raisins, dark chocolate and light earthy notes. Flavor is malty too with coffee and gently chocolate tones, ending in a smooth roasty and fruity finish. Medium bodied.

Bottle 50 cl. Dark brown to black and pouring, with a medium off white head of short duration. Aroma of dark roasted malt notes of smoke, coffee and licorice. The taste follows næsen.Tør mouthfeel with a fine finish and aftertaste closure. Throughout an easily drinkable and balanced Porter

[500ml bottle, Waitrose Edinburgh] Very deep brown pour, decent white head from the bottle. Aromas of roasted chocolate malt from the start. On the palate, bitter roasted chocolate flavour with a touch of coffee bitterness. Decent smooth finish however, the roasty flavours hold up. Really good  classic  British porter [08122007]

Fine and lasting head, laces and a deep dark redbrown colour-
Dark roasted nose with dried fruit, , nice1
Fullbodied and fine length, quite heavy for a "low" alc.
Taste is lightly bitter with chockolate, smoked meat, bacon, smoke
a really fine porter.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a beautiful deep brown with a two finger width light tan head. Great retention and lacing. Aroma is light roasted coffee and raisins. Some smooth chocolate undermines the nose. Light bitter coffee come through in the taste with a nice uncer current of sultanas and bitter chocolate. Mouth feel is a little watery but drinkability is high. Solid porter, if a little too easy drinking

British Store, Budapest
Egészen sötét és mélybarna színe van, amin egy közepes méretű, bézs színű, krémes hab helyezkedik el, ami igen ragaszkodó típusnak bizonyul. Illata füstös, pörkölt magvas, csokoládés és kávés. Kissé édeskésen, gyógycukorkásan kezdődik, aztán jön egy jó adag keserédes dohányfüst, barna kenyérből készült pirítós, kávé és keserű csoki és egy szép adag komló. Közepesen testes és buborékos. Utóíze keserédes, medvecukros és száraz, sokáig tart. Nagyon finom kis porter, könnyen iható és kívánja a következőt.
Egy kis érdekesség. A címkén látható sörcipelő figura, engem nagyon emlékeztet a régi Berliner mackójára...

Tasty brew, a nice rebuttal to the new-wave American super-hopped porters.  And while we do make kick-ass porters, Im happy to drink this throwback to the classic dark beers of a couple centuries ago.   Lovely notes of bitter chocolate are at the forefront of the brew, but a dried apple and toffee undercurrent solidifies this bottles Brit origin.  The finish is semisweet, with just enough bite from the Fuggles hops to keep the beer from being cloy.    Granted, Im feeling the thrill of finally having drank a decent import after days of failure, but this porter is solid.  Looking forward to exploring more of Fullers beer.

This one is from the Peoria, Illinois International Beer Festival.  Due to lack of space when drinking, my notes wont be that great on these beers.  Very dark appearance.  Taste was OK but, the finish was burnt.  Just didnt finish well which killed it for me.  I expected more out of something rated this well.  Maybe I just got a bad bottle.

Mély barna/rubinvörös színű porter, kétujjnyi vastag, bézs színű habbal, amely vékonyan megállapodik.
Illata erőteljesen kávés ill. pörkölt.
Közepes csípősséggel kezd, és olajos simasággal terül szét a szájban.
Gazdag, földes/füstös aromája erőteljes pörkölt ill. csokoládé malátát hordoz magában, melyet fűszeres/citrusos komló kísér, íze kávés, keserű csokoládét idéző.
Torkot kiszárító, keserű befejezése kávés, medvecukros és fűszeres.
Finom.

Dark brown/blackish with ok head. Bitter chocolate aroma. Taste is very smoked/burnt with a hint of coffee. The fact that there is almost no aftertaste, makes this beer somewhat incomplete. Good porter though.
Dark brown, a bit reddish, head could be a bit bigger, sticks ok to the glass. Earthy, raisins, light bitter roasted malts at both the smell and the taste. Expected more. Smoked, chocolate.

0,5 l bottle, bought at British Store, Budapest.
Deeeepdeeep brown-ruby with a fine creamy-pillowy beige head. Caramel, molasses in the nose with fine chocolate and espresso. Smooth mouthfeel with chocolate, toffee, roasted grains, coffee and cocoa, some tobacco, molasses. Well rounded, please give me plus one of this!

Out of the bottle thanks to chpueblo22! Thanks man! This is pretty hard to come by around here, oddly enough. Pours dark brown with a thin, beige head. Aroma is roasted coffee, dark cocoa, and a slight hint of bourbon, surprisingly.  Flavor is much of the same, but not as strong as the aroma. Earthy, roasted coffee flavors mixed elegantly with dark chocolate sweetness. Low carbonation; mouthfeel is velvety and smooth though. I could honestly drink this all day. If I could find this around here all the time, this would be my go-to porter. Official verdict: This tastes exactly how I think the perfect porter should taste! Do yourself a favor and try this. You wont be sorry!
smells roasty and malty. kind of thin and not very fizzy. hints of raisins in taste but primarily a watery coffee. nice enough. might think of this as a stout though.

Bottle from Bar on Buena. Pours a transparent reddish dark brown with a small head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and some coffee. Flavour of roasted malt, coffee and bitter chocolate. Nice bit burned aftertaste with coffe and bitter chocolate.

True Porter. Awesomely balanced. Amazingly creamy. Has everything I wanted and hoped in/for a porter ( Haha such an amateur ). Nice choco notes and flavours. Excellent malts in nose and again taste.Complex. Just a nice nice brew

Dark brown with a beige head. Medium rich aroma with roasted malts, a lot of coffee and same acidity. A much richer taste with tonnes of of sweet roasted malts, coffee, peat and some acidity. Sweet yet refreshing.  Perhaps a little thin in mouthfeel but a very nice porter.

On tap at Bull McCabes, Durham (and served in an old style dimpled glass). About time I got around to rating this I suppose. Silky, oily dark brown pour, with a thin but lasting head. Soft chocolate malts and the mildest of roasts in the nose. Body is smooth and milky, with just a bit of grit and chalk. Forgot how much I enjoyed this brew, which is really balanced and savory.
Very dark brown, with a small beige head. A great tasting porter - notes of coffee and chocolate, with hints of roastiness as well. Some bitterness. Rich and complex.
Bottle at the Fiddler, nice roasted malts and chocolate, great beer.

I am not one for a porter, but this is probably the best offering of the style I have tasted, really quite good, it has a nice aroma of coco and coffee, tastes of your porter malts that are roasty and chocolate and some coffee hints in there too, very nice taste good drink

On tap. Pours a nice dark brown with a generous creamy tan head. Roasted malts, some caramel, chocolate and a bit of fruit on the nose, great mouthfeel with a good carbonation, bitter but smooth taste, very good creamy porter. Definitely prefer it on tap, would like to try it on cask or nitro.

Bottle from the London Pride store in Ljubljana, Slovenia Very dark amber-red body thats effectively black until you put it in the light. Tan head, thick, went away at a medium pace. Sweet malty nose, coffee liqueur & raisins, nice enough. Tasty and creamy, the malty taste finishes in a blend of roastiness and aromatic hopiness. Light ra Everything comes together seamlessly and is damn balanced. Not too full, like most Fullers beers Ive had, but the best executed of all of them in my opinion.

A finger thick creamy light brown head on a clear deep mahogany. Good lacing. Dades and prunes among the aromas. Sweet dades, acidity and bitterness with light roasted and toasted notes. Medium body. Syrupy texture. Medium carbonation. Well balanced.

Ce porter échappe des arômes de chocolat noir, de café, de toffee et de noix grillés. Son collet de mousse beige est consistant mais nest pas très intense. Au goût, les arômes présentes sont confirmées et lamertume du houblon est bien senti.
pick of the week thanks to Quez - beautiful porter with creamy chocolate taste - will seek out again
(Bottle)  The Stoutragious pick of the week.  This is a solid porter & great session beer.  Well roasted and malty with nice depth.  I shall challenge with a new porter next week.
This is one of the lightest (abv) beers Ive had in a while. Dark marroon color. The aroma and flavor is slightly burnt and oaky. I bit bitter too. Not a bad beer, but not my ultimate porter.

Bottle in the Shooting Star, Liverpool St. Pours beautifully. Smooth reddish black/brown with a nice off white head. Aroma interestingly for me was English hop floral first, with minerally notes and then giving way to coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Really quite complex, but drinking with a friend so didnt have time to take it all in. Taste is chocolate, coffee and quite a bit of roasted bitterness and hop bitterness. Very much an English style Porter with quite a bit of bitterness and not as smooth or as balanced as something like Founders.

Tap. British Beer Company, Westford MA. English Pint Glass. Pours a dark brown, almost black, chocolate color. Small dark tan/brown head. Malty aroma of coffee, chocolate - toasty and nutty. Caramel, coffee malt flavors, but strongest was a chocolate character. Bitter hop balanced the flavor. Chocolate malt lingers through finish. A very easy drinking smooth porter which I enjoyed very much.

Tap. Near pitch black; thinner tan head.  Milder aromas: lighty roasty and sweet, and roasted malts come through in the taste much more clearly. Slightly bittersweet chocolate.  Thinner to medium body with softer carbonation.

draft. very creamy. Carmel and chocolate with a touch
of vanilla. Bitter finish. Really really good

12oz bottle poured into a Pint, great frothy tan head, slightly smoky aroma, roasted coffee, very easy drinking. This is quite good and very easy drinking. Id like to try it fresh off a cask if I ever make it to England.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2011 Poured into a 12oz glass from tap. Aroma reminds me of Belhaven. sweet, caramel, and maybe butterscotch. Appearance is nice as most porter s are. Flavor is smokey initially, with some chocolate and coffee flavors. Overall, wow this really surprised me, and I really enjoyed it.

On tap at Streets of London west Sacramento.  Dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma is sweet and roasty with coffee and nutty notes.  Flavor is chocolate with a mild roasted finish.  Body is light and carbonation is appropriate for the style.  Overall a nice smooth porter.

Pours black with ruby highlights, large creamy tan head and lots of lacing.
Nose shows lots of chocolate, liqourice, ground coffee, nuts and caramel. Really nice!
Very similar flavours but more roasted malt. Nice coffee, cocoa and caramel characters. Finishes with a mild roasty bitterness.
Great soft carbonation, body could be a little thicker though.

500 ml can from the liquor store. Pours dark reddish-brown, not quite opaque, clear. Nice fluffy tan head. Aroma is caramel, some coffee, and a hint of alcohol, maybe a touch of vanilla? Fairly sweet up front, nice bitter finish. Feels nice in the mouth, full, creamy, very soft carbonation. Taste is caramel to start, some fruitiness, mild hop in the finish, coffee in the long aftertaste. Nice.
One of my best beers. Taste is very hard to be described. You can mybe describe it as chocolate, caramel and cream, but still there is much more ingradients to taste :)

Bottle from Van Pernis, Arnhem. What a great Porter! Pitch black pour with a thick, creamy beige head. Hints of coffee, toffee, wood, chocolate and roasted hints. Same hints in the taste. A lot of chocolate and coffee there. Roasted finish which leads to an ok aftertaste. Very tasty brew. Would love to try it again!

Can 500ml, 5,4%
Very dark brown/red with not too thin roasted foam.
Aroma with a bit of sweetness, some hops and a bit of mustyness and chocolate.
Mediumstrong taste at first with a bit of sugar and bitterness, has some really nice, roasted tones.
Medium palate.
The aftertaste is nice too, lots of bitterness and some coffee.

500 ml can from Systembolaget, Sweden. Pours a nice dark brown, almost black. Taste on the bitter side of the scale, but nicely balanced against the malts. Complex malty aroma with chocolate, coffee, burned toast, roasted malt, hints of licorice. And theres a fruity aroma here as well, like cherries and a mix of red berries. Quite dry finish with a lasting aftertaste of roasted nuts. Very nice!

Great aroma, chocolate oak, dark pour with nice head. 
I love the flavour. Bold coffee notes, full body, smooth feel. 
Best Porter Ive had.

Bottle bought at Sainsburys, Pimlico, London. A dark brown/black/ruby coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Pleasing roasty, coffee aroma. Tastes of chocolate, coffee, roasty, malty, sweet, dark fruit, quite smooth and easy drinking. Delicious.
Pours dark brown with  a small dense lightbrown head. Toffee with roasted notes and a light fruitiness in aroma. Bitter roasted coffee in flavor with a dry rather watery finish, but still ok.

on Draft, Pours a very dark reddish brown with a quick diminishing thin head. Aroma of roasted malts, light chocolate with a little coffee and hint of nuts? Taste evolves from a gentle sweetness to a light bitterness on the finish. With notes of all the above aromas. Good amount of carbonation, that give it a lively feel. Very drinkable.

0,5 bottle from the supermarket. Pours deep ruby with a small off-white head. Good malty aroma, light roasted malts and dark chocolate. Taste is full malty, nice chocolate and some roasted notes as well. Medium body. Some hops and roasted notes makes a good aftertaste. Very good beer.

From a 500ml bottle on 28/2/2011. Pours a clear dark amber. Has a lovely strong aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, chico babies, honey and a little dark fruit. This is a beautifully balanced and complex porter, with big dollops of roasted malt and dark chocolate, and some more subtle plum and raisin flavours evident. Has a reasonably thick texture in the mouth. This is a delicious porter.

bottle from Auchan Market - Luxembourg City!
The Porter in the glass is black, no light shines through. The foam is fine and creamy-brown. The smell is intensely chocolaty bitter, with a very strong malt body. The beginning part is also dominant chocolate-malty bitter, in the background peaty and earthy, with a subtle smoky taste. The aftertaste is coffee-bitter, pleasant chocolatey again. Later, the Porter seems to win more in volume, it gets more full-bodied with every sip. An insanely good beer!
very nice chocolaty aroma. tastes like what you would expect from a porter. always exactly what you want in a porter, chocolate, coffee and slight caramel malts and drinkable.
Brown in color with foamy tan head... Aroma is roasted malts and dark chocolate... Flavor is velvety creamy mouthfeel, roasted malts, milk and dark chocolate with hints of coffee... Delicious

500ml can poured into English pint glass. Pours deep dark ruby-brown, with tan head. Aroma is roasty malt, coffee, chocolate. Surprisingly creamy moutfeel, low carbonation. Taste is deep and complex, dominated by the roasted chocolate, a little sharp bitter kick at the finish. Tasty beer, perfect for this cold february afternoon.

Can. Pours dark brown with little head. Roast, chocolate and some coffee flavour. Mouthfeel is a tad bit thin but this is a great representation of what a porter should be. Taste lingers after some time. I would love to try this on tap.
Maitosuklainen, paahtunut, kahvinen ja paksu. Paikallisessa pubissa nautittuna teki ainakiin minuun vaikutuksen. Tämän kanssa tulee varmasti joskus istuttua yksikseenkin.

Very dark brown with a moderate beige head. Aroma of toffee, butterscotch, roast, raisins and spice. Taste is rich chocolate and roasted malt with a touch of chocolate bitterness. Smooth and creamy, medium-full bodied, soft carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle; Pour is Dark brown with amber highlights. Average Tan head - retains fairly well, decent lacing in this pint glass. Finally - a traditional porter. The aromas are fairly close to the ESB - you have that apple skin, toffee nose with a hint of cocoa. Sweeter than I expected ; this brew has an interesting flavor profile - smokiness was detected, chocolate, a roastiness, apples, toffee, caramel  - with a bit of a bite as well. Excellent!

500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a deep, dark reddish brown with large, creamy tan head and nice retention.  Aroma has lots of chocolate, some coffee and roasted malt and a hint of dark fruit.  Flavour is fairly chocolatey but with a more pronounced roasty, coffee note and a bit of dark fruit in the background.  Mild hops in the finish.  Nice creamy mouthfeel and a big strong body.

Clear dark red brown with a big beige head. Aroma is roasted malt and burnt. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. The finish is dry and roasted bitter. Medium bodied and very smooth. Brilliant for a 5.4 % ABV beer. 090211
Aroma of Toffee chocolate, some floral grassy hops?. taste caramelized raisins, roasted coffee, prunes, chocolate, nice spicy green hop flavour. A bit thin but a great beer.

Pours almost opaque (hints of copper color when held to light) with a nice 2 finger head that dissolves quickly lacing the glass nicely. Looks really good.

Aroma is heavy toffee, burnt coffee beans followed by an almost milk chockolate like aroma.

Moutfeel is thick, rich and creamy. Malt bitterness up front turning into nice rich chockolate flavor at the end of the sip, followed by a lingering hop balance. Once sip screams for another. Carbonation is medium to low suiting the style perfectly.

Overall a superb porter.
Probably the best English made Porter out there.  Havent had it in a while but what I remember is that its challenging but still has a really good taste.

A dark brown color with a thin khaki head. Bittersweet chocolate hits the nose with a bit of roast. Starts off with sweet malt, very full mouthfeel and finishes full of bittersweet chocolate. This has more chocolate and less coffee than most porters, but I dont see anything wrong with that! An outstanding beer that I will be looking out for.

0.5L can from Systembolaget. A dense two-finger light chocolate colored head, resting on a near-clear ruby shaded dark brown body. Big aroma of chocolate and softly roasted dark malts. Rich malt flavor. Smooth and gently sweet. More chocolate, rounded roastedness, and a pleasant touch of fresh sourness. Carefully hopped, earthy and mild spicy tones. Creamy texture. More than medium full. Long malty coffee-accented ending. Utterly complex. Balanced and elegant. A benchmark.

Bottle from Waitrose: To me this is everything a porter should be. Rich and satisfying with buckets of flavour. Lots of chocolate and malt but it never becomes too rich, perfectly balanced. The king of porters.
Bottle shared with Travlr. Highs: mild chocolate in the nose - very nice. Lows: a touch too thin for my liking but definitely within the style. Nice.

Bottle courtesy of steptin, thanks!  Deep, clear chestnut maroon, huge beig head with good retention.  Aroma of chocolate covered raisins, like you used to get at the movies.  Taste is dark cocoa, burnt espresso, prunes.  Very nice.

Pours a rich dark black opal with a nice brown head. Aroma of toasted caramel malt and roasted espresso and cacao. Tastes is toasted malts and espresso with some dark fruits and licorice notes. Palate is rich full body and smooth creamy mouth feel, with moderate carbonation. Finish is toasted caramel malt, dark plums, espresso ending with some lingering licorice and cacao. Overall a very nicely balanced and tasty porter.

Burk. Robust i utförandet, fyllig. Ett öl man kan utforska, lager för lager, och låta eftersmaken skölja över en som en svallvåg. Beskan träder fram i relief, sticker upp som en pollare att göra fast vid. Komplex i strukturen utan att bli övermäktig - något som är och alltid varit Fullers signum.
A very nice porter that I would recommend to anybody. Nice chocolately, malty, roasty taste.Well done.
Dark beer with a brown head. Smells of darkly roasted malts and coffee. Taste is a nice full flavour of chocolate, malts, and smoke. Very tasty beer.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 Bottle 500ml at the Dickens. Masterpiece. Aromas of burnt caramel, chocolate, butter, and a hint of smoke. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and long length. Palate is velvety, almost creamy, with a medium-to-full body. Dark brown, with a frothy white head.
Bloody good beer. Nice aroma, smooth, round, still strong and interesting roasted taste with chocolate and coffee.

Fantastic porter, pours a coca-cola dark, with thick tan head.
Smells of dark unsweetened chocolate and coffee.
Medium body and good carbonation make the flavour of dry dark chocolate dance on the tongue, This beer might make this style one of my favorites. Certainly to want to explore the style more.
17th May 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Rich dark porter. Bitter at first but becomes savoury. Very drinkable.
Dark brown in colour with a light coffee coloured head. Aroma is of toffee and maybe well done/burn toast. Sweet smooth taste with coffee & or chocolate. I like this very easy to drink.

Bottle from OTM. The appearance is a deep dark brown with a creamy light tan head. The aromas are a little muted. Chocolate malts and a mild roastiness are the main contributions. The flavors have a lot of caramel, malt chocolate, some anise, and a hop bitterness. Mouth is medium to full bodied and nice and creamy. A classic.

Very, very dark brown color with some ruby highlights showing through.  Tremendously thick, creamy, smooth looking tan head that stayed around for a long time and had more than sufficient lacing.  Looks very inviting in the glass.  Calm hints of coffee and "dark" chocolate.  Smells of toffee with some roastiness.  Smells sweet, almost like an Oatmeal Stout.  The taste provided subtle coffee and chocolate flavors.  The coffee seems to be roasted and it stood out only a touch more than the chocolate.  Didnt pick up the toffee as much in the taste, but I picked up a touch of nuttiness.  Like almond or something.  Very nice medium mouthfeel.  Smooth and creamy.  Easy going.  Covers the palate with a slight oiliness and leaves plenty of flavor.  Very nice.  This is a super easy drinking Porter.  Very good and inviting.  Worth a try and a great session brew.  I could see myself having this on a cold night with some friends just relaxing.  Actually, I could see myself having several of these on a cold night just relaxing!!!!

Bottle.  Pours black with a thin, light tan head.  Aroma is full of roasted malt, chocolate, a hint of coffee.  Flavor is big and round.  Lots of malt and chocolate, a little bit of fruitiness, and just enough hop presence to balance the sweetness.  Full, creamy mouthfeel.  I know this one gets even better as it warms up, but Im having a hard time holding off.  Almost tastes like dessert, but less sweet.  Damn fine beer.
Bottled in Vail, Colorado. Pours a dark brown body with a cream/brown head. Dark chocolate malts aroma. Strong chocolate flavor with dark malts. Fairly creamy.

Pours a dark brown color with a nice off white head. My parents bought me this from canada. Smells of caramel and malty goodness. Bit of chocolatey goodness mixed there. Taste is of caramel, chocolate, some brown sugar, and roasted malts. Mmm
50cl, English brewery, from Slijterij van Bergen Eindhoven, not complex dry Porter, yet easy to drink, very balanced, clear, small head, good brew

Great beer. Dark color with a thickness to it as it is poured into the glass. Heavy aroma of chocolate with some coffee. Taste is extremely smooth especially has it warms in the glass. Rather long finish that brings a little caramel flavor. Highly recommend this beer.
Bottle. Black with an Amber hue and a thin off-white head. Malt, chocolate and caramel flavour. Deep roasted caramel finish.

17.12.2010. 0,5l Can. Dark brown, almost black colour wiith tan head. Aroma is roasted dark malt. Medium body. Aroma is malty with roasted flavours that is a little sweet, dark chocolate and smooth dry bitterness. Very good porter.
Great beer. Fantastic appearance as well as aroma. Surprisingly creamy and malt. Very smooth like velvet. Loved it.

500ml bottle. Roasted malt and coffee aromas that are pleasant and complex. Dark as night with a solid and steady tan head. The flavour, like the aroma, is rich and complex and very nice. Roast malt and toffee with some bitterness. Some chocolate flavours come through in the end.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2011 Aroma is roasty chocolate, biscuit. Almost black with a hint of red. Small Tan head. Taste is rich and malty. Smooth and surprisingly creamy. Roastiness, almost a smokiness very present. Chocolate. Palate is silky smooth and it all lingers perfectly. Overall this is an exceptional beer. The best example of a "to style" Porter IMO.
chocolate, coffee, roasty, black, clear, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2011 Bottle from Beers of Europe & tap @ The Doric Arch, London. Rich sweet roasted oaty aroma with a hint of grass. Almost black colour with a tan head. Roasted malt flavour. Very smooth, goes down well.
A very clean looking and tasting porter. Malty and chocolaty. This beer gets just about everything right for the style. Doesnt smell stale even after it sits for awhile. A well constructed beer.

500 ml can. Dark brown with a reddish purple hue. Medium-sized creamy light beige head. Soft roasted aroma with a hint of banana meat. Smooth velvety texture. Fairly low carbonation level. Definitely brown malts in there, but not overwhelming only enhancing the richness of the beer. Earthy, chocolatey and notes of coffee. Bready too. Hops hide well in the background, but there is enough bitterness to balance the malts well.

Bottle. Rich dark fruit on the nose, with a touch of coffee and spice. Pours dark, dark brown with a beige head. Robust flavors of coffee and fennel on the tongue, with a rich, long-lasting finish. Clean mouthfeel. This is a good, aggressive porter.
Bottle. Nice smell, nice taste and nice body. Nice all around porter.  This is one of the best porters I have tried.
Bottle on 26/11/10. Dark beer with a white head. Burnt toffee in the nose. Chocolate taste and a malty finish. Nice.

A: Pours a dark molasses with a moderate tan head and a bit of lacing as it goes down.

S: Dark, roasted malts with some chocolate. A hint of dark molasses. No discernible hop bitterness. Bits of toffee.

T: Much like the smell, with the sweeter toffee and chocolate elements coming to the front.

M: Medium bodied with good carbonation.

D: Not nearly the best porter Ive ever had. Definitely prefer the ESB and the 1845 to this. Overall, a good English brew.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-08-2010
The aroma is malty and caramel. not much hops. the color is dark brown with a tan head. med body, sticky texture . medium sweetness of brorwn sugar, but overall very balanced .

Six pack from Sonomas in Delavan....wonderful color and aroma; huge chocolate flavor and nose....gets even better as it warms....very black for a porter / looks more like a stout...but sweeter and lighter; medium body with soft carbonation....long sweet finish....a wonderful beer!
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2010 33cL bottle.  Rich coffee and chocolate aroma.  Heavy pour.  Completely translucent.  Minimal head and almost no carbonation.  Hints of coffee and chocolate.
From 500 mL bottle.  A very nice rich roasted dark beer.  A complex set of tastes, smokey, chocolate/coffee kind of flavour.  Its damn nice basically. Another good Fullers brew.

50 cl can from Systembolaget. Pours a cream, thick, small head. Very nice lacing. Dark brown/black colour. Smells of roasted malts, bread and chocolate. Tasty is medium bitter with notes of chocolate and coffee. Very well balanced with full body and a smooth mouthfeel. Great stuff.

Dark sweet malt aromas. Dark red-brown with thick tan head. Nice rich malt flavor with roast character perfectly balanced. The chocolate malt flavor lingers in the aftertaste. Great example of the style, although I have had other traditional English porters I like better.
Nearly black pour with a brown head. Aroma is malty with dark chocolate and coffee notes. Body is surprisingly light. This beer went great with dinner. One of the best porters Ive had.

Bottle. Pours deep ruby with a small tanned head. Good malty aroma, light roasted malts and dark chocolate. Taste is full malty, nice chocolate and some roasted notes as well. Some hops in the background makes a good aftertaste. Very good beer.

Pours a deep amber brown color with a white soapy head.  Has an aroma of roasty caramel malt.  Has a sweet roasty taste with some nice velvety caramel notes on the back end.  Has a thin mouthfeel.  Decent session porter.  Missing that extra something.  Not as complex as I had hoped.

Pours a deep dark red-brown with a light head, aromas of chocolate with a hint of Port, then a big burst of juicy roast malt on the palate, with lots more chocolate, a touch of coffee, some Muscovado dark sugar, a warming alcohol bite and a balancing hoppy bitterness, and to finish, a roast bitterness and dark chocolate. Wonderful.
A black body with a creamy tan head.  Tastes of deeply-roasted malts and coffee, with a proper amount of spiciness imparted by the hops.  A nearly perfect brew for those who like darker beers.

Pours a pure black with hints of light around the edges. Head is off-white, creamy with excellent retention and good lacing. 

Nose is of whiskey, vanilla, chocolate and dates, and some earthy tones.

 The mouthful is so smooth, again with chocolate, brown sugar, crystal malt sweetness. The body feels very thick and full, almost like there are some oats in there. The finish gives some alcohol, roast and hop bitterness, medium lasting... but ultimately very clean.

There is a reason this is the standard for the style.

Bottle.Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, roasted malt and coffee.Flavor is sweet roasted caramel malt with some bitterness.Medium body ,average carbonation.Nice English porter

Can from Systembolaget.
Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head.
Aroma of chocholate, rosted malt and some vanilla.
Taste of rosted malt, chocolate and some coffe beans.

Pours a dark brown with alight khaki bubbly head. The aroma is delicately malty, lots of chocolate, some caramel, notes of cafe latté, rye bread, and a hop presence is notable. The taste is a lot of chocolate and coffee notes, caramel, some roast too, the bitter, almost sour roasted touch that you see in a lot of porters. Highly drinkable, but I need some more body in a porter.
Bière britannique de type Porter de 5.4% dalcool, peu mousseuse, bien houblonné et malté à perfection.

Bottle. Pours black with nice tan head. Aromas are roasted malt all the way - with hints of coffee and chocolate in there for good measure. This trend continues in the flavour department with roast barley, chocolate, coffee and a bit of smoke coming through. Medium bodied with a good level of carbonation. Nice bitterness that keeps the beer trim and tidy. Really, really good porter.
Bottle 500ml. Color dark red/brown with medium brown head. Aroma caramel, chocolate, roasted. Taste chocolate, coffee.

500ml can from the LCBO.  

Pours a solid black with a nice cream colored tight head that stays.  Smells strongly of chocolate, roasted notes, faint hops.  Some lacing on the glass as its drank.  Mouthfeel is medium thickness, mild carbonation, and creamy.  Tastes of chocolate and burnt coffee working very well together, the hops arent coming through too much for me other than adding the crispness at the end, but that isnt a complaint.  Amazing flavor.  Very happy I picked this can up on a whim without reading about it, what a great find.

Pours deep black with cherry red tones in light, head is small and brow leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, fidges some coffee and some smokeyness. Flavor is a mix of coffee beans, roasted malts, chocolate, fidges, madeira wine and hops. Well balanced, lean and slightly acidy on palate. Finishes with mouth filling lean but still biting dry, smokey and tart aftertaste. What a great porter, enjoyed evry drop.

500ml bottle. Pours an opaque black, with a large mid-brown head. There is an excellent smokey bacon aroma up front, which combines with coffee notes to create an alluring breakfasty scent. The smoked bacon is present to begin, but is soon overtaken by a rich coffee taste and a velvet-smooth whipped cream texture, giving the feel of a Vienna coffee. The finish is smooth and lingering. Throughout, the rich creaminess coats the mouth nicely. A delicious beer indeed, and an excellent example of a fine style. At the risk of furnishing far too much information, it went down very nicely with a warm bath and a good book.

Aroma is that of coffee and chocolate. Malt also fills the nose. First taste is bitter chocolate and coffee finish. This beer really shows well when a little warmer, allowing many complex flavors to show trough. Overall very nice porter, great dark brown/red color. Recommend at least giving this one a shot, definitely well put together.

Tryed it ou of a 500ML Can. Still working on it as I tpe this. 3 fingure moca looking creamy had that last about amin then gos 2 fingure then a min latr 1 fingure. Laces the pint glass a little. Some sips the head taste creamy moca caramel siy fluffy really nice. Some sips the head has no taste. It stats off  little watery then it gos into a bite of a rosted coffee bitter taste. Then turns into a little bite of a choclate/caramel taste on th tunge. Enough to notic. Um yeah I dunno porters well so far bu dam i like this. You could jus give me a glass of the head alone(so fucking good)3.5/5 Try one today.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2011 Can. Black with clear ruby tints and a nice smooth latte head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and roasted. Taste is rich and smooth with nice milky chocolate and coffee. Classy and tasteful and really deserves its rank. One of the best porters ive had. The can is better than the bottle though.

Can:
Nice brown foamy head on top of a dark brown to black beer.
Smell honey, darker fruits, sweets and some toasty malts.
Taste honey, hints of wine, watery, hint of oatmeal, caramel, toasty malts and grass.
Not bitter at all, soft sweet but well balanced.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Presentation: Picked this up in NY recently while on a trip for work. Surprisingly, I dont recall having seen it around my neck of the woods. Poured from an 11.2 oz brown embossed bottle into an Imperial pint glass. Label in simple, displaying the name, the breweries crest, and s mall man at the bottom carrying a tray of drinks on his head. Best before 05 APR 11.

Appearance: Pours with 1 finger of light tan head. This settles to a series of islands of foam not quite covering the surface of the beer. The beer itself is a clear mahogany with a distinct ruby tone. No sediment in the bottle.

Smell: Wow! An amazingly rich and creamy nose with strong aromas of toffee, cream, and roasted marshmallows.

Taste: Mellow semi-sweet malt upfront with a follow through of caramel toffee and coffee. Finishes with a lingering mix of roasted barley and mild hop bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Lower than average carbonation, as is appropriate for this style. Body is very good.

Drinkability: Whatever hesitancy I had after seeing how it looked following the pour were overcome by the amazing aroma. A solid, flavorful drink that I would kill to try on cask.

Dark brown pour with a beige head.  Coffee and chocolate roasty nose.  Tastes of caramel, roast, smooth chocolate on a light body.  Had this with meat pie at a British restaurant, and it matched very well.

Can from Systembolaget.

Very dark brown with a small tan head. Roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Very drinkable with a pleasant, creamy mouth feel. Good stuff!

0,5L can. Pours slightly seethru black with red hue. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, leaves, and butterscotch. Taste more on the sweet side but some of fuggles hops is noticeble and gives a light bitter aftertaste. Body is full for such revativly low alcohol beer. Somewhat creamy texture,average carbonation, long "dry in mouth"finish. Easy drinkin´.This is good beer but overrated in my opinion.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2012 Can from Systembolaget. It poured a very dark amber liquid, not quite pitch black as it looks at a glance. It also had a medium sized light brown head. Flavour of chocolate, dark malts and nuts. Semi-smooth mouthfeel. A surprisingly nice beer, well balanced and enjoyable.

50 cl can. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, nuts and oak. Taste is complex bringing notes of chocolate, coffee, toffee and roasted malts back and forth with a long aftertaste. Palate is very creamy with head being very creamish. Well done!
Can. Dark brown with a large, light brown head. Aroma: dark chocolate, roasted malts. Taste: dark chocolate, coffee, some citrus. Smooth and creamy.
My favourite beer! Rich, full bodied, strong chocolate flavour with bitter coffee finish. looks gorgeous in the glass with dark body and fluffy, long lasting caramel head. Cannot recommend enough!

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2010 Bottle. Dark translucent cola colour. Nice medium thick foamy head that disappears quickly. Carbonation is light to medium. Taste of chocolate and coffee (mocha) with licorice notes. Not very hoppy but they are there in the background. Initial mouthfeel is effervescent but smooth. Alcohol taste is stronger than most 5.4%ish brews. Delicious.

pours deep red-brown with a creamy off white head and nice lacing.  Toasted malt aroma with some wood and brown sugar.  creamy texture with pleasantly light carbonation.  Taste is rich a chocolatey with some hops coming through as well.  finish is hoppier and more bitter-sweet.

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 21.3.2009.
Pours a dark brown colour with a frothy white head. Roasted malts dominate the nose. Flavour of roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate. Kudos for the low ABV which doesnt compensate the flavour. Easy to drink and very pleasant.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 tap at pub italia, ottawa. very dark brown pour, almost black with a creamy beige head, very good retention and lacing. dark complex malts - full of chocolate, some coffee, light smoke. moderate to low carbonation, medium to full body, nice grassy and bitter coffee short to medium long finish. excellent porter!

On tap at Fullers Hock Cellar in Chiswick. Pours a deep brown with a large creamy head. Light nitrogenation creates a nice spectacle after the pour when the initial head fizzles out to reveal the dark body. Smells of rich caramel malt and chocolate with a hint of coffee and cream. Flavor is very rich! Creamy chocolate and caramel with dark roasted malts. Very smooth and creamy.
(can) very dark brown, medium brown head; aroma of roast, smoke; smooth, balanced flavour, long light bitter finish

50 cl bottle, pours deep dark with a minor head, aroma of coffee, chocolate and roasted malt, taste is predominatly chocolate with slightly roasted coffee notes, pretty smooth mouthfeel, medium body, lovely 5,4 % abv beer.

500 mL can from the LCBO, served in a snifter. Pours dark chestnut with a small, fluffy tan head. The head slowly fades to a thin remnant, but leaves a small amount of fine lace. On the nose there are aromas of coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, earth and herbal hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with dark roasted notes. Subtle hops enter towards the end. The finish is dry, moderate in length, and slightly herbal. On the palate, it is medium in body with a slightly dry texture and slight carbonation. Overall, this is a nice porter. It is appropriate to style, moderately sweet and only slightly bitter. I like the roast coffee notes. The pasteurized version tastes a little off--in particular, the hops seem stale. The cask version is likely much better. 2010-09-22
Can LCBO Pours beautiful near-black with thick tan head. Heady aroma of roast malt. Very pleasant, smooth mouth feel. Complex flavour, sweet to bitter finish. Lovely beer.

Pours medium brown with a light brown head. Head faded pretty quickly. Strong malty aroma with lots of chocolate and coffee. High bitterness on the tongue. Palate was very drinkable with a super long malty finish. Simply classic.
blahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!! how the fuck is this 100? BOOOOORING. tastes like a guinness + 1

11.2 ounce bottle.  This one pours black with the consistency of a cola.  Full 1 inch head thats nicely tan in appearance with a creamy and bubbly head.  Looks gorgeous, if its any consolation.  Deep, rich, woodsy smell with mahogony and chocolate.  Smooth, velvety mouthfeel.  Roasted malt reminds me more of a dark coffee (think Sumatra if youve ever had it) than anything else.  Nice clean bitterness in the finish.  Hop character lends a nice amount of earthy notes to the whole affair.  Overall a very enjoyable porter and a nice night cap to my Labor Day.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2016 Most excellent. Roasted flavor and rich but not too much so. Very very drinkable. Would love to try the cask version. Serving: Bottle and Tap

POurs a dark oily brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasty espresso, toasty chocolate and some earthyness.  Taste is a sweet dark chocolate to a bitterish roasty coffee finish.  Mouthfeel is extremely smooth.  Solid porter.

Small, creamy, light brown, diminishing head.

Clear body with a dark black colour, some red transparency in the light.

Burnt coffee and chocolate notes in the aroma followed with some dark sugar/caramel sweetness.

Medium body, slick and mellow.

Finishes off sweet with a slight bitterness

Great beer :)

500ml bottle.  Very dark cola brown hue with amber and ruby tinted highlights, lovely small dark beige coffee crema like creamy head, good lacing.  Nice aromas of chocolate, roasted coffee and malt, caramel, Vogels toast,  raisin, vanilla, some fresh leather.  Flavour was enjoyable and seemed well balanced sweet-bitter to me.  Looks smells and tastes great but thinner and more watery than expected which was a bit of a let down.  Overall though fairly good and paired well with chocolate self saucing pudding.

Sweet with a lot of good caramel and chocolate flavor.  This beer packs a good amount of flavor for its size.  Theres caramel, chocolate, roast and light fruitier malt touches in the aroma.  The flavor is dominated by caramel and chocolate.  Theres a bit of herbal hopping in there, maybe.  Its just a bit too sweet, ultimately.  The flavors verge on candy bar, which is meant less negatively than it reads.  I think my scores would go up with a stronger mouthfeel.  It seems a little thin, and a full creamy feel would go a long way with this beer.  I would definitely enjoy trying it from a cask.  Appearance-wise, its dark brownish-ruby with a relatively thin and dissipating beige cap.
Dark brown, nearly black. Medium-bodied. Hints of coffee and chocolate. Very enjoyable.

500mL can, pours black with a beige/tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, light coffee, vanilla and biscuit. Flavour of smooth roasted malt-somewhat burnt, vanilla, coffee, and some smokiness. Creamy mouthful with a nice burnt finish. Very good, though overrated Id say.

A very classic and traditional Porter (as should be!) Not too heavy nor sweet. This makes it very drinkable as some other porters tend to be explosive and rich on first sip but you wouldnt want to drink a second.
Bottle. Pours black with offwhite head. Nose is chocolate, fuggles and roasted malts. Taste of smooth chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts and light fuggles.

Pours in a pale coffee stream; cola colored in the glass with a mere skim of foam. Crazy, powerful rum or cognac and black walnut aromas notes of toffee, nougat, cherry. Some roasty impressions emerge later. After some time, it all just morphs into "new leather shoe." Artificial "chocolate flavoring" and lactose taste; hints of coffee and caramel. Light yet creamy and tongue-coating. Dryish finish... pleasant cocoa powder and charred toast aftertaste. Overall very restrained when compared to American porters. Just okay... still tastes artificially flavored to me.
Aroma/Malty-toasted, Appearance Head/Initial-greamy, Head/Color light brown, Body/Hue-black, Initial Flavor-bitter light, Finish Flavor-bitter light Palate/Body-medium to full very good beer

Pours a very dark brown color with a nice tan head.
Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and chocolates.
Flavors of roasted malts, coffee and chocolates, caramel and light spices.  Good carbonation, light sweetness, creamy and little smokey.  Great tasty flavors and easy to drink.

Has a nice darkish brown pour that isnt super thick, but actually more on the lighter side. The head was somewhat thick and brown with nutty malty aromas. The flavors were almost chewy with that  of roasted nuts, coffee, and malts. Definitely a enjoyable beer.

Le liquide est brun et possède des contours rouges.  Le col mousseux beige est mince.  Une fine dentelle est observée.  Les arômes sont éclatés : malt foncé aux effluves de café davantage que celui du chocolat, touche de fumée, pointe fruitée, caramel brûlé, bourbon.  Au goût, apparition de la mélasse plutôt que du caramel, du café et des houblons.  En bouche, le liquide a une tenue impeccable pour le style et sa texture est drôlement flatteuse.  La finale est explosive de grains torréfiés et de fruits foncés.  Superbe démonstration du savoir-faire anglais.  Un véritable classique.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours black with dark brown highlights.  Head is medium size beige and dissapates quickly.  Ok lacing and low carbonation.  Aroma is nice light coffee and taste is coffee and some chocolate and finishes hops.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2010 Bouteille 500 ml. 5.4%. Belle couleur brune foncée, mousse beige assez présente. Arôme de chocolat et caramel. Très goûteuse en bouche, elle est très équilibrée. Goût de chocolat et un peu de café. Arrière goût despresso et de fumée. Excellente bière.

Freestyle sampling at beerbistro in Toronto.  Tastes of chocolate roasted malt and is sweet with dark fruits.  Slightly oiley and chewy mouthfeel.  terrific i forget how much i lover a good porter until i get one.

Strong licorice aroma, some malts in there too but I cant semll past the licorice. Thick, dense head on pour, it lasts for quite a while, there must be some solid lacing but I cant see enough to tell. It looks much thinner than the flavour it imparts. After the sweetness of the malts you get a lasting roasted malt flavour. It thins out some and Im sure it has been filtered, but its pretty good tasting othrewise. I always like a thicker ale, Im sure Id have to make quite a trek to find this in a cask.
500ml bottle.  Pours near pitch black with a small head.  Aroma is licorice and roast malts.  Taste is of roasted malt.  Full mouthfeel with a strong bitter finish.
I am rating this from memory, so Ill have to touch this up later.  Very dark and deep. Rich and complex. Mmm mmm good
Bottle at gingermans with Eli.   Smokey with bacon and ash.  Delicious... Velvety and silky smooth.  Lactic and acidic, cherries and farmhouse all at once.

Bottle, London.
Bit of a shame I was blocked up in the nose for this one.
Dark brown body, persistant white head.
I get nutty malts on the nose, as well as dark chocolate and vinous fruity undertones.
Smooth, rich body, low carbonation.
Roasted flavours without too much astrigency. Very nice!

Bottled from Waitrose. Dark brown, black coffee colour, pale brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, sweetness, alcohol (brandy-like). Powerful taste complements bitterness. Slight burnt toast aftertaste (which I like).

Pours black with minimal head. Aroma is black licorice and coffee. Flavor is dark coffee and burnt toast. Mouthfeel is ridiculously thin and watery--very distracting. Some lingering burnt bitterness in the finish. Ok, but nothing more.

Pours opaque dark brown with deep ruby gleam in the favoured English pint glass. Tan-white head, vivacious and long-lasting. Initial chocolate, mocha and roasty aromas. Chewy-medium mouthfeel; moderate bitterness and nice tartness on the palate with a nice smooth creamy finish. So good. So so good for a porter..

Pours dark (not quite black though) with a very small off-white head. Nose is fairly weak, with a mix of sweet malt and roastiness dominating. The flavor, however, is quite rich, with the above flavors dominating here as well with a little light hoppiness and alcohol in the background. The sweetness remains into the finish but is never out of balance with roastiness or bitterness. A little to the oily side. Very good beer.

Draught at new Yard House with Big Al and Lisa. Absolutely classic porter. I have no idea how they turn this out in such volume but still maintain such a high level of quality. Perfect at 5.4 ABV too.
On tap / N02.  Fantastic malt. A mild yet tasty malt.  Great balance and amazing mouth feel.
Dufter af nyklippet karse :-) God og behagelig duft, lækkert brunt skum og god farve. God smag af nødder og chokolade. Lille bitterhed.

Pours a dark red brown with a thin head of light tan or off white.  Lots of lacing on this one.  A little swirl reinvigorates the head.  Aroma is of brown sugar, milky coffee, grassy or dusty hops - quite light on the nose.  Its vinous and bitter in the mouth.  Theres almost a yeasty taste to this beer, possibly bready.  Dark fruits such as dates and raisins, and definitely a hint of brandy and wood.  There is a teasing of vanilla here, but only just.  A bit thin on the palate - could do with a little more of a silken feel to match the taste.  Finish is hoppy, sour and bitter.  A good beer, but nowhere near a 100 rating.  This is a case of a reputation over substance.

Bottle. Very dark brown pour with a beige head. Roasty, toasty aromas of vanilla, chocolate, raisins, coffee, butterscotch. Flavours of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, dark fruits. Hoppy, smoky and malty.

50 cl bottle. Pours a dark ruby with a little brown head. Aroma is of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. The taste is pretty similar to the aroma, and is very malty with dark chocolate and coffee flavors. The palate is smooth with a high carbonation.

50cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is huge: roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and prunes. Taste is somehow simpler: maltiness first, with coffee and chocolate flavors. Woody notes in the finish. Not too sweet. Palate is full with medium carbonation. This beer is great, easy to drink but still complex and flavorful.

The first every porter I tried and still my favorite English style porter. Pours your standard dark brown color with tan head. I absolutely love the nose on this beer. It smells like brewing dark beers with that huge roast and chocolate maltiness. There are just enough bittering hops to prevent it from being too sweet. They start on the front of the tongue and fade to the huge roasty, chocolate malt flavors. Just a fantastic lingering finish to it.

Woowww what a beer !!! Bottle 50cl, deep black ale with nice brownish head. Smell is chocolate and malty. Aroma is deeply on black chocolate and roasted malt, some notes of smoked malt too with vinous smell. Quite dry, finish is long and bitter but with nice chocolate and spicy notes of licorice. Surprising beer, very intense with low alcohol range, nice.
Pours dark brown/black with 1 finger tan head. Smells of chocolate, milk, and malt. Smooth but thin. Taste is chocolate with some coffee and nuts.

500ml bottle. Pours a deep brown with bright amber highlights where the light hits. Fairly small head that leaves a nice little lace. Big chocolate malt nose that follows through on the palate with a hint of smoke and what I want to call cola, but thats not exactly it. A little thinner on the palate than Id expected. A classic.

Bottle.  Aroma is lots of chocolate, lots of malt including Crystal and Chocolate, roasted notes. Rich caramelly flavours and notes of toffee on the nose. Thin tan head that quickly disappears. Very deep mahogany, almost black. Taste is very bitter with a dry finish. Very gratifying. A full-bodied beer, with a good amount of carbonation on the mouthfeel. A great pint that goes down a treat!

A descent porter indeed. Not as good as when I consumed it on cask at a Fullers pub but good indeed. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a caramel body. Nutty texture reminiscent of chocolate chip coookies. A very descent porter indeed. I can quite happily consume this.

The aroma was the only disappointing thing about this beer. A mild malty/toffee but nothing else. Not surprising given it was coming out of a can. Everything else, especially the taste, is wonderful. A bitter-sweet chocolate flavour is present all the way through. What a beautifully balanced porter.

This beautiful porter poured a black colour with red wine highlights. Its head was foamy beige with bubbly lacing. The nose was majority coffee with hints of chocolat. Taste was pretty much coffee (did not find much chocolat). It got bitter in the middle and finished smooth. The mouthfeel was smooth as well, with low carbonation. Quite delicious and always good to keep a few of these in the cellar.
When held to the light it is a deep dark red with a tan head. Scent is roasted malts and some smoke. Coffee in the taste as well as licorice and malts. Good stuff.

Draft pint at Fiddlers Hearth in South Bend.  I had no idea this was a 100th percentile porter.  It struck me as very good but certainly not the best Ive had.  Anyway, this one pours a cloudy brown with some amber highlights and a small tan head.  Notes of nuts, toast, caramel and chocolate malts, and brown sugar.  Light-medium bodied, with below average carbonation and a smooth palate.  Very nice porter.
Dark Amber with small head. Aroma dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, bread. Taste slight bitter with chocolate, coffee, roasty, licorice. Body medium, text smooth, soft carb Finish with bitter tone.

The beer pours a dark brown color with a khaki head. The aroma is chocolate with some dark fruit, roasted malt, coffee and some English hops. The flavor is similar. Roasted malts with some earthy hops along with some bready malts and sweet chocolate. Not much coffee in the flavor. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
black, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, caramel, cereal, coffee, chocolate, toast, spruce, light sweetness, very bitter, salty, full body, fizzy, creamy, long finish, bitter,

Appearance:  Pours a dark reddish brown with tan swirls of soapy head.

Aroma:  Light roast, light medium coffee roast, a bit of musty dog and herbal hops.

Taste:  Sea salt topped dark chocolate brownies, mineral water and bitter spicy hops.

Mouthfeel: Thin and fizzy.

Overall:  A very enjoyable, dry porter. Super solid.

500ml can.  Pours a dark, dark brown with a beige head.  Faint aromas of molasses, coffee, and smoke.  Flavour is big on molasses / black licorice, with some coffee, and a little caramel.  Lots of coffee in the bitter finish.  Solid.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a very deep brown, only barely not black, with nice light beige bubbly foam head.  Quite the embodiment of a porter, aroma of smoked roast malt, bourbon, chocolate, baked bean, caramel.  Soft creamy mouth feel, full bodied, very tasty.  Wood-chocolate taste with smokey, roasty malt on the finish.  Just a great porter.
Bottle. Ok, this is the best porter Ive ever had. Malty, slightly fruity, toffe aroma. Deep mahogany brown color. Chocolate, vanilla, roasted nut, just a great beer.

Complex and outstanding porter!  Enjoyed out of a CAN!
Distinct notes of bourbon and oak in the nose, woody maple esters, and toffee like caramel definitely present.  Fine clarity for a dark beer, effervescent cascade throughout.
Carries similar complexities and flavor nuances that can only be found in higher gravity stouts and bourbon barrel aged dark beers.  Diacetyl is slight however it really adds to the mouthfeel.  Finishes dry and quite clean making this 5.4%abv porter very approachable.

bottle.... fantastic porter!  pours a deep brown with a 1 finger off white head...  some coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and a touch of tartness... medium body with more chocolate notes, light coffee, nuts, caramel, toffee and some dark fruit.  big roasty finish with a coffee ending...

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2010 Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma is of roasted coffee malts and some chocolate, almost smokey. The taste is very nice and is of roasted malts, coffee and has a nice dry bitterness to it as well. Somewhat thick on the palate, full bodied with light carbonation. Overall a very enjoyable brew.

Bottle.

A - Deep mahogany brown to black with ruby hues on the edge (cola colored). Good sized, thick, foamy, creamy light beige head with good retention and leaving a nice lacing.

S - A lot of coffee and roasted/burnt malt. Also a fair amount of caramel and toffee, but not a great amount of chocolate.

T - Rich roasted malt, chocolate and caramel flavors start the sip with a somewhat sweet taste with a little bitter roasted malt. This gives way to a good amount of espresso and coffee flavors along with some more profound roasted malt, giving it a bit more of a bitter taste. The finish has some more of those sweet flavors along with some vanilla, and the coffee still has some presence.

M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Pretty smooth and creamy.

D - A very drinkable beer. Good porter tastes with a nice balance of sweet and bitter. Easy to drink a number of these in one sitting. Good and easy to drink beer.

Notes: Nice drinkable porter that has a good balance of flavors. A very nice example of a porter, not an amazing beer, but a solid choice that I would gladly drink again.
Dark brown with a tan head that fades quickly. Nose is deep roast malt, bitter chocolate, light coffee, toast. Taste is the same with more roast malt. Nice, easy drinking porter.

Smells malty and roasted.  The taste is more of a good bitter black coffee with a hint of dark chocolate.  It is creamy to the palate and never overwhelming.  The aftertaste is a bit like charcoal or charred wood.  Served from a pint can.

One of the best porters Ive tasted. Pours brown red, nearly black, with a foamy tan head. Nutty malts, slight funk, and yeast in the smell. Tastes of chocolate, nuts, toasted malt, and brown sugar, with a coffee-like finish.

Dark brown pour from bottle obtained from BarZigKin.  Well balanced, hops and malt in equal parts.  Chocolate, caramel and coffee taste.  Smooth finish.  Well done.  I would definitley drink this one again.

11.2oz bottle from grape & gourmet. pours a dark, cola brown with a thick, tan head and solid lacing. aroma is excellent with rich, dark roasted malts, pumpernickel bread crusts, coffee, and chocolate pudding with hints of roasted nuts and smoke. flavor is delicious as well with huge roasted malts, bitter dark chocolate, and a bit of toffee up front with earthy hops, iced coffee, and a touch of soy coming through late. palate is medium bodied and maybe a touch thin with medium carbonation. overall, a damn tasty porter.
Smooth and refreshing. Not harsh at all. Beautiful black color with no head. Complex taste - chocolate, caramel, and roasted coffee mix.

12oz bottle.  Poured dark dark brown with very little tan head.  Great aroma filled with coffee and chocolate. Great creamy taste of the same with a woody taste also.  Just a stellar porter.  The way they should be made.
500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours dark, reddy brown in colour, decent tan head.  Aroma and taste are chocolatey, and roasted malt, tiny hint of smoke.  Very good porter, the standard!

Tap at Pound and Pence, NYC. Pours a dark brown with a firm, white head. Nose of rich, roasted malts and some coffee. Flavor is dynamic and understated. Some nice smokiness and bacon flavor. Note of chocolate and coffee bean. Body is medium and carbonation is low. A smooth, pleasant beer that makes a great sessioner.

Can from LCBO. My favorite porter, by far. Pours a dark cola brown. Wonderful coffee- like taste, perfectly balanced. Medium body, not as thin as many other porters. Great lingering finish that works so well. Excellent.

11.2 bottle pours a deep brown (ruby in the light) with a smooth cap of frothy cream-colored head.  Aroma is a fantastic blend of dark-roast coffee, chocolate malt, and sourdough bread(?).  Flavor matches, with a rodust coffee base and loads of malt pushing a smooth texture across the tongue.  The texture is just perfect, and makes this a sessionable porter...which explains why soccer hooligans exist in such great numbers in London!

On tap at The Yard House. This was great actually. Awesome roasted malt and coffee aroma. Flavors of coffee, butterscotch, toffee, brown sugar, roasted malts, smokey hints and hops of course. Very good beer. Had it immediately after an Old Rasputin, and it lived up to it easily. Great beer, get it if you have the chance.

Bottle from The Inn Beer Shop , Southport.  Poured a slightly ruby tinged brown colour with a decent enough tan head.  Aroma had traces of summer fruit, with dark chocolate and roasted malt notes. Similar themes continued on into the flavour with the addition of some slight coffee and vanilla notes.
Tasty enough stuff and definitely one of the best from Fullers but am struggling to comprehend why this rates so highly.
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate and notes of coffee.

Aroma of caramel, chocolate pudding and whipped cream. Appearance is dark brown with creamy head. Flavor matches the nose: a nice caramel malt base with chocolate flavors, very pudding-like. Palate is creamy. Solid porter.
Standard roasted, malty aroma.  Dark brown color with decent head.  Bit of a burnt flavor.   Finally something decent from fullers!
Pint at The Barking Dog. Tastes pretty solid (and sort of smoky). This is the kind of porter you can put back two at a time. A little tang left over in the finish to remind you its a porter.

500ml bottle. Pours a thick creamy head as expected. With the a body of straight coffee and desert coffee on the nose. This is all roast with some sweets just as I would have guessed. A hearty bitter on aftertaste not everyone would fancy.

One of my favorites.  Pours a very dark reddish brown with a rapidly diminishing thin head.  Aroma of roasted malts + chocolate with a little coffee and something like walnuts?  Taste evolves from a gentle sweetness to a light bitterness on the finish.  Good amount of carbonation (ie. not too much).  Very drinkable.  Maybe not the most complex beer ever, but it doesnt need to be - its just flat out good.

On draft at International Beer Garten in Lutz, FL.  Pours amber-copper with a thick, mealy off-white head.  Nose is malt, caramel, slight bitter, slight biscuit, and a slight toast/ roast.  Flavor is pretty nice for a Brit beer: roast, malt, slight sweetness: fruity, but dark like there is some chocolate present.  Biscuity all over like a good British beer should be.  Full bodied for a porter.  Very nice overall.

12 oz bottle.  Dark brown body with little head.  Smells of toffee, roasty, dates and chocolates.  Flavors of roasted malts, some chocolate/cocoa, toffee and berry(?).  Surprisingly thin body and slight mouthfeel.  Slight, dark chocolate, bitter finish.  Not as complex and "complete" as I would have thought it should be.

Serving type: 500ml can, 
Poured a dark molases like, with a 1" off white foam head. 
Tasted like very strong coffee, which is ok with me. There was also a light burnt and dark chocolate taste to it. Overall a very good beer.

Very good! Pours a nice deep rich dark amber/brown, with a thin creamy head. Has a nice subtle nutty/coffee aroma.Thick texture with a chocolate and a hint of hops taste. Well-crafted and very enjoyable.

into pint glass, pours a dark black color with a medium moka head. Nice chocolate and coffee aroma. Full bodied porter. Deep roasted malt flavor. Rich, complex flavors. lots of cocoa, chocolate, and coffee. very smooth taste. Slightly sweet. Well balanced. An incredible porter.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2011 Pours out a blackish brown, slightly see through, with a small khaki head.  Aromas of campfire smoke, chocolate, a touch of coffee, and dark malts.  Nice robust aroma.  Flavor is not as sweet as hoped for.  Silky texture with light carbonation, just a little too light.  But the flavor is great.  Lightly smoky, lots of chocolate malt, a sweet hint of milky coffee, and a noble hop bitterness towards the end that lingers along with a smoky-ish finish.  Great porter, just missing something golden.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2010 Dark brown color, small beige head; aroma of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate, hints of licorice; light-medium body, moderate carbonation - fairly smooth; flavor is roasted malty with notes of licorice, coffee and chocolate; light bitterness and sourness in the finish. The standard of the porters, and a pretty good one. Has everything that a good porter needs - only, could be even a bit more powerful in releasing them.

Black with a red tint, short head fades quickly. Aroma has mostly roasted caramel and a bit of smoke and a touch of fruits. Aftertaste is fairly short and a bit acidic, leaving a nice portery roasty aroma with a bit of bitterness.

Fullers London Porter
Great beer, looks like Bohemia Cavha an excellent beer made in México  limited edition
Vanilla, Chocolate and Coffee notes. Full body, good for the dinner.

He wears a chocolate orange coat, fitted with a fine tan hat. An organic licorice and chocolate nose perks above a smokey, salty licorice pipe hanging from its flavorful mouth. The roasty, mellow caramel character has a dry malt sense of humor as he bids farewell, leaving you humming with a burnt coffee aftertaste. This likeable old guy has been hanging around the historic Griffin Brewery since 1845 and is made by Londons last remaining traditonal family brewer.

50cl bottle: Pours dark brown with a beige head. Sweet and buttery aroma, malty (chocolate, vanilla) like a mash tun after doughing in. A bit metallic though. The flavour is nutty and roasty with sweet caramel up front, leading to a fairly dry and bitter finish. Really subtle on the hops, a touch spicy. Semi-creamy, but a little on the light side. Still very nice.

Poured from a can, the London Porter exhibited a small, creamy, off-white head that was mostly diminishing. The color was ruby-dark brown. Chocolate and roasted espresso bean in the aroma. The taste is lightly dry with a long, pleasing light bitter finish. The palate was round, smooth, and creamy with soft carbonation.  This was an enjoyable beer. I would be happy to drink it again.

Bottle. Pours deep dark brown with just a hint of red and a plentiful, aromatic and lacy head. Aroma is roasty, caramel, chocolate, and toffee. Tastes fairly sweet with a matching bitterness that sticks around for a while.

I can see how many experienced raters can overlook this gem of a beer, with many new raters rating this perhaps what some see as higher than usual.  But after having this several times in the past (its available everywhere) and having this on a Christmas Day tasting, one can see why its rated like it is.  A big chocolate/nutty aroma may seem pedestrian to some, but it was simple and elegant to me.  Flavor also has the chocolate sweetness, a nice roasted malt that didnt really show up in the aroma, and a light smokey note shows up about mid-palate.  The chocolate really stands up and grabs your attention though and its quite delicious.  I would have to say London Porter is richly deserving of its iconic standing.

can. Poured opaque brown with a hint of red. Creamy beige head. Aroma is smokey. Full creamy mouthfeel, slightly flat texture. Flavours of espresso, smoke, bitter dark chocolate. Finishes lightly bitter.
Dark.  Malty and raw.  Minimal aroma.  Finishes a bit long.  Overall, not bad but, nothing to save.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle. Pours black with modest crema head. Nose is so well integrated it seems a shame to pick out elements - but theres chocolate, coffee, peat, and light woody hops. Its rich, sweet and nutty but it still has a lightness to the palate. Elegant, balanced and refreshing.

Fullers London Porter is a dark brown ale with a cappucino colored head that leaves foam all over the glass.  It has an aroma like toffee-- but not too sweet.  It smells roasty, like chocolate, coffee and baked goods.  heres an earthy twang to it thats unambiguously English.  Its medium-light bodied and quite smooth.  he finish is ever-so-slightly chalky.  Its not that sweet on the tongue, really.  Its chocolatey and slightly bitter.  Its perfectly balanced.  Its a bit grassy and almost umami.  Very classic; very drinkable.

Spectacular beer. Colour is dark black with some red and a lot of depth. Complex throughout; with toasted malts and a tiny bit of coffee. Delicious creamy chocolate ending. This was the first porter I ever tried and it remains one of my favourites. It actually made me fall in love with the style.

Pretty much black in color with a thick light caramel colored head.  Aroma is of malts, smoke, slight soy sauce, and a slight nuttiness.  Flavor is of chocolate malts, smoke, nuttiness, and a slight aluminum taste.  Aftertaste is pretty smooth with that aluminum finish.  After a couple of sips this one gets very, very drinkable.  Great brew on a cold, blizzard filled night like tonight.

Smells like fresh baked pumpernickel with a brown sugar dusting and a bit of shoe leather in there.  Big roasted malt aroma and flavor here to be sure but it comes with a lingering bitterness that I find to be off putting in a porter.  Mouthfeel has one up on many porters due its creamy nature while not being clunky or stout like.  The finish, unfortunately, is just flat out unpleasant.
